3:45.race_name: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Dante Stakes (Group 2)
3:45.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; Overall 6.8; Home straight: Far side 6.9, Centre 7.0, Stands' side 6.9)

runners.name: Alpine Trail
runners.breeder: S A S U Ecurie Des Monceaux, J Etienne
runners.comment: Made it 3-3 with Listed win at Newmarket & could take this rise in his grade in his stride
runners.spotlight: Reportedly doesn't do much at home and isn't entered in the Derby but made debut in February and made it 3-3 (9.6f/1m2f, AW/good) in the Listed Newmarket Stakes 13 days ago; made all by 3l and this 550,000euros yearling could take today's rise in grade in his stride, for his all-conquering trainer who has won the first two English Classics of the season; player.

quotes.race: Nyetimber Newmarket Stakes (Listed Race) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Alpine Trail has done nothing wrong. Even at home, to be fair to him, he has never been an exciting horse to watch but the lads will say he is a hard horse to get past in a gallop. We could now look at something like the Lingfield Derby Trial for him. Do I think he is a Derby horse? I don't know. Like I say, he wouldn't jump out at home but you can't fault what he has done on the track. He is not currently entered in the Derby but we will step him up at Lingfield and see what materialises from there. He has done it all nicely today. He showed he stays and stepping up to a mile and a half might see more improvement again ? which he will need with what we are mooting for. He was a raw Dubawi last year who just needed a bit of time. He got it and has repaid us so far - Charlie Appleby, trainer

runners.name: Damysus
runners.breeder: Newsells Park Stud & Merry Fox Stud
runners.comment: Reappeared with close 3rd in Group 3 Classic Trial at Sandown; every chance he'll improve
runners.spotlight: 460,000gns yearling who won readily at 8-11 on debut in December (7f, AW); returned with close third of five in the Group 3 Classic Trial at Sandown (1m2f, good), where he was outpaced on the bend, and looks a type who will improve with experience; one of three for the Gosden yard; not ruled out.

runners.name: Devils Advocate
runners.comment: Soundly beaten at Epsom; likely capable of better but hard to be confident after that run
runners.spotlight: Impressive 1m2f AW win on second 2yo run; soundly beaten favourite on return in Listed Blue Riband Trial at Epsom (1m2f, good) and, while he should be capable of better, with this more conventional track and the new cheekpieces possible positives, it's hard to be confident after last time.

runners.name: Mister Rizz
runners.comment: Takes huge leap in grade but has shown promise and could have lots more to offer
runners.spotlight: Didn't race last year having had an injury, and not entered in the Derby; second to subsequent Esher Cup winner on debut at Kempton (1m, AW) last month and easily won three-runner maiden at 2-13 at Doncaster (1m2f, good) 12 days ago; takes huge leap in grade today but this 425,000gns yearling, whose dam won a Group 2, could have lots more to offer; not ruled out each-way.

stable_tour.quote: He suffered an injury and didn't run last year but he made a really pleasing debut when second at Kempton last week, beaten by a horse who had bags more experience. He'll improve a ton for that and will probably step up to 1m2f. I hope he can win a maiden and go on from there. 16-04-25

runners.name: Nightwalker
runners.comment: Maybe unsuited by Newmarket in Group 3/Listed races; the flat track may prompt improvement
runners.spotlight: Won Yarmouth maiden (7f, good to firm) last September for the now-retired Sir Michael Stoute; no threat in Group 3 and Listed races at Newmarket the next twice (1m/1m1f, good to soft), most recently on last month's stable and seasonal debut, but on each occasion he made late headway after appearing unsuited by the track, and today's flat course could prompt improvement.

runners.name: Pride Of Arras
runners.comment: Defied inexperience to power clear on sole 2yo run; absent since but an exciting prospect
runners.spotlight: Well-backed favourite when defying his inexperience to power clear on debut at Sandown (1m, good) last August; absent since, having reportedly "had an issue", and this is a vastly tougher test of his credentials, but he's an exciting prospect and it remains to be seen where his limitations lie.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Dante Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Pride Of Arras is not Westover, he's not Bluestocking. He does have a very good back pedigree but he doesn't have perhaps the profile of those when it comes to pedigree. But he has more speed than Westover did and he's a better workhorse. It's all in front of us, I hope. If he handles Epsom, which I think he will, and he handles the jamboree, which based on today I think he will, we've every right to think he's going there to be competitive. What happens after that, who knows? - Ralph Beckett, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was pretty impressive on his debut in August and then he had an issue. He's in good form now and I think he's going to go for the Dante. His owner is from Yorkshire and his work would suggest that's a good place to start. 28-04-25

runners.name: Royal Playwright
runners.comment: Some solid Group form; dam won C&D Group 1; may lack the star potential of some of these
runners.spotlight: Won on debut at Salisbury (7f, good) last July; some creditable efforts in defeat in Group/Listed races since, and denied clear run when Listed third at Newcastle (1m, AW) on reappearance; his yard won this in 2012 and 2023, and his dam won the C&D Group 1 Juddmonte International so the step up in trip could suit, but he may lack the star potential of some of these.

runners.name: Sea Scout
runners.comment: Neck win in Listed Blue Riband Trial at Epsom; likely needs another sizeable step forward
runners.spotlight: Won Lingfield maiden (1m2f, AW) last November on second start and showed an excellent attitude to follow up in Listed Blue Riband Trial at Epsom (1m2f, good) last month, prevailing by a head at 40-1; could continue to progress but likely needs another sizeable step forward to land this hot contest.

quotes.race: Betfred Blue Riband Trial (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Sea Scout is a sleeper at home - he only does enough in his work - but has a fantastic Derby pedigree and we know he's going to stay a mile and a half. We were pretty confident he would handle the track and ground and we were quietly hopeful of a promising run. We didn't expect him to be such a big outsider of the field. It would be good to get him some more experience before the Derby if he comes out of this well and the Vase at Chester or the Dante at York could come under consideration before coming back here - Simon Crisford, joint-trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: The Lion In Winter
runners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
runners.comment: Will reportedly "come forward" for this run but he's a top-class prospect; respected
runners.spotlight: Made it 2-2 in Group 3 Acomb Stakes here (7f, good to firm) last August, scoring by nearly 2l from subsequent Royal Lodge winner Wimbledon Hawkeye, with recent 2,000 Guineas winner Ruling Court in third; pedigree suggests this trip will be right up his street; stable has won this four times but not since 2010, while trainer reports he "will come forward a lot for his run in the Dante", but he's a top-class prospect who has to be respected.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Dante Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Ryan was very happy. He said The Lion In WInter jumped out and he was a bit keen and a bit fresh, but when he did get him back he relaxed very well. He said he had to come out earlier than he wanted as they were coming around him and he probably got a little bit tired because it was his first run, but he was very positive about him. Ryan said the ground probably couldn't be quick enough for him and he rides like a horse with a lot of class and a lot of speed, and we just have to decide now do we go to Epsom or does he go to a French Derby or what does he do? The long and the short of it and what is going to tell us is how he is in a week - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Acomb Stakes (Group 3) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: The Lion In Winter broke smart there and Ryan gave him a very uncomplicated, straightforward ride. They just went an even gallop but he found plenty when Ryan asked him. He looks a very nice colt so I'm delighted for everyone. We always thought he'd get further than seven. We came here with the view he'd go back [to the Curragh] for the Goffs Million and we'd get good experience by coming here. He's not short of pace but you'd imagine he'd get further than a mile and a quarter - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Juddmonte Chaldean Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: The Lion In Winter is a lovely horse and had been working lovely. He will have no problem going up in trip but he has plenty of class - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won what looked a really good Acomb Stakes on what proved to be his final run last season as he had to miss the Dewhurst. He's in good shape but took a little time to come right, so he's a little behind the others. He's very well but just carrying plenty of condition, so he probably won't make Newmarket. He might make the Irish Guineas and we'll have a look at the Dante as well. 07-04-25

runners.name: Tuscan Hills
runners.comment: 2-2 in 2yo campaign, including Listed win; ceiling of ability is yet to be identified
runners.spotlight: Won on debut at Thirsk (1m, good) last August and posted another convincing success in Listed race at Pontefract (1m, soft) in October to make it 2-2; takes on much classier opposition today but his grandam is Oaks winner Eswarah and the ceiling of his ability is yet to be identified.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Silver Tankard Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: We all thought of Tuscan Hills as a nice horse and he's done everything right at home. We wanted to start him off over a mile like we did at Thirsk and we felt that, with the way he won, we'd move him up in company. We thought he'd enjoy the ground, although the track was a bit of a concern because of the undulations. However, he did it nicely in the end and he's a nice horse to look forward to in the future. We're going to have plenty to look forward to. He's showed us he gets the mile fine, but with the way he won suggests he'll stay a bit further and that's what you want to see from a two-year-old before their three-year-old season. Hopefully, he keeps going the right way and we can have a lot of fun with him - Raphael Freire, trainer.

runners.name: Wimbledon Hawkeye
runners.comment: Kept on for a creditable fifth in 2,000 Guineas and could relish today's longer trip
runners.spotlight: Runner-up to The Lion In Winter in Group 3 Acomb here (7f, good to firm) last August then went one better in Group 2 Royal Lodge at Newmarket (1m, soft) in September; no match for top-notch milers in the Craven and 2,000 Guineas this spring but has still performed creditably and he's shaped as though this step up in trip will have a positive impact; contender.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Dante Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: It was a great run. They were two lovely colts in front of us and we've beaten the favourite. I thought we were going to win coming down the straight and he's taken his racing so well. Wimbledon Hawkeye is exciting for the future and we'll be definitely going to the Derby. We thought the ground was a little bit overwatered and Hector said it wasn't ideal. Real quick ground will suit him - James Owen, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Futurity Trophy Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: Wimbledon Hawkeye was lost in the ground. He showed his heart and how good he is in the way he battled on to finish third. James said it's a lot softer here today than it was at Newmarket. He was struggling in it but he's a lovely horse for next year. I'm thrilled to be here mixing it with the top and he's done us proud - James Owen, trainer.

quotes.race: Juddmonte Royal Lodge Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: We thought if we won today we might have a crack at the Futurity Trophy at Doncaster. Wimbledon Hawkeye has still got some more growing to do, which is why we were a bit hesitant about coming here today, but he did a nice bit of work here the other day when he walked all over a 90-rated horse, so we thought we'd swing the racket. We'll have a look at Doncaster but he's very much a next-year horse and we could have a Guineas horse on our hands. Beyond that we have some unfinished business in the Derby after Ambiente Friendly's near-miss this year - Tim Gredley, part owner.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Acomb Stakes (Group 3) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: I'd have taken that coming here, I would've been delighted if Wimbledon Hawkeye came in the first three. I know he was against horses who've had just one run and it was his third, but he's come on a lot. We can aim higher now. We'll try and find a nice spot and step him up to a mile - he's a mile and a quarter horse all over. The Gredleys know more than I do so we'll speak to them and get it right - James Owen, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won the Royal Lodge and was third in the Futurity. He took us to some nice places and basically put us on the map in Group races. He's done very well - he's gone back to the stud and Giles, who runs the stud and does a fantastic job, is really happy with him. We think he's going to stay very well, but we'll see what he does when he comes back in. He's due to come back in early January and we'll let him tell us whether we to go for the Guineas or a Derby trial. 01-01-25

3:13.race_name: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Middleton Fillies' Stakes (Group 2)
3:13.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; Overall 6.8; Home straight: Far side 6.9, Centre 7.0, Stands' side 6.9)

runners.name: Ambiente Amigo
runners.comment: Half-length win over Karmology in 1m2f Listed race at Nottingham; this demands plenty more
runners.spotlight: Her form has improved a notch this season with second in a warm handicap at Kempton (1m3f, AW) followed by half-length verdict over Karmology to win Listed race at Nottingham (1m2f, good to firm) 16 days ago; this assignment demands plenty more of her, though.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Nottinghamshire Oaks Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: This was the right race for Ambiente Amigo and it's great to pick up some more black type ? she'll be a broodmare down the line. We can have some good fun with her this season. If she's fine and hasn't lost too much weight, I wouldn't be frightened to run her again this weekend - James Owen, trainer.

quotes.race: Quinnbet Juvenile Hurdle (Go North Grey Bomber Juvenile Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Ambiente Amigo is a lovely filly and did well on the Flat. I hold her in high regard and she did it the right way while learning on the job. We'll probably go for something low key with her next time but we'll assess our options. We have a few juveniles who have won and are going down a similar route but it's a nice problem to have - James Owen, trainer.

quotes.race: Follow @attheraces On Twitter EBF Fillies' Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C & D) (Qual') (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ambiente Amigo has come on leaps and bounds and the team has done a great job in keeping her relaxed. She has some lofty entries in the autumn and I'd imagine she'll step up in class next. She was a little keen early and we didn't go overly quick, so for her to pick up and quicken like she did was quite impressive - Hector Crouch, jockey.

runners.name: Beautiful Love
runners.comment: Has a good chance on her US form, which was not reproduced at Newmarket 11 days ago
runners.spotlight: Easily best form has been in the USA, including when a close fourth at the Breeders' Cup (1m3f, firm) in November; ran creditably at Gulfstream Park (1m4f) in January before her third of five to a short-priced stablemate in Group 2 at Newmarket (1m1f, good to firm; 11-1) 11 days ago, in her first British race for 18 months; she has a good chance on US form and may be able to get closer to that this time.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Middleton Fillies' Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: William said they got racing far enough out and the rest of us sort of paid for it. Beautiful Love wants stepping up to a mile and a half but it's just finding the right race because she carries that penalty still from last year - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: Defender 130 (Conditions Race) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Beautiful Love is a very nice filly and when she ran over seven last time it was always going to be too sharp. She'll appreciate stepping up even more to a mile and a quarter and hopefully she's a filly who can keep some nice company back at home - William Buick, jockey.

runners.name: Doha
runners.comment: Needs to resume improvement but this daughter of two Arc winners may still find extra
runners.spotlight: Won handicap at Royal Ascot (1m, good to firm) last June and Listed race at Saint-Cloud (1m2f, very soft) in October; 11.6f Group 1 proved too much for her on final start; needs to resume improvement but this daughter of two Arc winners may still be able to find extra.

quotes.race: Prix Dahlia - Fonds Europeen de l'Elevage (Listed Race) (4yo+ Fillies & Mares) (Turf)
quotes.quote: This is massive and a huge pleasure for all the team, especially with Sheikh Joaan here to see her win. Treve hasn't had a whole load of luck as a broodmare up until Doha, but it's so difficult when you have a brilliant racemare and they get so few chances to breed a really good one. We're very lucky and hopefully this is just the start. She ran with credit in the Nassau Stakes and Ralph has done a great job. We'll discuss with him and Sheikh Joaan to see if she runs again this season, and it's not impossible she'll stay in training at five as she's still improving - Rupert Pritchard Gordon, Al Shaqab's representative in France.

quotes.race: Kensington Palace Stakes (Fillies' Handicap)
quotes.quote: Obviously Royal Ascot is a big deal for Sheikh Joaan and Al Shaqab. It just occurred to me that dropping Doha back to a mile in a race like this, where they go a good gallop, might just play to her strengths. Obviously she's bred to get a mile and a half well, and more, so it was a roll of the dice but it was worth doing and it worked out - Ralph Beckett, trainer.

quotes.race: At The Races App Expert Tips Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I think that's winning as your pedigree suggests you should do. Doha is exceptionally well-bred and it's important that she wins her maiden and hopefully we can go on to better things. She's not short of speed. She's quite a racy filly - she likes to get on with it - so coming back to a mile, having not looked like we saw out the mile and a quarter last time, was the obvious step. She will stay further in time, but she's probably a bit quicker than we would expect her to be. It's stepping stones towards black type, if you're not winning your maidens it's hard to take that leap. She's done that impressively and Ralph will plan where she goes next - Hector Crouch, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: She's in the Middleton at York, which is a possibility. She doesn't come to hand very quickly and there are plenty of options for her, the Pretty Polly and so on. I'd like to have another crack at a Group 1 race at some point. She's training well and is a tough sort who loves her work. 28-04-25

runners.name: Karmology
runners.comment: Proved herself last term; good 2nd in Listed race on return but just behind Ambiente Amigo
runners.spotlight: Won C&D handicap last July, followed by second in two York Listed races (1m2f/1m4f) on good to firm; resumed with a good second to Ambiente Amigo in Listed event at Nottingham 16 days ago but needs to build on that to turn the tables, let alone beat all the others in this, her first Group race.

quotes.race: Azets Handicap
quotes.quote: Karmology probably ran on ground too soft for her a couple of times and was unlucky at Chester last time. Even today she wasn't the quickest away and is still learning. I kept her honest from the bend but she hasn't had a lot of runs. For an inexperienced filly in a handicap around York, I was quite impressed - Sam James, jockey.

quotes.race: Download The Vickers.Bet App Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: She's probably still a bit green, she's still improving, but Karmology should stay a bit further I'd think - Pierre-Louis Jamin, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: William Hill Ripon Champion Bonus 2023 Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Karmology is a nice filly but a work in progress, very much a filly for next year and over a longer trip - Karl Burke, trainer.

runners.name: Nakheel
runners.comment: Won Doncaster Group 2 (good to soft) in September in first cheekpieces, suited by 14.5f
runners.spotlight: Minor honours in one Listed race over 1m2f and two at 1m4f (good to firm; one here) before improved form to win the 14.5f Group 2 Park Hill at Doncaster (good to soft) in September; that step up in trip seemed to suit her particularly well and it's also different ground today, both of which are concerns, but first-time cheekpieces also played a part and those are retained.

quotes.race: Betfred Park Hill Fillies' Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Nakheel certainly has appreciated that [cut in the ground] today. From my point of view, if she's coming back into training next year, then I wouldn't be in too much of a rush to do any more [this season] - Owen Burrows, trainer.

runners.name: Royal Dress
runners.comment: Going beyond 1m1f for first time could suit judged on her Group 3 Curragh win last July
runners.spotlight: A hood was enlisted by new yard last term and she raised her game when winning a Listed contest at Goodwood (1m, soft) in May on reappearance and five-runner Group 3 at the Curragh (1m1f, good; last to first) in July; off since a modest show in August; something to prove on good to firm but going beyond 1m1f for first time could suit judged on the Curragh performance.

quotes.race: William Hill Conqueror Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I was confident I'd won, although I got there plenty soon and Royal Dress idled a bit. She probably flew under the radar a little but she did well round here last year over a mile against some of today's runners, so it was a shrewd bit of placing by James. I think she's got more to offer, it's her first run of the year, so she can improve her way through the season - Ben Coen, jockey.

runners.name: See The Fire
runners.comment: Led briefly 1f out on return and may have needed the race; big chance if back to her best
runners.spotlight: Group 3 winner here (1m1f, good to firm) last August; beaten a neck in the Nassau at Goodwood (1m2f) the time before and also ran well in further Group 1 assignments (1m and 1m2f) on final two outings last term; not so hot on reappearance in 1m2f Group 3 at Sandown three weeks ago but she led briefly 1f out and may have needed the race; big chance if back to her best.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Middleton Fillies' Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: We've always had a very high opinion of \See The Fire and she's improved since last year. We were a little disappointed with her run at Sandown but she probably needed it as she travelled well but didn't quite get home, but that probably put her spot on for today. She's a very exciting horse. We always fancied going back for the Nassau as she was second in it last year and that's the primary objective. If that goes well we might consider coming back here in August. We made a bit of a bollocks of campaigning her last year when not stepping up in trip until it was too late. She obviously relishes this trip. She really found her feet after her Eclipse run last year and ran really well on Champions Day, having had a busy season. There's lots of look forward to - Andrew Balding, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Strensall Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: See The Fire was very good at Goodwood and deserved to win a decent race. Hopefully she'll now go on to better things. We don't need to remind people who her dam was when winning the Juddmonte, so we know she was bred for the job. She actually likes not having space, although she's not overly-big. She enjoys tracking on to the back of them like she did at Goodwood, but then when it opened up she was electric. I'd definitely say we'll be going for a Group 1 next - Oisin Murphy, rider.

quotes.race: Qatar Nassau Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies & Mares) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: It was a good run from See The Fire. I thought it was a pace collapse from two furlongs out and I felt I'd pick up Ryan, but as he taught me in the last race, he takes a bit of passing - Oisin Murphy, rider.

quotes.race: bet365 Fillies' Mile (Group 1)
quotes.quote: See The Fire travelled strongly, but she got there sooner than Oisin wanted to. She just tired late on but she is an exciting filly, and we are looking forward to next year. I think we will look towards the 1,000 Guineas with her - Andrew Balding, trainer.

quotes.race: Tiber Tiger British EBF "Newcomers'' Maiden Fillies' Stakes (For horses which have never run) (GBB)
quotes.quote: See The Fire is the best specimen we've had out of Arabian Queen so far and we came here confident as her homework had been exceptional. We'll probably stick to seven furlongs for now, but she has a big future all right - David Bowe, owner's racing manager.

runners.name: Sioux Life
runners.breeder: Allevamento Le Gi S R L Societa' Agric
runners.comment: Ended her time in Italy over 1m2f in the mud, with a victory by 4l going away in Group 2
runners.spotlight: 4-5 strike-rate in Italy last season for Endo Botti, ending on the upgrade over 1m2f in the mud with Group 3 win at San Siro and a victory by 4l going away in Group 2 at Capannelle; needs better still on this debut for new yard, in the more demanding company and on very different ground.

2:42.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; Overall 6.8; Home straight: Far side 6.9, Centre 7.0, Stands' side 6.9)

runners.name: Northern Express
runners.comment: Went close in this 12 months ago and the reapplied cheekpieces could be a plus; player
runners.spotlight: Not at his best on either run this year but he's back in cheekpieces today, in which he won the competitive International Handicap at Ascot (7f, good to firm) last June; he's just 1lb higher today and has lots of good form at York, including a close second in this 12 months ago; player.

quotes.race: Moet & Chandon International Stakes (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Northern Express has been a real good servant to everyone. Michael [Dods, trainer] and I discussed last week that he was probably getting a little bit cute in his old age, so we just popped the cheekpieces on today. He's run fourth in this race the last two years but it's typical of Michael, he's great with these sort of horses to keep them going year after year. It's massive to come down here and win - Paul Mulrennan, jockey.

quotes.race: Vickers.Bet Thirsk Hunt Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a worry when the rain came as Northern Express is a better horse on faster ground but they were going through it. Because of that I told him to ride him a bit handier today because he struggles to pick up on this ground. I thought he got there too soon but he kept going - Michael Dods, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Thoroughbred Marketing Handicap
quotes.quote: Paul (Mulrennan) gave Northern Express a super ride. He loves it here and he needs these type of races with a bend in them. That was lovely ground for him today and I was impressed with the way he picked up - Michael Dods, trainer.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Northern Express disappointed at Ascot. It may have been the straight track but he'd been wearing a hood and he didn't jump the stalls and he never looked interested. I said to Paul to drop him in and he's done it nicely. He's a fair horse - on his day he's pretty good but he can disappoint as well - Michael Dods, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Paying Extra Places Handicap
quotes.quote: We thought Northern Express needed further and I said to Paul ride him from the back, drop him out, get him to settle and ride a proper race on him and he's done it nicely. He's a nice horse - Michael Dods, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Extra Places Every Day EBF Novice Stakes (Div I)
quotes.quote: Northern Express has a good pedigree and a great temperament. He's a big horse and I got a nice pitch and he finished the race off well. He loved the juice in the ground and the further he went the better he went. I think he'll make a nice three-year-old - Paul Mulrennan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: We decided we'd keep him at 7f but he loves York so much that we ran him over a mile there twice this season and he finished second each time. Last time, when we brought him back to 7f, he won a heritage handicap at Ascot on King George day. There wasn't a decent 7f handicap at the Ebor meeting, so we decided to wait for an open handicap at Ascot in a couple of weeks. He's now rated 106 and probably deserves a chance in Listed company at some stage. He's entered in the Ayr Gold Cup, as Paul Mulrennan is keen for him to go over 6f again. He's only run once over 6f in last year's Ayr Gold Cup, when he was hampered a bit, so he might be worth another try over it. Then there's a 7f Listed race at Redcar in early October - I think he'll have an entry in that, as well as a 7f handicap at Ascot on the same day. That would be the rough plan. 28-08-24

runners.name: Cerulean Bay
runners.breeder: D Ryan, D S Ryan & R A Williams
runners.comment: Hat-trick last summer; may have needed comeback run, but has to take sizeable step forward
runners.spotlight: Completed a 7f hat-trick last summer (soft/good) and he ran well over 1m on fast ground last May; this 4yo retains potential and may have needed his comeback run 19 days ago, but has to take a sizeable step forward.

quotes.race: Best Price Guaranteed Daily At Vickers.Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: All credit to Cerulean Bay, he had it all to do from that draw,. We were drawn the widest and he's off 96 now, he's high enough but he's got the right attitude. If something comes to him, he keeps going and he likes it here. There's no stopping him at the minute, he's having a great season - Danny Tudhope, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: EBF Stallions Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Cerulean Bay was very good. This would be his minimum trip but he's a lovely horse for the future. It felt like a good race, so it's a nice performance to give away that weight - Danny Tudhope, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He had a very good season last year. On his last run in Ireland he pulled up lame, so we feel there's still room in his mark and he can go on again. Dropping him back to seven furlongs seems to have been the making of him. He's very tough round a bend, so we'll look at the good handicaps on those tracks. 14-04-25

runners.name: La Trinidad
runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late Mr O J Williams
runners.comment: Returned with fine 3rd at Thirsk but it's a long time since he won here; may be vulnerable
runners.spotlight: 8yo who looked as good as ever when reappearing with close third of 13 in the Thirsk Hunt Cup 12 days ago; could give another good account and he won two in a row here in summer 2021, but he's 0-15 at York since; has never won off a mark this high (up 2lb for last time) and may be vulnerable.

quotes.race: William Hill Summer Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: We'll have to go to York now. The ideal situation was to run well here and then go to York for the Clipper Handicap. We've won 13,000GBP for today which is great, though 77,000GBP for the Clipper would be a lot better, wouldn't it? I thought when La Trinidad came around the bend he was cruising, but I was hoping that Jonny didn't use his whip too soon. He waited and he gave him a really good ride. He used to ride him out all the time at home anyway, so he knows him well - Roger Fell, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: In Loving Memory Of Michael Wood Handicap (Woodsmith Construction Group Straight Mile Series Quali')
quotes.quote: I was waiting and didn't think it was going to happen for ten or so strides, but it opened up just in the nick of time and La Trinidad just got through. He's a decent horse. He's seven but still has a fair bit of ability and I think they all fancied him today. I hope he can keep on rocking and rolling - David Nolan, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: John Smith's Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: La Trinidad is going the right way, I've always thought he was a good horse. We won't over-race him and he could win a nice race - Roger Fell, trainer.

quotes.race: Ice Co Supporting Macmillan Handicap
quotes.quote: La Trinidad is a nice horse and he was down in class. Everyone keeps telling me we should go for the Cambridgeshire. He's definitely got a good engine and he's got a big handicap in him - Roger Fell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's talented. He can sometimes not be the easiest to ride, he can do a bit too much in his races, so he likes a good pace to aim at and to come from nearer the back than the front. He won impressively off 85 at Doncaster last year and ran competitively in better races afterwards. Last year we aimed at the Straight-Mile Series Final at Redcar at the end of the season and we'll be doing something similar again. He finished second that day to Painters Palette, who was then sold for 165,000gns at the sales. The handicapper hasn't been very kind to us. He could do with being dropped 3lb or so. He could go to Redcar on Friday. 21-06-24

runners.name: Blue For You
runners.comment: Last three wins have come over C&D; reappearance third at Haydock bodes extremely well
runners.spotlight: Kept on well for close third on last month's reappearance at Haydock (7f, good) which bodes extremely well for his prospects today, with his last three wins having come over this C&D (good/good to soft); also effective on fast ground; his usual visor returns and he's a leading contender.

quotes.race: John Smith's Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: Blue For You seems to like this track. We've tried him at Ascot a few times and it's never worked, but he's bounced back from a terrible run down there. It's horses for courses. He normally shows his best here. We'll do the same thing and go to Goodwood and then come back for the mile race here at the Ebor meeting - David O'Meara, trainer.

quotes.race: John Smith's Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: He's a very good horse who travelled really nicely. Blue For You got the openings today and at Ascot last time he boiled over before he got to the start - we were happy to draw a line through that. He does like it here and he'll come back here next month. He might do Goodwood in between as well - David O'Meara, trainer.

quotes.race: Plusvital Handicap
quotes.quote: Ble For You got a very good ride. He just found that little bit more late on. He won at Galway last year and he might go back there for a handicap - Dermot Weld, trainer.

quotes.race: Claregalwayhotel.ie Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: We hoped he'd run well but obviously others appeared to be in better form coming into the race. He had to improve from his first run but we were optimistic he'd handle the ground. It did look unlikely in the dip and he is still a big raw horse. He toughed it out well and has shown a good attitude and hopefully he'll be up to Stakes level - Kris Weld, assistant to Dermot Weld, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He'll run this month in preparation for York in May, which is his track. He's also run well at Goodwood, but we now know he doesn't like Ascot. He looks well and should have more life in him. 14-04-25

runners.name: Alzahir
runners.owner: James Paul Services To Industry Ltd

prev_owners.owner: Al Wasmiyah Stud, G Bailey, N Wrigley

runners.comment: Won two in a row earlier this spring; two losses since, which knock him down pecking order
runners.spotlight: Won two in a row earlier this spring (7f, good), following wind surgery, and he may be okay now back up to 1m; capable of better than he's shown on his two runs since, but those defeats knock him down the pecking order today.

stable_tour.quote: A half-brother to Suedois who had a couple of runs for us last year and I think he could do well. He wants fast ground over seven furlongs or an easy mile. He's had a nice break and has come back working well. 19-04-24

He was purchased at the horses in training sale for 20,000gns. He runs on December 7 at Wolverhampton in a 0-85 and with luck in running he should go close. He was unlucky last time and probably would have been a lot closer had he got out, but he's dropping in grade at Wolverhampton and I think he should win. 05-12-24

runners.name: Sisyphean
runners.comment: Impressive over C&D last July and could make a bold bid under Ryan Moore on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who won by 5l over C&D (good to soft) last July and was a close fourth at Goodwood (1m2f, good to firm) in August, losing two places close home; soft ground may not have suited here when last seen in October; lightly raced and could make a bold bid under Ryan Moore on his reappearance.

quotes.race: George Blades Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: We've always thought the world of Sisyphean and the wind op has done the trick. We came here very confident. I've no idea where he goes next - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a big horse and took a good blow when winning at Newcastle in February, when he had to do his own dirty work from the front. We've always thought an awful lot of him and still do. He's a strong traveller but I'd love to see him get a lead. I think he'll win some nice races this season. 04-04-24

runners.name: Old Cock
runners.comment: Made it 3-5 last August; hasn't kicked on since but not written off back on better ground
runners.spotlight: Made it 3-5 when winning Haydock handicap (1m, good to firm) last August; lesser performances on both runs since and was beaten a long way in the Lincoln on reappearance, but those were on good to soft going and this lightly raced 4yo may appreciate the return to better ground; not written off.

quotes.race: Oakmere Homes Hambleton Handicap
quotes.quote: The trainer f***ed up by running Old Cock in the Lincoln. He got a rush of blood early in the year and ran him too soon. He wasn't quite there and I looked at him on the Sunday morning after the race and said I'm a f***ing idiot. This has been the aim since and I'm delighted we were able to come here and run a good race. He's very talented on his day and he looked a million going round the parade ring today, I was never confident because it's York but I had a strong hope. Who knows where the ceiling will be with him? He's a big horse with plenty of scope so we'll see. We'll aim towards the Hunt Cup but I'll speak to the owners before making a final decision - Ed Bethell, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfred 'The Classic Bookmaker' Handicap (London Mile Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Old Cock is a lovely horse and always has been. The first two home were the right two and he's a big, raw horse who could be even better next year. There's a 3yo 1m handicap at York in two weeks I had in the back of my mind, but he doesn't really take his racing that well. He's a big horse and he's not great when you rush him, so we'll see how he is - Ed Bethell, trainer.

runners.name: Romieu
runners.comment: Made it 2-3 on British debut; in at deep end on handicap debut but could be up to the task
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who won the first of his two starts in France (1m, heavy) and comfortably made all on his British and stable debut in a novice at Redcar (1m, good to firm) last month; thrown in at the deep end for his handicap debut but it will be no surprise if this well-bred 4yo is up to the task.

quotes.race: racingtv.com Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Romieu is a nice horse and we think a good bit of him. He's very grand and big, but impressive too. He didn't have to beat much, but there wasn't much more he could have done. He's unexposed and it'll be interesting to see what the handicapper does with him, but we're hoping to be aiming for a nice prize at the Dante meeting next - Adrian Keatley, trainer.

runners.name: Cruyff Turn
runners.comment: Arrives in good form; won this in 2022 but a long time since he's threatened here
runners.spotlight: Won at Redcar (7f, good to firm) last month and creditable fourth in the Thirsk Hunt Cup (1m, good) 12 days ago; each-way claims if his good form continues and he won this in 2022, but it's a long time since this 8yo has posed a threat at York.

quotes.race: Host & Stay Handicap
quotes.quote: Cruyff Turn was eliminated from the Buckingham Palace Handicap at Royal Ascot so we came here as he likes the track and good ground. I hope this will give him a bit of confidence and we could aim him at the mile handicap at the Ebor meeting he won two years ago - William Easterby, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Clipper Logistics Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: We swerved races at Ascot and Goodwood as Cruyff Turn loves fast ground. He's always been a lovely horse, he's a big horse who has just taken time - Tim Easterby, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's training well and we're very happy with him. He's just as good over seven furlongs and a mile, and he likes good ground and doesn't want it too heavy. 23-04-24

runners.name: Storm Catcher
runners.comment: Seven-time AW winner but current form and the suitability of turf are the doubts
runners.spotlight: Seven-time AW winner, the latest in February 2024, and he's well handicapped on that form (has a lower turf mark); however, he's failed to get competitive on his five runs since and is 0-9 on grass; others preferred.

runners.name: Stanage
runners.comment: Lightly raced 4yo who made a really good start to his season and had an excuse last time
runners.spotlight: Can be headstrong but he was strong at the finish to win at Doncaster (7f, good) in March on his only previous run in this hood, and he was repeatedly denied a clear run when third at Newmarket next time (7f, good; back in blinkers); unbalanced when soundly beaten down to 6f at Newmarket recently and the return to 1m is well worth a go; this lightly raced, ex-Gosden 4yo still has considerable potential upside in view of his excellent pedigree.

runners.name: Dingle
runners.comment: 1m AW wins the last twice but he's 6-21 on AW as opposed to 0-14 on grass
runners.spotlight: Has won in double-figure fields over 1m on AW the last twice; has shown ability on turf in the past but he's 6-21 on AW as opposed to 0-14 on grass, and he didn't shine when tackling this surface last season.

quotes.race: Read Katie Walsh On Betway Insider Handicap
quotes.quote: Dingle goes well fresh so we were hopeful of a good run and I think the plan is to take come back here in April or the big meeting at Newcastle - Sean Levey, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's unexposed and the form of his Kempton win in September has been well advertised with the second and the fourth winning since. He could run in the 7f handicap at Newbury on Friday 16-04-21

He's a three-time winner, the most recent at Newcastle over a mile in the spring off 78. He had a good time on the all-weather over the winter/spring and we're going to focus on a similar campaign for him again. He's having a nice break and is one to keep an eye out for in the winter. 06-09-23

runners.name: Mr King
runners.comment: On a handy mark and had an excuse when a well-backed favourite in the Thirsk Hunt Cup
runners.spotlight: Now 4lb lower than when close third at Ayr (1m, good to firm) last September; unable to reproduce that form since but he was caught wide when a well-backed favourite in the Thirsk Hunt Cup 12 days ago and is not ruled out.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely horse who I bought earlier this month and he's settled in really well. He's a lovely, big, relaxed, long-striding horse who's won at a mile and run well at 1m2f and looks to have plenty of ability. Ger Lyons is a very good trainer and I don't know if there's a lot of improvement in him, but he'll give his new owner a lot of fun. He looks as though he wants good ground and a galloping track. I put him in an early-closing race at York and the Cambridgeshire could be a good long-term target. 26-07-24

runners.name: Theme Park
runners.comment: C&D winner who will be suited by the expected competitive gallop in this big field
runners.spotlight: Finished well to win over C&D (good to firm) last July and at Pontefract (1m good to firm) in September; fair third at Pontefract (1m, good) a fortnight ago on second start back and the expected competitive gallop in this big field should play to his strengths; not discounted.

runners.name: Urban Sprawl

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum

runners.comment: In fair form on turf on his last three starts but may be vulnerable in his hot handicap
runners.spotlight: Five-time turf winner who scored on AW last month; fair efforts on turf on his three starts since but may be vulnerable in his hot handicap.

quotes.race: Victoria Racing Club Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I had no idea whether I'd won or not, but Urban Sprawl is game and he's in good form. He was really gunning for the line and he was able to stick his head down where it matters. He's tough - David Probert, rider.

quotes.race: Twickenham Nursery Handicap (Jockey Club Grassroots Nursery Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Urban Sprawl probably won't go to Carlisle on Thursday. I don't know what Darley will want to do with him. He's quite exposed for one of theirs and is what he is, but is very genuine and Andrea said he could go a bit further, which could be key in getting more out of him. I don't think ground matters to him - Mark Johnston, trainer.

4:18.race_name: British Stallion Studs EBF Westow Stakes (Listed Race)
4:18.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; Overall 6.8; Home straight: Far side 6.9, Centre 7.0, Stands' side 6.9)

runners.name: Aesterius
runners.comment: Reappears carrying 5lb penalty but his Group 2 Flying Childers win reads extremely well
runners.spotlight: Reappears carrying a 5lb penalty but he was a Listed, Group 3 and Group 2 winner last season, and his defeat of Big Mojo and Magnum Force in the Flying Childers reads extremely well; strong claims.

quotes.race: Carlsberg Danish Pilsner Flying Childers Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Aesterius is a very talented horse. He won the d'Arenberg, he's come here 12 days later and backed it up. It's the same double we did with Soldier's Call. The Breeders' Cup will be his end of season target, that should really suit him. Do we have a crack at the Abbaye in the meantime? He's a course and distance winner at Longchamp and he'd get 18lb off his elders. Soldier's Call was only beaten a neck in it by Mab's Cross after winning and it's something we'll have a good discussion about - Archie Watson, trainer.

quotes.race: Prix d'Arenberg (Group 3) (2yo) (Sprint Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Aesterius bought a strong level of form into the race. Everything went smoothly and he won impressively, as I hoped he would. James was delighted with him and said it was very straightforward. He's a very talented colt. He's in the Abbaye, which we almost won with Soldier's Call as a two-year-old having won this race. We'll discuss that with the owners. The Breeders' Cup Juvenile Turf Sprint at Del Mar will be his final target of the season - Archie Watson, trainer.

quotes.race: Jaeger-Lecoultre Molecomb Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Aesterius just raced away from the winner a bit, which happens in these big fields. He didn't get to race against Big Mojo but he's run a huge race and got his head down on the line. We'd love to finish the year at Del Mar, which would suit him. I'd imagine we'll go along the lines of the Prix d'Arenberg and then the Flying Childers - Archie Watson, trainer.

quotes.race: Dragon Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Aesterius ran a huge race at Royal Ascot. Like a lot of the races there, it was a bit affected by the draw. He raced against Whistlejacket the whole way, but still ran a huge race and was beaten just over a length. This was the obvious race with half an eye on Goodwood and he's sharpened up. James was very happy but we'd have preferred something better to lead us into the race. James was trying to keep hold of him so he didn't land in front three furlongs out. I'm sure he'll improve again with a strong pace to aim at. My immediate thought is he'd travel well in a Molecomb - Archie Watson, trainer.

quotes.race: M J Church Contracting Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Aesterius is a lovely horse. He was very laid back. He's quick and has only been doing his work with older stakes sprinters. I haven't galloped him with a two-year-old. He'll only get quicker. All being well we'll look towards the Norfolk or the Windsor Castle depending on what the owners have - Archie Watson, trainer.

runners.name: Captain Kinsella
runners.breeder: R C Dollar & Hellwood Stud Farm

prev_owners.owner: Optimumracing Co Uk & Andrew P Bell

runners.comment: Denied a clear run in Sandown handicap last time but looks up against it now up in grade
runners.spotlight: Made all in two 5f AW novice races in December; fair efforts in handicaps the next twice, including when denied a clear run at Sandown most recently, but he looks up against it now up in grade.

runners.name: King Of Light
runners.comment: Returning to handicap company in his favour; more to prove on fast groundurs
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 5f as a 2yo (good and soft) and also performed with credit over C&D; 6lb higher than when scoring at Haydock on his only handicap run and this is more suitable than some of his subsequent assignments.

runners.name: Mr Lightside
runners.comment: Just behind Aesterius when close third in last season's Group 3 Molecomb; possible player
runners.spotlight: Best 2yo effort came when close third in the Group 3 Molecomb at Goodwood (5f, good to firm; Aesterius second); creditable Listed fourth behind Tropical Storm over this C&D next time; reappeared with good second at Chelmsford (6f, AW) and the return to 5f could be a plus; possible player.

runners.name: Sir Yoshi
runners.comment: Opposable on vast majority of form but not ruled out each-way in view of C&D Listed third
runners.spotlight: Opposable on the vast majority of his form, including both runs this year; however, his standout performance came on his sole visit to York, when a Listed third of 16 behind Tropical Storm over C&D (good to firm) last August; not ruled out each-way now back here.

quotes.race: Tipperary (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Sir Yoshi wants quicker ground than that. He got a bit intimidated last day and I wanted to get one more run into him before Ascot. He's tough and we don't really know how good he is. He'll go for the Windsor Castle now - David Marnane, trainer

runners.name: Treasure Isle
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
runners.comment: Non-runner
runners.spotlight: Non-runner.

quotes.race: Qatar Racing And Equestrian Club Irish EBF Juvenile Sprint Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Treasure Isle is a fast horse, we learned that last time. It's unusual for a two-year-old to put up such a fast time here. The Flying Childers is the race for him - Aidan O'Brien, trainer

quotes.race: Coolmore Stud Calyx Race
quotes.quote: Treasure Isle was still a bit green and he might improve for another run. We hope he'll be an Ascot horse and he has loads of speed - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was a Listed winner over five furlongs last season. He's a very fast horse and is keen, so he might not stay that far, but we'll see. He's in good shape and nearly ready to start. 07-04-25

runners.name: Tropical Storm
runners.breeder: Hellwood Stud Farm & R C Dollar
runners.comment: C&D Listed winner last August and may have needed recent reappearance; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in Group 2 Norfolk at Royal Ascot and won Listed race over this C&D (good to firm) last August; fair fourth to Aesterius in the Group 2 Flying Childers next time and 5lb better off with the winner today; may have needed recent reappearance run at Newmarket and he's one to consider.

quotes.race: Julia Graves Roses Stakes (Listed Race) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Tropical Storm was super. He was a bit out of control at Goodwood but not here and he was fantastic. He got a bit idle in front but when pulling up he took hold of the bit again - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

quotes.race: Norfolk Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: I have a lot of belief in Tropical Storm. I said before the race that he's probably the best maiden in the country, and that was a super run. Hopefully he can win at this level. He has size, and a big future - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

runners.name: Star Of Mehmas
runners.comment: 2yo Listed winner; reappeared with very creditable Listed 3rd; respected under 3lb penalty
runners.spotlight: Improved with each 2yo run and made it 3-4 with Listed win at Ayr (5f, good) last September; very creditable third on reappearance in Listed fillies' race at Chelmsford (6f, AW) a fortnight ago, when she had a wide trip, and she's respected under a 3lb penalty.

quotes.race: British EBF Stallions Harry Rosebery Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Star Of Mehmas broke nicely and went through the gears well. She's very straightforward and she was tough when I asked her to pick up. Mr Hughes said to have her in the first couple and see how she goes, she has a good cruising speed - Billy Loughnane, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: She's a filly on the up and will make a nice three-year-old as she's got a bit of size. 18-09-24

runners.name: Miss Lamai
runners.comment: Listed winner but hasn't really threatened in Group races on last three starts; vulnerable
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in the Listed Marygate over C&D last May then ran well at Royal Ascot before a Listed win at Naas; hasn't really threatened in Group races on her three runs since, however, and may be vulnerable once more.

quotes.race: Arqana Irish EBF Marwell Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: Miss Lamai is a good filly and a tough filly. I thought if she ran up to her last two runs she would have been hard to beat. The draw helped. She is in the Lowther and that's the first time I have seen her really finish out her race - Karl Burke, trainer

stable_tour.quote: A Listed winner at two, she looks like she's done really well through the winter and it wouldn't surprise me to see her carry on as a three-year-old and pick up some black type. 11-04-25

2:10.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; Overall 6.8; Home straight: Far side 6.9, Centre 7.0, Stands' side 6.9)

runners.name: Shagraan
runners.comment: Tough sprinter; solid return at Goodwood two weeks ago; ran well here last year; contender
runners.spotlight: Tough sprinter who ran a string of good races in hot handicaps last year, including at this track (5.5f, good to firm) at the Ebor meeting; solid return to action at Goodwood two weeks ago when faring best of those to race prominently; another big run on the cards.

quotes.race: Betfair Be Friendly Handicap
quotes.quote: Shagraan was drawn on the wrong side and the ground was a bit on the softer side than ideal, but he's done it well. He's still improving and places like Bahrain might suit him, so we'll have a look at where we're going to go - Mick Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: Anderson Roofing Supplies Ltd 20th Anniversary Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Shagraan has taken a big step forward from his Haydock run and shown a bit of class. We thought he was a horse who could run in a decent grade and he's shown that there. We'll stay at six furlongs for now. Windsor is a nice, sharp track and he was always travelling smoothly and he picked up well. He'll come forward again for that - Clive Cox, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a strong and competitive colt by a great sire in Sioux Nation. He made a pleasing second start when an impressive winner at Windsor over 6f, where he travelled strongly throughout. We upped him in class to Listed level last month for the Rose Bowl at Newbury where he stepped up with his performance in finishing a good second. On his homework I think 6f is his strip but he is sharp and ideally he would probably be at his best over 5½f, which leads me to think of the Flying Childers, which we won with Caturra in 2021, who had previously won the Rose Bowl on his way to that Group 2 success. This fellow is definitely going the right way and he runs in the Group 3 Molecomb Stakes at Glorious Goodwood on Wednesday. 02-08-23

runners.name: Tees Spirit
runners.owner: Ingleby Bloodstock Ltd & The Ivy League
runners.comment: Two runs this year suggest he'll do well to better last season's fifth in this race
runners.spotlight: High in the weights after a productive 2024 campaign, having been hit hard for a conditions race win at Beverley (5f, good) in September; two runs this year suggest he'll be vulnerable in a race like this (fifth off a 1lb lower mark last year when in better form).

quotes.race: Eddie And Violet Smith Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It wasn't my plan to come here, but when I saw the entries I said to the lads we're going to have to throw him in as it was only going to be four runners. Fair play to Ali Rawlinson [rider of King Of Stars], he and Mia had a talk as we all know how King Of Stars runs. I said to Mia see how you jump, see how Ali jumps and go from there, as there was no point in the two of them taking each other on because it's a long way home with a bit of give in the ground. Mia gave him a good ride. She's doing really well and she's at the right stable with Eve [Johnson Houghton], and she used her head there. Tees Spirit came into the race in good form and he's been a star this year. Emaraaty Ana had the form in the book, so it was a great performance and I'm chuffed to bits for Mia and the horse - Adrian Nicholls, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Abergwaun Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Tees Spirit came here instead of the Beverley Bullet. I was delighted that the ground was so quick and he just seems to be getting quicker. He loves rattling off fast ground over 5f. He's in the Abbaye and he will probably run - Adrian Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing League On Sky Sports Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: We haven't done anything different with Tees Spirit but his confidence is sky high and he's on a roll. We only have 20 horses and it's great for us to have one as good as this. He hasn't stopped improving yet and he might be good enough to be aimed at Listed and Group races eventually. He's shown he likes this course, so the Portland Handicap is certainly a consideration for his next race - Adrian Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Watch On Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: Tees Spirit was doing everything right at home and had been working nicely. He put the race to bed fairly quickly - Barry McHugh, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's done brilliantly for us. Winning the Dash at Epsom a couple of years ago was massive for me and then he backed it up in a Listed race at Tipperary. He hit all the heights and had such a good year back then, but what goes up must come down. He had his wind done and it took him a while to come back but Mia's claim really helped with that. He's come back this year in great form, winning first time at Newmarket, after which he was stepped up in class. He came back to form at Sandown the other day and you don't get rated 97 for nothing. There's a 5f handicap on the first day of Glorious Goodwood and a similar race at Haydock on the Sunday of that week and he'll go to one of those depending on the ground. It's good to have a horse to take you to the big gigs. 26-07-24

runners.name: Spartan Arrow
runners.owner: Hambleton Racing Ltd Xxxi And Partner
runners.comment: Looked smart at Epsom latest (cheekpieces first time); up 7lb but still has low mileage
runners.spotlight: Finished third in the corresponding race 12 months ago when trained by the Crisfords; theoretically has more on his plate off today's 7lb higher mark but he's earned it having won two of his four runs for new connections; created a positive impression at Epsom last month when the new cheekpieces (retained) did the trick; one to take seriously.

runners.name: American Affair
runners.comment: Giant strides last year; better than ever on reappearance; looks a Group horse in waiting
runners.spotlight: Made giant strides last year, notably when getting up late in the Portland at Doncaster (5.5f, good); better than ever when overcoming a troubled passage to win at Musselburgh last month (5f, good to soft); hard to believe he's not still well treated up 4lb and he looks every inch a Pattern-racer in waiting; whether today's combination of a fast 5f on quick ground will see him to best effect remains to be seen.

quotes.race: Lindum York Handicap
quotes.quote: It's probably American Affair's last go in a handicap. He's done nothing but improve and started off last year in the mid-70s, but the more racing he's had the sharper he's got. He just shuts down when he hits the front and is still quite raw. Jim said we'd learn a lot more about him today as there's no easy five-furlong race here. He's proved he's up to going to the next level - Paul Mulrennan, rider.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Price Boosts Scottish Sprint Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: We probably have to go into Group races. There's the King Charles over five furlongs at Ascot, which would be okay. I don't think we'll go to Newmarket but American Affair is a good horse and he's maturing - Jim Goldie, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfred Portland (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: American Affair has done nothing but improve all year. Jim Goldie is some trainer. The last couple of races he's been running with the choke out and not really finishing. Jim said today to ride him ice cold, I got him to switch off and he finished really well. What will he be like next year with another winter on his back? He's still very babyish and raw - Paul Mulrennan, jockey.

quotes.race: Sky Bet For The Fans Handicap
quotes.quote: American Affair is a homebred and as he came off the box, I said to him, 'Your granny [Class Wan] won here' and we've had a few generations of this breed. From where he was drawn [13], Paul got the rail and kind of bossed it - Jim Goldie, trainer, speaking to ITV Racing.

quotes.race: Watch Racing TV In Stunning HD Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: American Affair is a work in progress but the uphill finish and the step up to seven played to his strengths. He's a big horse and there should be a lot more to come from him - Paul Mulrennan, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He's very talented. We hoped he would bounce back the way he did at Musselburgh and he'll improve for it. We're excited. He'll probably go to York for a 5f handicap next but I've put him in the Temple Stakes and the King Charles at Royal Ascot. We'll probably stick to 5f at the moment. I think he's up to that class over five and he's a simpler ride over that trip. He appears very fast and seems to be comfortable at that pace. 07-05-25

runners.name: Pilgrim
runners.comment: Royal Ascot win last summer on the only occasion he's had 5f and fast ground; has C&D form
runners.spotlight: Ended last season with a whimper but he enjoyed a fine June, running away with a Musselburgh handicap before beating 27 rivals in the Palace Of Holyrood House at Royal Ascot (5f, good to firm); encouraging return to action at Ripon last month when not looking in love with the track; more required to take this having been nudged up 2lb but he ran well at this meeting last season and Royal Ascot was his only other run over 5f on fast ground.

quotes.race: Palace Of Holyrood House Stakes (Handicap)
quotes.quote: Pilgrim has done it well there. I thought he might have knackered his handicap mark at Musselburgh. We always thought that he was a really nice horse, not just a good two-year-old, and he's shown there today he's good. It's a great place to come and have a winner so it's very nice. This lad has a lot of speed. He travelled very well and he won quite comfortably. He done it easy - Joe Fanning, rider.

runners.name: Vintage Clarets
runners.comment: Best run this year when 3rd at Ripon last month; likely vulnerable on today's ground
runners.spotlight: Best effort this season when third of seven at Ripon 19 days ago (Pilgrim second), keeping on well in the closing stages; has won over 5f on good to firm ground but he's particularly effective on slower going and there's a strong suspicion he'll get taken off his feet early.

quotes.race: William Hill Catterick Dash Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a bit easier this year [than last year]. Vintage Clarets' last couple of runs were good, he enjoys that ground, he broke well and I was able to get the run of the race - Osin Orr, rider.

quotes.race: William Hill Catterick Dash Handicap
quotes.quote: We got there plenty soon enough and in the last-furlong Vintage Clarets was only just doing enough but I did think we got nailed on the line.  He's a legend of a horse and he's been very consistent all year. It's great to get a win on him - Oisin Orr, jockey.

runners.name: Toca Madera
runners.comment: Didn't build on his reappearance 2nd when 6th at Goodwood latest; work to do with Shagraan
runners.spotlight: Ran well given how hard he pulled at Newmarket on his seasonal return last month but he took a backward step at Goodwood two weeks ago; finished behind Shagraan on that occasion, as he had a couple of times last year; others are more appealing.

quotes.race: British EBF 40th Anniversary Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands B, C And D) (Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: Toca Madera had done everything right first time, and was a little bit unlucky, but he did that well. We'll see how he comes out of it. He didn't like the ground but Kieran was very complimentary, saying he'll be better on much better ground. With rain round the corner Royal Ascot is a possibility - Brian Meehan, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Jm Jungle
runners.owner: Mps Racing Ltd & The Ayrshire Tradesmen
runners.comment: Boasts strong handicap form here; behind American Affair on return but still a big player
runners.spotlight: Boasts strong handicap form at this track, enjoying his finest hour when seeing off 21 rivals over 5.5f at last season's Ebor meeting; no match for American Affair at Musselburgh on his reappearance but it was still an encouraging effort; no obvious reason why he won't be in the thick of it.

quotes.race: Symphony Group Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: When the draw came out and the ground was dry we were delighted. This was the plan all along, but Jm Jungle will roll away in all the big five-furlong handicap sprints for the rest of the year - John Quinn, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: World Pool Handicap
quotes.quote: JM Jungle is in very good form, and up to Haydock he had been running really well and just got touched off at York and Hamilton. Then he won nicely at Haydock. He's got a lot of speed from the gate, so we felt that this track would suit him - John Quinn, trainer.

quotes.race: Bet Boost At bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: JM Jungle has been running consistently and I thought he was unlucky to bump into a well-handicapped horse last time. He went to bite the second horse and I had to drag him back off, but he's done it well in the end - Jason Hart, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's another who did well in Bahrain and he arrived back in such good form that we decided to keep going for now, so he'll either head for the Scottish Sprint Cup at Musselburgh or a valuable race at Bath a week later. He gave Jason [Hart] a good feel on his last run in Bahrain and he could still be improving. He's an out-and-out 5f horse. 20-03-24

runners.name: Vantheman
runners.comment: Ran a stormer at this meeting last year; sharper for last month's return; interesting
runners.spotlight: Ran a stormer in the 3yo 5f handicap at this meeting 12 months ago, finishing second of 17 despite a poor draw; won a Pontefract handicap (5f, good) last July; not so good in three runs since but the combination of 6f and a six-month layoff may have contributed to his weak finish at Newmarket last month; can do better today.

runners.name: Trilby
runners.comment: Still well treated but fast 5f on fast ground may not be the conditions for him to show it
runners.spotlight: String of fine runs last season and he looked better than ever when winning at Beverley last month (5f, good); another solid effort at Leicester 19 days ago and remains on an attractive mark; a rapid 5f on quick ground wouldn't appeal as optimal for him though.

quotes.race: Beverley Beaker Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Trilby shows nothing at home. He's so laid-back for a sprinter. He's a pleasure to deal with and, because he's so easy and rideable, he just saves himself, which is great. He's been a great horse for us so far, so anything else he achieves is a bonus. He likes Haydock, and we all like a day out at York, so fingers crossed we'll keep tipping away with him. It will be fun to see what the season brings - Sam England, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Sam: He's been a cracking buy for 2,000gns. He's best on a stiff sprint track.  Jonathan: He was a little disappointing last time in an amateur riders' race on the all-weather, but I think he's probably better on turf. He was unlucky not towin at Pontefract previously, he got there and pricked his ears in front and got caught. 08-02-24

runners.name: Zoulu Chief
runners.comment: Course win as a 2yo (6f); promising 3rd at Ascot last time & now has something to build on
runners.spotlight: Enjoyed his best day when dominating a 6f nursery at the Ebor meeting in 2023 (good to firm); it hasn't been smooth sailing since but he showed good speed when third of nine at Ascot (5f, good to firm) and he now has something to build on; Oisin Murphy booked; considered.

runners.name: Ventura Express
runners.comment: Running well in defeat this year but surprising if there weren't a few better treated
runners.spotlight: Three solid efforts in defeat this year and he's on his last winning mark; surprising if a few weren't better treated today though.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Handicap
quotes.quote: Ventura Express jumped a little bit slow but he soon travelled well through the race and he picked up and won nicely. I thought he would run well but I didn't quite expect that. He's been gelded which makes a massive difference because I don't think there's much else different than what Richard Fahey does, they're a lot better than us! - Paul Midgley, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been fantastic for us and absolutely adores Pontefract. The course is everything he needs as it's a stiff 5f and he's always at his best there. He's really solid and seldom runs a bad race because he's so honest and genuine, and he probably overachieves a little bit. Last time at Thirsk I don't think they went that hard early, whikind of played against him. But he'll probably go to Beverley or Pontefract again next time. Handicap wise, he'd be at the top of where he needs to be but last season we had to step him up a grade and he still ran well. He wears his heart on his sleeve. 28-06-24

runners.name: Nazron
runners.comment: Handicapped to win & latest run hugely promising; in deeper today but still unexposed
runners.spotlight: Impressive winner of a 5f handicap at Windsor last August when 2lb lower; two promising runs after wind surgery in January, notably last time at Wolverhampton where he tanked through a strongly run 6f handicap, leading in the final furlong but picked off late on by two rivals who came from off the pace; well treated and of some interest in the short term; this is a tough task but he's not yet fully exposed.

quotes.race: Boost Your Acca At BetMGM Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Job done I think for Nazron. He's ran consistent all year. He's a nice horse and it was nice to get his head in front, so hopefully that will give him a bit of confidence going forward - David Egan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Vince Lamour
runners.comment: C&D win in October came on soft; finished behind a few of these at Musselburgh last time
runners.spotlight: Made all when beating Trilby over C&D last October (soft ground); satisfactory return to action at Pontefract last month but he finished behind a few of these at Musselburgh last time.

runners.name: Mon Na Slieve
runners.comment: Turf win last month but two runs since suggest he has his work cut out; new blinkers today
runners.spotlight: Benefitted from the return to turf when winning a Class 3 at Musselburgh last month; fair fourth behind American Affair next time but he failed to fire at Thirsk 12 days ago; now tried in blinkers; stable may have stronger claims with Vantheman.

stable_tour.quote: He was unlucky after winning his novice first time out at York because he never really had his ground. He loves it fast and even good to soft is no good to him. He's an out-and-out 5f horse who is up to winning some nice races. 04-04-24

runners.name: Mondammej
runners.comment: Four AW wins over the winter but he'd be a surprise winner here
runners.spotlight: Had a good winter, winning four times on AW; more recent efforts don't suggest he's the answer in this field.

quotes.race: Weekly £5 Free Bet With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: You can just see that Mondammej has absolutely thrived since he's had it (wind operation). He's very well behaved now, he's getting manageable. He probably travelled far too well today over the six furlongs and the line came just in time - Cam Hardie, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: £30 In Free Bets With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: Thankfully Mondammej was well behaved today with all the hiccups in the stalls. He had a nice gallop to aim at and he came alive around halfway. He loves it here and it was just a case of waiting for the gaps to open and pushing the button on him - Cam Hardie, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Heed Your Hunch At Betway Handicap
quotes.quote: Mondammej deserved to win another one as he's gone close in a few big sprints. The ground was too sticky at Doncaster as he's a top of the ground horse. There's the six-furlong Coral Sprint at York in three weeks' time if the ground is right - Antony Brittain, trainer.

quotes.race: Riu Hotels And Resorts Handicap
quotes.quote: The first time we ran Mondammej he was probably a little but green but still travelled well and got the job done smartly. We ran him a couple times after and he just started getting a bit hot-headed so we had to try a few different things. He absolutely ran away with me one day at Newcastle. He's a bit of a ticking time bomb and was being a handful in the stalls but today he was absolutely pitch perfect, he settled lovely through the races and we think a lot of him. He was climbing a bit on the grass, it's a new experience for him but he'll improve for that and I'm glad we're getting his head in the right place. You'd like to see him take on some of these big handicaps. I know he had a low weight today but he's done it easily enough. He has the potential it's just keeping a lid on him - Cam Hardie, jockey.

runners.name: Fine Wine

prev_owners.owner: Paul Dixon Kevin Brennan and Partners

runners.comment: Won this race in 2022; regressed since but latest Musselburgh third was better
runners.spotlight: Ran away with this race in 2022 and went on to show smart form on both turf and AW in the next 12 months; not stood a lot of racing since but he showed he retained ability at Musselburgh 13 days ago; this is a much stronger contest but he couldn't be discounted with confidence.

quotes.race: Paddy Power 'Making Flat Less Flat' Handicap
quotes.quote: There were worries about turning out so quickly, he's always sore the day after he runs, going back to the first time I ran him. It was a good run at Hamilton and I had no intention of declaring him but I trotted him up and he was like a dressage horse, he was absolutely perfect so I had to declare him. That is by far his most impressive performance to date. You've got to keep sprinters going when they're in this sort of form because they can soon drop out of it and the Dash is the next target. I've been speaking about it for months, we've been second and third and I'd love to win it. It's a very hot race and it doesn't suit every horse, rolling down a hill, but Fine Wine is so quick and he almost broke the track record at Southwell - Scott Dixon, trainer.

runners.name: Lethal Nymph

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Trevor Fox

runners.comment: On losing run and failed to fire last time; tough race in which to end his drought
runners.spotlight: On a long losing run; has run some solid races in defeat this year but last time at Thirsk wasn't one of them; this is a hot race in which to try and end the drought.

stable_tour.quote: He's done really well over the winter and wants quicker ground rather than slower. We'll look at a summer campaign over six furlongs. Ascot suits him really well and hopefully he could be one for the Wokingham. 02-05-23

We've put a bit more speed into him. He didn't do anything wrong at Thirsk the other day when he was second and he probably bumped into a well-handicapped one of Jim Goldie's. He's come out of the race really well. There's a good prize in him and the plan is to go for the Rockingham at the Curragh on Sunday. I imagine the Curragh will suit him as it's a stiff 5f with plenty of speed on from start to finish. He's uncomplicated to ride. 28-06-24

4:55.race_name: Frank Whittle Partnership ebfstallions.com Novice Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
4:55.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; Overall 6.8; Home straight: Far side 6.9, Centre 7.0, Stands' side 6.9)

runners.name: Jan Steen
runners.comment: Carries 5lb penalty and had just three rivals to beat on debut at Thirsk but did it easily
runners.spotlight: 100,000gns yearling who was heavily odds-on and easily made all on debut in a four-runner maiden at Thirsk (5f, good to firm); carries 5lb penalty and this is a much tougher test of his credentials, but his trainer's 2yos continue in flying form and he could have a very bright future.

runners.name: Wise Approach
runners.comment: Carries 5lb penalty for Ascot win but cost 1,000,000gns and could have lots more to offer
runners.spotlight: Carries a 5lb penalty against some very interesting types but he won a warm conditions race on his debut at Ascot (5f, good to firm; joint-favourite) and this 1,000,000gns half-brother to Group 1 winner Perfect Power could have lots more to offer for his top stable, especially now at 6f.

runners.name: First Legion
