runners.comment: Cost 500,000gns at last month's breeze-ups; interesting newcomer, especially if backed
runners.spotlight: 50,000euros foal, 500,000gns 2yo breeze-ups last month; Mehmas half-brother to winners Lady Of Spain (1m-9.5f including 2yo/Listed); dam unraced half-sister to 1m Group 2 winner Real World; trainer is having a good spring with his 2yos; interesting newcomer, especially if well backed.

quotes.race: Frank Whittle Partnership ebfstallions.com Novice Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: First Legion had breezed very well and was bought with a big reputation. He was a little bit keen in the middle of the race, but he picked up good. He came from a good breeze-up place and he'll improve on good, fast ground - Shane Foley, rider.

runners.name: Full Gas
runners.comment: Will need to be very useful to make winning debut in this race but has precocious pedigree
runners.spotlight: 60,000euros yearling; fourth foal; Bungle Inthejungle brother to 5f AW 2yo winners Funny Money Honey (Listed) and Sports Coach (RPR 91); will need to be very useful to make a winning debut in this race but he has a precocious pedigree; one of two newcomers for the yard; watch the betting.

runners.name: Going Commando
runners.comment: Well beaten at 28-1 on his debut at Beverley and is probably best watched for now
runners.spotlight: Useful pedigree and was drawn wide on his debut at Beverley (5f, good), but he was well beaten at 28-1 and is probably best watched for now.

runners.name: Isambard Kingdom
runners.comment: 115,000gns yearling; should have a future but may be one for later on
runners.spotlight: 115,000gns yearling; fourth foal; No Nay Never half-brother to 7.3f-1m1f winner The Parent (including 2yo; RPR 96); dam 7f-1m1f winner (including US turf Grade 1); should have a future but may be one for later on.

runners.name: Kinnalargy
runners.comment: £125,000 2yo breeze-ups; worth a market check on debut given last month's purchase price
runners.spotlight: 38,000gns yearling, £125,000 2yo breeze-ups; Havana Grey half-brother to winners Calidus Mirabilis (1m/1m2f AW; RPR 75) and Escher (Italian 6f 2yo/7f); dam 1m3f AW winner (76), sister to 7f/1m winner Rare Ransom; one of two newcomers for yard; worth a market check given last month's purchase price.

runners.name: Romeo Montague
runners.comment: £140,000 yearling; trainer saddled last year's runner-up (subsequent Listed winner)
runners.spotlight: 16,000gns foal, £140,000 yearling; by Sergei Prokofiev; first foal; dam 6f 2yo winner (RPR 71), half-sister to 6f 2yo/7f winner Another Investment, out of US 5f 2yo/6f winner; trainer saddled subsequent Listed winner Yah Mo Be There to be second on debut in this race last year; not ruled out.

runners.name: Side Deal
runners.comment: 280,000gns 2yo breeze-ups last month; worth second look on debut in view of purchase price
runners.spotlight: 80,000euros yearling, 280,000gns 2yo breeze-ups last month; by Starspangledbanner; first foal; dam placed 1m2f-1m4f (RPR 78), half-sister to two winners; worth a second look on debut in view of his purchase price.

runners.name: Spaceman
runners.comment: £105,000 yearling; from good northern stable and no surprise if he runs well on debut
runners.spotlight: £105,000 yearling; first foal; by Starman; dam 7f/1m AW winner (RPR 92), out of 7f 2yo winning half-sister to two useful winners; from good northern stable and it will be no surprise if he runs well on debut.

runners.name: Tadej
runners.breeder: Star Cottage Stud & Mr N O'Keeffe
runners.comment: Close 4th to Wise Approach on debut at Ascot and 5lb better off with the winner; contender
runners.spotlight: Well-backed 7-2 shot when fourth on debut at Ascot (5f, good to firm), beaten just under 1l by the winner Wise Approach; he's 5lb better off with that reopposing rival and the step up to 6f seems a likely plus; contender.

runners.name: Lina Codina
runners.comment: Takes on males on debut and likely to improve for the run; others preferred
runners.spotlight: 27,000gns yearling, 32,000gns 2yo breeze-ups; fifth foal; Sergei Prokofiev half-sister to French/Italian 6f-7f winner Muchas Gracias (including 2yo); dam 1m-1m2f winner (RPR 72), sister to 5f 2yo Listed winner Roxan; takes on males on debut and likely to improve for the run; others preferred.

5:25.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (Good in places; watered; Overall 6.8; Home straight: Far side 6.9, Centre 7.0, Stands' side 6.9)

runners.name: Anniversary
runners.comment: 2nd to Many Men in six-runner nursery at Newmarket (1m2f, heavy); 1m4f+ will suit him well
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden at Newmarket (1m, good) on debut and runner-up on his two other starts as 2yo, latterly to Many Men in a six-runner nursery at Newmarket (1m2f, heavy; gelded since); shaped that day as if 1m4f+ will suit him well and that he's the type to make further progress.

quotes.race: Jenningsbet Newmarket British EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a really pleasing debut. We were a bit unaware of where we were with such a big, fine-looking colt but Anniversary had done enough at home to look ready for his first day out. That was a real taking performance and he had a nice attitude. He's got plenty of size, which is most exciting as there's plenty to look forward to - Rob Hornby, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Rahiebb
runners.comment: Made most at Haydock (11.6f novice, good) but picked off by good prospect in final strides
runners.spotlight: Won debut at Newcastle (1m, AW) in March and runner-up in two more novice races; made most at Haydock (11.6f, good) latest but was picked off by a good prospect in the final strides; withdrawn from Lingfield Derby Trial last Saturday when the ground was officially good to firm; should figure prominently on handicap debut if the ground is suitable.

stable_tour.quote: He's a bit of a thug at home but his two runs have put some manners on him and he ran well both times. I think the handicapper reacted a bit heavily after his last run and we'll probably go for a novice off that rating. He could develop into a nice middle-distance/staying horse if he channels his energy in the right way. 11-04-25

runners.name: Pantile Warrior
runners.comment: Good-ground 2nds last year were better form than this season's 1-6 win and handicap fourth
runners.spotlight: 1-6 for a Chelmsford maiden (1m2f, AW) on reappearance but had to work to land the odds; last summer's form on turf (three seconds) was better but his return to good ground for handicap debut at Doncaster (1m2f) on latest start proved disappointing, leading until over 1f out; a revival is needed but he should stay if he settles.

runners.name: Tuscan Star
runners.comment: AW hat-trick before improvement ran out of steam when a close 3rd of four at Wolverhampton
runners.spotlight: Three wins on AW this January/February, latterly on handicap debut when upped to 1m3f at Kempton, but that improvement ran out of steam when a close third of four at Wolverhampton (1m4f) on latest start; needs to resume progress on this second turf outing.

runners.name: Merchant
runners.comment: Kept edging closer to go down by a length when 11-10 at Newmarket (1m2f); 1m4f plausible
runners.spotlight: Edged it in the second of two very close finishes over about 1m on AW in December; failed to justify 11-10 favouritism in seven-runner handicap at Newmarket (1m2f, good to firm) on reappearance 11 days ago but kept edging closer to go down by a length and 1m4f now seems plausible.

runners.name: Last Galileo
runners.comment: This handicap debut looks far more realistic, with fair claims to stay the extra 3f
runners.spotlight: Made most and won by a neck in a good scrap at Ayr (1m, good) last October in his second novice event; 18-1 when put very firmly in his place in Listed event at Newmarket (1m1f, good to soft) on reappearance and this handicap debut looks far more realistic, with fair claims to stay the extra 3f.

stable_tour.quote: I think he's going to want a mile and a quarter-plus but he'll probably start off next week in the Feilden Stakes over 1m1f, which on a galloping track like Newmarket might just play to his strengths. He's quite lazy, which makes him hard to assess but I think he's got a lot of potential up to a certain level. 11-04-25

runners.name: Many Men
runners.comment: Two 1m2f wins before creditable, never-nearer 5th at Sandown; 1m4f looks well worth a go
runners.spotlight: Ended last term with a 1m2f handicap win at Newmarket (soft; from Anniversary) and started this one with another at Doncaster (good; Pantile Warrior fourth); both were under Jack Doughty; up another 6lb to this mark when creditable fifth of 12 at Sandown (1m2f, good) three weeks ago, never nearer; 1m4f now looks well worth a go.

runners.name: Novelista
runners.comment: New trip will suit; interesting handicap/seasonal debutant if he goes on the ground
runners.spotlight: Pedigree suggests strongly that this step up to 1m4f will suit him well and that impression is backed up by his placed efforts in 1m2f novice events on final two outings last season; has raced only on soft or heavy; interesting handicap/seasonal debutant if he goes on the ground.

6:00.race_name: Unibet More Extra Place Races Apprentice Handicap (London Middle Distance Qualifier) (GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Westridge
runners.comment: Similar form all handicap starts but the cheekpieces and, especially, longer trip may help
runners.spotlight: Narrowly denied a now smart stablemate in a Windsor novice (1m, good to firm) last June having shaped well here (7f) the time before; hasn't quite matched that in handicaps since, similar form all three starts including AW and on his return at Newbury (1m2f, good) last month, but he comes from a strong-staying Aga Khan family and this extra furlong will suit, as may the added cheekpieces; respected.

runners.name: Trouville
runners.comment: One good run last year but patchy otherwise; may do better; gelded on this return/AW debut
runners.spotlight: Won maiden at Chepstow last May; good fourth of 13 in a Doncaster handicap (1m4f, good to soft) in September but it wasn't happening when he was hampered in the Old Rowley Cup at Newmarket one month later; gelded and drops in class for this reappearance/AW debut; unraced at two and he's probably capable of better this term.

runners.name: Way Of Life
runners.comment: String of good efforts since notching a five-timer three years ago; bang in the mix again
runners.spotlight: Completed a five-timer between November 2021 and May 2022, including four on AW; the handicapper's got a long memory and a losing run has been the feature since, but a string of consistent efforts include no less than 12 second-placings and he had zero luck when fourth at Lingfield (1m4f) last time; yard continues to tick along very nicely and a well overdue sixth success could be in the offing.

quotes.race: Starlight Charity Remembers Christopher Hanbury Handicap
quotes.quote: Way Of Life is just growing up. He was so raw and ignorant and gormless as a younger horse and if he had ability he kept it well hidden, but we knew something was there. I hope he doesn't get crucified for that by the handicapper - Jonathan Portman, trainer.

runners.name: Afloat
runners.comment: Narrowly landed a fourth win last time; earlier AW form can be forgiven; thereabouts
runners.spotlight: Won at Yarmouth (11.5f, soft) last October for Rae Guest; built on her encouraging stable/seasonal debut at Leicester (1m4f, good to firm) when winning at Haydock (1m2f, good) 19 days ago, tongue tied both times; four lesser runs on AW at the start of her career are likely irrelevant and she should be a threat off 2lb higher than last time.

quotes.race: quinnbet.com "Confined" Handicap (For horses With No More Than One Win)
quotes.quote: I think we'll look for some softer ground for Afloat next time as it was good to soft when we declared but now it's good to firm. We had to run as she was 2lb well in - Rae Guest, trainer

runners.name: Damascus Steel
runners.comment: Dual course winner (1m4f) but step backwards on turf last time; returning here may help
runners.spotlight: Dual course winner (1m4f) who made a fairly encouraging return from break over that C&D when beaten a little over 6l in April; didn't build on it over 1m6f on good to firm next time but may do better returned to this venue; fair to say he needs to.

quotes.race: At The Races App Form Study Handicap
quotes.quote: Damascus Steel had shown a fair bit in his last three starts and it was just about finding out what was best for him. We tried different tactics today - going forward - and it seems to have done the trick, while we also added the blinkers to sharpen him up and that seems to have worked too. He's done it nicely and can hopefully win again for the owners. You'd say he'd get further, but I think we'll probably stay at this trip. I wouldn't be opposed to dropping back in trip but that's up the guv'nor. He goes on most ground - Jack Morland, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won three times last year but then lost his way a bit. He was out the back in a slowly run race at Kempton on his first run back this month and never got involved. He's a strange horse - he'll run a bad race and then he'll win, a typical Mastercraftsman I suppose. He likes the all-weather but I'm keen to go back on the turf. I've explored the avenue of trying to make him stay 2m but I don't think he does. He's come down the handicap a fair amount and is probably dropping to a dangerous mark. The punters will have to tread carefully with their eyes closed, though, to see what horse turns up. 30-04-25

runners.name: Major Reward
runners.comment: Big absence but formerly quite useful on the Flat in Ireland; market check required
runners.spotlight: Beaten about 30l in two hurdle races for this yard in 2022; fairly useful sort in Ireland on the Flat in 2019 and 2020, however, including on AW at up to 1m4f; not seen for over three years but the handicapper's factored that in and market support should be heeded.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Apprentice Claiming Race
quotes.quote: Major Reward is a genuine horse and he tries hard. I got a nice pocket in by the rail and he travelled well into the straight. He can be a funny horse but today was his day - John Shinnick, rider.

8:30.race_name: Unibet 40,000+ Live Streamed Events Handicap (Jockey Club Grassroots Mile/London Mile Series Qual')

runners.name: Superposition
runners.comment: Given every chance when a well-held fourth off this mark at Pontefract
runners.spotlight: Only went up 2lb for winning his maiden at Southwell (1m) but was given every chance when a well-held fourth off this mark at Pontefract (1m, good); hasn't had a lot of racing but needs to find something on that last run.

stable_tour.quote: He's always shown a considerable amount of talent but sort of lost his way. He had a wind operation and we gelded him last year. I was thrilled with the way he came back, behaving very well at Southwell and winning in impressive fashion considering he carried a four-year-old's weight. He runs at Pontefract on Wednesday. He looks to have got a little bit quicker and I hope he'll continue to progress along the handicap route. He's a very good mover and, touch wood, very sound. I wouldn't want to run him on rattling fast ground, but equally he doesn't want to run on very soft ground either. We're still learning a little bit with him after only five runs but his behaviour last time was fantastic, which is the important thing with him. 30-04-25

runners.name: Glam Squad
runners.comment: 3-10; only 4lb higher than for last win and appeals as a horse with more to offer
runners.spotlight: His third win in ten starts when emerging from midfield to win with a bit in hand at Southwell (1m) in October; only 4lb higher and appeals as a horse with more to offer.

runners.name: Ata Rangi
runners.comment: Overcame a wide stall to race prominently and win nicely over C&D last month
runners.spotlight: 7.5f maiden winner for Henry De Bromhead; still lightly raced and overcame a wide stall to race prominently and win nicely over C&D last month; better drawn this time and only 4lb higher.

stable_tour.quote: He's a sweet horse who ran very nicely last week on his first run for us and handicap debut, winning at Kempton. I think he's going to be a miler and I hope there will be more to come. 16-04-25

runners.name: Beylerbeyi
runners.comment: Tailed off in two hurdle races during the winter; won his last Flat start off 5lb lower
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in two hurdle races during the winter; won his last Flat start at Wolverhampton in October (9.4f) but on balance of form this 5lb higher mark could find him out.

runners.name: Jodhpur Blue
runners.comment: Should pay his way in handicaps but perhaps best watched here on first run since October
runners.spotlight: Joined this yard for 25,000gns after winning his fifth start for Charles Hills, a 7f maiden at Newcastle; the second has won since, showing useful form; should pay his way in handicaps but perhaps best watched here on first run since October; trainer also runs Beylerbeyi.

runners.name: Arctic Dawn
runners.comment: Kept boxing on for pressure when second over 7f last time and looks ready for a mile
runners.spotlight: 0-6; first run since gelded when pulling clear of the third in a 7f Southwell handicap 18 days ago; kept boxing on that day for pressure and looks ready for a mile.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a little setback, but the form of his second at Wolverhampton last time looks decent as the winner [Rocking Tree] went on to win a handicap from four other last-time-out winners. We rate him and he'll probably be out in June. If there's a valuable maiden or novice he could run in one of those, but something like a nice Class 4 handicap would also be an option. 02-05-24

runners.name: Great Blasket
runners.comment: Quiet this season but competitive mark if he can get himself back on track
runners.spotlight: Had a hot streak last summer when winning four handicaps but it's been a quiet return from a break, with latest defeat coming in a Yarmouth handicap he won 12 months earlier; competitive mark if he can get himself back on track.

quotes.race: Follow Us On X @betrhino Handicap
quotes.quote: We'll check Great Blasket over tomorrow but as long as he comes out of the race okay I can't think why he wouldn't take his chance. He's a very hardy horse. He won first time for us and we probably didn't know how to ride him the next few times on the all-weather. Kieran Shoemark won on him at Southwell, where we said we'd drop him out and try to get there as late as possible, and since then he's won four from five. The change of tactics has definitely worked in his favour. I think stepping up to higher grade races suits him down to the ground, a harder pace and better quality of horses gives him a better target to aim at - Jamie Insole, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Coast To Curragh Charity Cycle Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Great Blasket did that nicely and was tough. We were a little bit worried that the ground would be a bit sharp for him but Shane said he travelled around nicely. He'll probably step up to a mile the next day - George Murphy, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Down To The Kid

prev_owners.owner: GB Civil, N Sennett & I Furtado
Gb Civil Engineering & The Giggle Factor

runners.comment: Completed a Southwell hat-trick at this trip in good style two weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Completed a Southwell hat-trick at this trip in good style two weeks ago; has another 6lb to deal with now but he's on a roll.

stable_tour.quote: He didn't show much last year but hit the lids in style this year with back-to-back wins at Southwell in the spring, each time over 1m4f. He was denied his hat-trick back at our local track by a nose. He was disappointing last time but had had had a much-needed break so was always going to be better for the run. There is more to come from him as he is still relatively lightly raced. 29-08-22

runners.name: Drifts Away
runners.comment: Four-timer came up shy but Brandon Wilkie returns with his 3lb claim and that can help
runners.spotlight: Kicked off his hat-trick over C&D (then won twice at Chelmsford) but was only third last time at Southwell and 5l behind Arctic Blue; Brandon Wilkie returns with his 3lb claim and that can help.

runners.name: Court Of Session
runners.comment: Well held in his six races since moving yards and not beaten a rival in his last two
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner for the Crisfords but mostly well held in his six races since moving yards and not beaten a rival in his last two.

runners.name: Sunny Corner
runners.comment: Didn't run too badly back from a break at Brighton and should be sharper this time
runners.spotlight: The winner of three turf handicaps over 1m and only 3lb higher than for the latest at Newbury last July; didn't run too badly back from a break at Brighton and should be sharper this time; only had one run on the AW, though.

quotes.race: Yeeehaaa.Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Sunny Corner went really wide on the bend but showed a bit of ability at Windsor. He just needs to settle down and learn to chill out a bit and I think he'd be quite a nice horse. He wouldn't want it too firm, though - Stuart Kittow, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Distinction

prev_owners.owner: Nick Willis And Mike And Wendy Yardley

runners.comment: Penultimate run was a positive one but always vulnerable to something more progressive
runners.spotlight: Third of 18 in 1m2f Doncaster handicap in March but couldn't land any blow back over 1m at Southwell; always vulnerable to something more progressive.

quotes.race: Charles Stewart & Co Steve Evans Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: Distinction has done us proud. The stiff mile and soft ground were ideal. He's declared for Kempton tomorrow but that was just a back-up in case he couldn't run here - John Mackie, trainer.

8:00.race_name: Try Unibet's New Improved Acca Boosts Fillies' Handicap (London Mile Series Qualifier)

runners.name: Rockymountainway
runners.comment: Dual turf winner last summer; has run well over C&D; may have needed last month's return
runners.spotlight: Won twice over this trip on a soft surface last summer and has run well over this C&D; never figured on last month's Musselburgh return, but that was a better race than this one and she may fare better with the run under her belt.

runners.name: Al Khawssaa
runners.comment: Pulled her chance away on last month's return but showed good form on the AW last year
runners.spotlight: Third of nine on her debut over C&D last August before landing a four-runner Southwell novice (7f, Tapeta); apprentice-ridden when pulling her chance away on last month's Beverley return, but would have a solid chance on handicap debut if that has taken the freshness out of her.

quotes.race: Tips For Every Day At raceday-ready.com Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was nice and straightforward. Al Khawssaa was weighted to beat the [William] Haggas horse and was more alert and travelled much sweeter. She was still a little green when she hit the front so there's a bit to do learning-wise, but hopefully she'll keep improving - James Doyle, rider.

stable_tour.quote: She's had her problems, which is why she's only raced twice, but we're very happy with how she's moving at the moment. She's got a nice amount of ability and how she runs under a penalty on her next start will determine plans. She'll get a mile and hopefully she can progress. 11-04-25

runners.name: Powdering
runners.comment: Mainly seen on Tapeta; not handicapped out of things, but isn't drawn to advantage
runners.spotlight: Has run well in her few goes on Polytrack, but mainly seen on Tapeta and has scored twice at Southwell (6f/7f) this year; not handicapped out of things, but she isn't drawn to advantage.

runners.name: Gaiety Musical
runners.comment: Four wins from nine starts on AW this year; shorter trip and wide draw pose a question
runners.spotlight: Four wins from nine starts on the AW this year including twice over 1m here; only beaten a neck at Southwell (1m, Tapeta) ten days ago, but the shorter trip and her wide draw pose a question.

runners.name: Thursdays Child
runners.comment: Didn't show a lot on her stable debut/return over 6f here last month; best look elsewhere
runners.spotlight: Won her first two starts over 6f/7f on turf/Tapeta for Micky Hammond last spring, but more out than in since then; didn't show a lot on her stable debut/return over 6f here last month; best look elsewhere.

runners.name: Searchingtheblues
runners.comment: Twice disappointing since winning twice on the AW last summer; plenty to prove
runners.spotlight: Won her first two starts in AW novices last summer, the first over C&D and than an 8l success at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta); only seen twice since then, though, and has been disappointing; plenty to prove.

runners.name: Lady Of Andros
runners.comment: 1-6 for Andre Fabre; makes stable/AW debut after seven months off and worth a market check
runners.spotlight: 1-6 for Andre Fabre last year; not beaten far in a couple of 5f Listed races in August (including at Newbury), but last three efforts not quite so good; makes her stable/AW debut after seven months off and worth a market check.

runners.name: Liberalised
runners.comment: Well held in three starts for this yard and improvement needed now switched to a handicap
runners.spotlight: Mainly highly tried since making a winning debut for Karl Burke at Hamilton (6f, good) last summer; well held in three starts for this yard and improvement needed now switched to a handicap.

quotes.race: Sodexo Live 2YO Series Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Hamilton Park 2yo Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Liberalised was impressive. She's been showing us all the right signs at home and she's the sort of filly who does everything so easily. You can never be sure first time out but Karl [Burke, trainer] has got a good gauge on his two-year-olds and she's bound to improve - Danny Tudhope, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Dash Of Azure
runners.comment: Second in all three starts last year; makes handicap debut after 197 days off; respected
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in all three novices last year, the latest over C&D in October; makes her handicap debut after 197 days off and respected if returning in the same vein.

runners.name: Cypriot Diaspora
runners.comment: Hasn't shone in three goes on the AW and is yet to prove she wants this far
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner over 5f/6f on turf and is favourably handicapped on her best form; however, she hasn't shone in three goes on the AW (including on last month's return over 6f here) and is yet to prove she wants this far.

stable_tour.quote: She's tough little filly who won last time out at Goodwood, her second win of the season. She's a 6f filly and possibly a 7f one. She has no real ground preferences- she's a good regular runner and is still improving. She goes to Carlisle on Thursday for her next run. 11-07-24

runners.name: Bridgets View
runners.comment: C&D winner who makes her handicap debut after six months off; drawn widest
runners.spotlight: Promising in three starts last year, culminating in a narrow success in a valuable maiden over C&D in November (form worked out well); makes her handicap debut after six months off, but would have made greater appeal had it not been for the outside stall.

stable_tour.quote: She's a big filly who didn't do much wrong last year and has done well since. She's probably a bit behind some of the others but she could have a good year. She could be progressive in handicaps. She doesn't want the ground too quick and I expect her to stay 1m. 16-04-25

runners.name: Stellenbosch
runners.comment: Placed in her first three starts, but well held on handicap debut; needs to bounce back
runners.spotlight: Placed over 6f/7f in her first three starts at top tracks, but didn't get home on handicap debut at Yarmouth (7f, good to firm) a fortnight ago; needs to bounce back on AW debut.

runners.name: Isabella Castile
runners.comment: Beaten a neck on AW debut here ten days ago; a player off the same mark (1lb well in)
runners.spotlight: Quite impressive when winning a Windsor novice (6f, heavy) last October and beaten only a neck on AW debut here (6f) ten days ago; shouldn't have an issue with the return to this trip and a player off the same mark (1lb well in).

runners.name: Primrose Path
runners.comment: Off 162 days since winning at Lingfield and the draw hasn't been kind
runners.spotlight: Caused a 25-1 surprise in a Lingfield nursery (7f, Polytrack) in December, but the form looks solid with four of those behind winning their next starts; 5lb rise not the end of the world, but she has been off 162 days and the draw hasn't been kind.

9:00.race_name: Try Unibet's New Smartview Racecards Handicap (London Stayers' Series Qualifier)

runners.name: Kingdom Of Stars

prev_owners.owner: M White, Mrs A Gillies And Partner

runners.comment: Unexposed handicap debutant but the step up to 2m not sure to suit (dam a sprinter)
runners.spotlight: Just three races, all at big odds and twice showing fair form (1m2f-1m4f); better is needed and the step up to 2m is something of a query (dam a sprinter);

runners.name: Caprelo
runners.comment: Course win (1m3f) last year; sharper for reappearance and steps up in trip with potential
runners.spotlight: Made a successful handicap debut here (1m3f) last spring; progressive in defeat on his next three starts before ending 2024 with a low-key run on soft at York; last month's reappearance should have blown away the cobwebs and he steps up to 2m with headgear now enlisted; not fully exposed.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Kempton in April and was  second last time at Windsor, where the ground was too quick. I'm not sure he's quite as good as Marmelo and Vent De Force, who were also out of Capriolla, but I think next year he will be quite progressive. 06-06-24

runners.name: Currumbin
runners.comment: Progressive stayer on AW this winter; below par on turf latest but can quickly bounce back
runners.spotlight: Did well on AW for new yard over the winter, winning over 1m6f at Southwell and 2m at Chelmsford; also ran well over C&D in February but his form dipped on turf 13 days ago; solid contender back on AW.

quotes.race: Build Your Acca With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: I watched back Currumbin's last few races and it just looks like he stays. Today he relaxed beautifully, he took me there very comfortably and he won well - Kieren Shoemark, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Moel Arthur
runners.comment: 2m win at Lingfield in January but he's found it tougher going since
runners.spotlight: Ended a losing run when winning a 2m handicap at Lingfield in January; he has found it tougher going since and takes on less-exposed rivals this evening.

quotes.race: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Handicap (GBBPLUS Race)
quotes.quote: The two-mile trip was the question mark, so the way the race panned out suited Moel Arthur. I don't think I've ever been as slow around here - Callum Shepherd, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Capone
runners.owner: Maximum Racing And D Ffrench Davis
runners.comment: Did well in 2023; ran to form in just one of three starts last year; absent ten months
runners.spotlight: Did well in 2023, including an easy Chester win (2m, good) off 5lb lower; raced just three times last year, running to form only once, and he returns from ten months off with a point to prove.

quotes.race: MansionBet Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: That was a disaster. I left the ear plugs in and Noel said Capone never woke up. He's going to be a much nicer horse next year and it's great to give Noel a winner - Charlie Mann, trainer.

quotes.race: Best Wishes For 2019 Juvenile Hurdle
quotes.quote: Noel (Fehily) thinks I ran Capone too soon as he didn't settle today but he's a lot better than that. He won't run again for at least a month but he's a decent horse. He works very well and we've got nothing that can go with him at home - Charlie Mann, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was a present from Charlie Mann when he retired. He's had a wonderful season but sadly he irritated an old leg injury when I ran him at Salisbury the other day. He couldn't get into the race on the rail and when he got clear he stretched and I think he did something funny when he crossed the road, so we won't see him in a little while. 21-09-23

runners.name: Gooloogong

prev_owners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith
Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith

runners.comment: Got messed about when well backed at Goodwood latest; yard in form; can do better
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 in good form over hurdles; sent off favourite for his return to the Flat at Goodwood 13 days ago (1m6f, good) but plenty went wrong and that's not the run to judge him on; yard in form and he's one to consider.

quotes.race: NavanRacecourse.ie Maiden
quotes.quote: Gooloogong has been progressing nicely over the winter. Ryan spoke very nicely of him and he will fit into one of the trials now - Chris Armstrong, stable representative

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice colt who came forward nicely from his only run at two to win at Navan in March. We're thinking about the Queen's Vase for him but nothing is set in stone yet. 15-06-23

runners.name: Donald Llewellyn
runners.comment: Conditions to suit but he ran poorly here when last seen and others look safer
runners.spotlight: Three course wins (two over this trip) in 2023; made a winning return to Flat action at Lingfield in March but ran poorly back here three weeks later; others appeal more.

runners.name: Doublethetrouble

prev_owners.owner: R W Hayward & Mrs B Wakelin
R W Hayward & E R Wakelin

runners.comment: Conditions to suit but fully exposed and vulnerable to improvers
runners.spotlight: No problem with conditions and he's run some sound races in defeat on AW this year; might find a few better treated.

6:30.race_name: 'Mayors Buckaroo' Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Not Now Nathaniel
runners.comment: Some support before finishing fourth on her Flat debut last month; Polytrack debut
runners.spotlight: Bumper (Tapeta) and dual hurdle winner who was the subject of market interest on her Flat debut at Catterick (1m4f, good to firm; Belgravian second) three weeks ago, before being beaten just over 3l; this is another moderate maiden and she might be capable of better; Polytrack debut.

quotes.race: Cheshire Oaks Designer Outlet Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Not Now Nathaniel is not a bad mare. I couldn't get her settled in the mares' bumper at Aintree and I genuinely believe she would've been in the first four if she had. She's overeager and raw and just needs racing. She has a good engine - Brian Hughes, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: I shouldn't have run her last time at Bangor as the ground was nearly heavy down the back. I still think I can nick a bit of black type with her, but I've got to do it on the right day. She's not badly handicapped and she has enough experience for it now. 12-11-24

runners.name: Slack Alice
runners.comment: Mildly progressive in her first three bumpers, now makes her Flat/AW debut
runners.spotlight: Mildly progressive in her first three bumpers before being well beaten at 125-1 in a Grade 2 at Aintree last month; now makes her Flat/AW debut in a race that won't take the world of winning.

runners.name: Gallivanted
runners.comment: Stepped forward when third here (1m) last run; new trip fine on pedigree; player on return
runners.spotlight: Took a good step forward from his Windsor debut when third of 11, beaten 3l, in a course novice (again over 1m) last term; big step up in trip for this reappearance but his pedigree offers plenty of hope for it and he had subsequent winners in front and behind him last time; interesting.

runners.name: Lone Rock
runners.breeder: Mount Coote Estates & New England Stud
runners.comment: 20,000gns foal; gelded son of Fastnet Rock; yard 4-86 in maidens over the last five years
runners.spotlight: 20,000gns foal; gelded son of Fastnet Rock; closely related to French 1m (Listed) and 9.7f winner Dark Orchid (RPR 106), half-brother to four winners including Orchid Star (Listed-placed 7f/1m AW; 100); dam French 10.5f winner, half-sister to French Derby winner Hernando; yard is just 4-86 in maidens over the last five years but he's introduced at an ordinary level.

runners.name: Belgravian
runners.comment: Beaten favourite all runs; no major progress for this trip last time but this is winnable
runners.spotlight: Green when seventh on his debut at Bath last autumn and again let his backers down on his Tapeta comeback (both about 1m) when fourth of nine last month, having been gelded; no major improvement for the step up to 1m4f at Catterick three weeks ago, finishing second but a beaten favourite for the third time; may need even further but this is winnable and he's in the mix once more.

runners.name: John T
runners.comment: Much better last time when second (turf; hooded, not today); up in trip again; contender
runners.spotlight: Well-held seventh on his debut here (1m) in December and was withdrawn after refusing to enter the stalls on his return visit in March; gelded subsequently and he showed what he could do when second of nine in a hood at Windsor (1m2f, good to firm; 66-1 again) 17 days ago; up in trip once more, with no hood this time, but that last run just about sets the standard.

runners.name: Witch Hazel
runners.comment: Fair debut at Lingfield over 1m2f last month; goes up in trip and is open to progress
runners.spotlight: Masar half-sister to two winners at sprint trips; fair debut when fourth, beaten just over 8l, behind an Oaks entry at Lingfield (1m2f; 50-1) 17 days ago; now steps up in trip and is open to improvement.

7:30.race_name: Industry Leading In-Play Markets At Unibet Handicap

runners.name: Moostar
runners.comment: Not guaranteed to improve for the longer trip and could have been better drawn
runners.spotlight: Made a successful nursery debut when making all at Thirsk (6f, good to soft) last September and didn't run badly when in midfield on her Windsor return (6f, good to firm) last month; half-sister to a multiple AW winner, but not guaranteed to improve for the longer trip and could have been better drawn.

quotes.race: Up To £25 Back With Bresbet Nursery Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Moostar was pretty good today. Speaking to Daryll [Holland, trainer] beforehand, he just said she is more of a galloper than a filly who quickens so I made use of that stride. She's still learning. I felt she wasn't doing a tap in front once I asked her a question and hopefully there's plenty more to come - Jason Watson, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Mighty Ruler
runners.comment: Well held on stable debut; return to this trip may suit but still down the pecking order
runners.spotlight: Finished a close third of 12 when fitted with cheekpieces/tongue-tie on nursery debut at Wolverhampton (6f, Tapeta) in November, but twice well held since including on stable debut here (6f) last month; return to this trip may suit, but still down the pecking order; stable also runs Reporter.

runners.name: Warrnambool
runners.comment: Two best efforts have come over C&D; has an awkward draw, but still makes the shortlist
runners.spotlight: Two best efforts in four starts have come over C&D, as when fourth of ten on stable debut after 133 days off last month (first two won next time); has an awkward draw, but still makes the shortlist dropped 1lb.

runners.name: Whizz By
runners.breeder: New England Stud & Mount Coote Stud
runners.comment: Most consistent since handicapping (111223); high on the list; tongue-tie on
runners.spotlight: Most consistent since handicapping with a record of 111223; the three wins came at Southwell (7f, Tapeta), but she finished second of ten over this C&D in March; well drawn and high on the list with a tongue-tie given a go.

runners.name: Reporter
runners.comment: Makes his stable debut after four months off having been gelded; bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Best effort for Ed Walker when beaten less than a length into second of seven at Newcastle (7f, Tapeta) in December; last off 11 over this C&D in January and makes his stable debut after four months off having been gelded in the meantime; drawn wide and has a bit to prove.

runners.name: Captain Harry
runners.comment: Modest effort last time; return to 7f may help, as may a visor, but he has plenty to prove
runners.spotlight: Just a hint of ability in his five starts to date, though not in his latest outing at Doncaster (1m, good to firm); return to this trip may help, as may the visor, but he has plenty to prove for now.

runners.name: Kazakh
runners.comment: Showed ability in two of his three starts for Amy Murphy; watch market on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Showed ability in the last two of his three starts over 7f on the AW (all in a tongue-tie) for Amy Murphy, as when fourth of eight in first-time cheekpieces (now removed) at Chelmsford in January; makes his handicap debut after four months off and has the outside stall; watch market.

runners.name: Spirited Dancer
runners.comment: Out of the frame in five starts since winning at Bath but may appreciate the extra furlong
runners.spotlight: Comfortably landed a Bath maiden (5.7f, good) for Jack Channon exactly one year ago, but out of the frame in all five outings since including on stable debut over 6f here (first-time hood) last month; may appreciate the extra furlong on breeding, though, so worth considering.

quotes.race: Daily Price Boosts At Yeeehaaa.Bet British EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands C/D) (Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: Spirited Dancer showed a lot of promise at Kempton but it was a non-event when she was unbalanced here next time. Jack and the team have been happy with her at home and I came here expecting a big run. She delivered - Eddie Greatrex, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: She won her maiden at Bath in May. She ran in the big sales race won by The Dragon King at Newmarket on Saturday, finishing down the field. She's a sweet filly who does everything well. 10-10-24

runners.name: Jersey Maverick
runners.owner: Tim Cottier, Clark, Spence And Fellowes
runners.comment: Has 4l to find with Warrnambool on last month's return over C&D; more needed
runners.spotlight: Showed ability on a couple of occasions last autumn, but has 4l to find with Warrnambool on last month's return over C&D (first-time cheekpieces); more needed.

runners.name: Bear Island
runners.owner: T G Roddick & W P Churchward
runners.comment: Fourth in three starts at two, including twice here; may have needed reappearance; hood on
runners.spotlight: Showed ability in finishing fourth in all three starts last year, the first two over 7f/1m here; gelded in the autumn and didn't get home on his handicap debut/return at Nottingham (1m, good) last month, but a player if coming on for the outing with a hood now given a go.

runners.name: Beltadaay
runners.comment: Won Leicester nursery in October; half-brother to a Polytrack winner; worth a second look
runners.spotlight: Having been gelded he improved plenty on previous form when making all and winning easily on nursery debut at Leicester (7f, heavy) in October; ran as though last month's Beverley return was needed and this half-brother to a Polytrack winner is worth a second look.

runners.name: Noble Guest
runners.breeder: Boyce Bloodstock & Mrs C E Percival
runners.comment: Unplaced all seven starts, but has hinted at ability and this is a drop in grade
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all seven starts, but has hinted at ability and this is a drop in grade; not dismissed entirely.

runners.name: Penelope Valentine
runners.comment: Won easily over C&D in February and ran with credit when fourth last time; respected
runners.spotlight: Paid dearly for her emphatic win over C&D in February with an 8lb rise, but she ran with credit when fourth of 12 off 1lb higher than today at Leicester (7f, good) last time, so this mark may not be beyond her; respected.

runners.name: Kosometsuke
runners.owner: A Bintouq, C Fahy & R & S Marchant
runners.comment: Makes handicap debut after seven months off; well worth monitoring in the market
runners.spotlight: Modest form in three starts over 6f on turf/Polytrack last autumn, but is bred to be much better than that and now makes his handicap debut after seven months off having been gelded in the meantime; represents a leading yard and well worth monitoring in the market.

7:00.race_name: Unibet Zero% Mission Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: American Treasure
runners.comment: Has shown ability in two 6f AW runs but needs a good step forward to take this
runners.spotlight: She has run to a fair level in two 6f runs this year but she's drawn widest and needs a good step forward for the extra furlong.

runners.name: Bijoux
runners.comment: Debut win has taken some knocks; held under a penalty here last month; down in trip
runners.spotlight: The form of her debut win at Southwell (1m) in March has taken some knocks since and she could only finish in midfield under her penalty here five weeks ago (again 1m); drops in trip and likely needs improvement for it.

runners.name: Sea Poetry
runners.comment: Drawn wide and penalised but there was a lot to like about her Newmarket win last year
runners.spotlight: Attracted support on her Newmarket debut last November (7f, good to soft) and landed the money with a hard-fought success; that form has received numerous boosts since and she's a leading candidate despite a 7lb penalty and a wide draw.

stable_tour.quote: She has a beautiful pedigree. Owen hasn't done a huge amount with her yet but she has the looks to be a good filly in due course. 02-08-24

runners.name: Al Joory
runners.comment: Too green to do herself justice on debut last October (7f, Tapeta); should do much better
runners.spotlight: Prominent in the betting ahead of her Southwell debut (7f) last October but she was far too green to do herself justice; bred to do much better and fancied runners from the stable aren't usually missed in the betting.

runners.name: Bevy
runners.comment: Well-beaten 125-1 shot on her debut last month (7f, AW); hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Well-beaten 125-1 shot on her debut last month (7f, AW); hard to fancy.

runners.name: Brecon Beacons
runners.comment: Half-sister to three winners, notably Oaks third Caernarfon; needs a market check
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; half-sister to winners Caernarfon (7f/1m including 2yo/Listed; third in Oaks; RPR 111), Dan's Dream (5.7f/7f including Group 3; 106) and Oksana Astankova (7f AW; 66); enough paper appeal to warrant a close look in the betting.

runners.name: Chilli Salt
runners.comment: Has seven winning siblings, two of them Black Type performers; a newcomer of some interest
runners.spotlight: Ninth foal; sister to 1m winner Jazz Scene (RPR 70), half-sister to six winners including Random Harvest (1m including Group 3; 112) and One Evening (1m3f/1m6f including AW/Listed; 108); dam 7f/1m winner (Listed; 111); lots to like on paper and she's one for the shortlist.

runners.name: Christmas Gift
runners.comment: Raced freely and unable to quicken on her debut last month; should do better in time
runners.spotlight: Inclined to overrace in a steadily run race on her debut at Chelmsford four weeks ago; could take a good step forward with that initial experience behind her.

runners.name: Day Of Grace
runners.comment: Half-sister to three winners out of a Group 3 winner; powerful stable; betting to guide
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; half-sister to winners Kinako Mochi (1m; RPR 81), Cowboy (1m3f AW; 72) and Irish Storm (Australian 1m3f); dam 7.4f/1m winner (including 2yo Group 3; 110); bred to have a bright future and the betting should be revealing.

runners.name: Karakula
runners.comment: Well held in two 7f runs in March; handicaps over further beckon
runners.spotlight: Dam was smart at 7f but she is by a stamina influence and, judged on her two runs in March, may not come into her own until handicapping over further.

runners.name: Parisian Phoenix
runners.breeder: A R W Marsh & Irish National Stud
runners.comment: 9,000euros half-sister to three winners; needs to be above average to make a winning debut
runners.spotlight: 9,000euros foal; seventh foal; half-sister to winners Masucci (7f-1m2f including AW/Hong Kong; RPR 92), Never In Paris (5f 2yo; 86) and Roman Encounter (5f 2yo; 77); dam a modest maiden; will need to be above average to make a winning debut.

runners.name: Renewal
runners.comment: 2nd to smart filly when last seen 314 days ago (7f, good); more to come but maybe over 1m+
runners.spotlight: Clear promise in two fillies events on turf last summer, chasing home the subsequent Listed winner/Group 3 placed Celestial Orbit at Haydock when last seen 314 days ago; more to come this year and respected, for all 1m+ is likely to suit better in time.

runners.name: Summer Heat
runners.comment: Half-sister to three winners (including Group 3); one to consider, especially if backed
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; half-sister to winners Ideal Beauty (French 5f/7f including 2yo/Group 3; RPR 108), Sidewalk (French 9.5f; 86) and Intelligentsia (6f 2yo; 82); dam 7f 2yo winner (including Listed; 98); appeal on paper and worth a market check.

runners.name: Time After Time
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs D R Guest & Mr & Mrs Jpm Main
runners.comment: Poor form in two AW fillies' maidens around the turn of the year; hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Poor form in two AW fillies' maidens around the turn of the year; hard to fancy.

7:10.race_name: Fontwell Christmas Parties - Book Now Handicap Hurdle
7:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 5.6) (Watered) (Rail Movements: All races +18yds)

runners.name: Super Sabre Sam
runners.comment: Hasn't look on that good a mark in handicaps but was beaten under 5l over C&D latest
runners.spotlight: Won his maiden here over 2m3f on soft; hasn't look on that good a mark in handicaps but was beaten under 5l over C&D last time in first-time cheekpieces; each-way claims.

runners.name: Golden Ambition
runners.comment: Had a break after his progress came to a sudden halt; respected despite no headgear
runners.spotlight: Followed up his C&D win on soft ground in October when pushed out to score at Lingfield (2m7f), and his second at Ascot was no backward step; Huntingdon was but he's had a break since then; the blinkers that had been working so well are now removed, but he's respected nevertheless.

runners.name: Decorated
runners.comment: Made all here last time on good; up 7lb but rated higher in the past
runners.spotlight: Has appreciated the return to hurdles and made pretty much all over 2m3f (good) here three weeks ago; up 7lb but rated higher in the past.

stable_tour.quote: He ran a really positive race at Warwick on his first attempt over fences. He finished fifth but we gave him a good run first time out and we took the cheekpieces off. We're going to Lingfield on Wednesday for a 0-110 race over 2m7½f. Hopefully he should run well with that outing under his belt. 18-12-24

runners.name: Miss Ireland
runners.comment: Bumper winner and second over hurdles; ran in snatches when tailed off on h'cap debut
runners.spotlight: Won her bumper here and nearly won a maiden for mares at Lingfield in February; however, hasn't always looked straightforward and ran in snatches when tailed off on handicap debut at Ascot.

runners.name: Danton
runners.comment: Out of sorts when last seen but does return from a break on a fair mark
runners.spotlight: Out of sorts when pulled up on last two appearances (chase/hurdle); does return from a break on a fair mark so difficult to dismiss.

runners.name: Lord Maher
runners.comment: Maiden hurdle winner in Ireland; hasn't shown much in Britain including a handicap
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner in Ireland; hasn't shown much in Britain including a good-ground handicap at this track; now in cheekpieces.

runners.name: Rockola
runners.comment: Dual winner and at least as good when a closing third at Ludlow; thereabouts
runners.spotlight: Won her first two handicaps at about 2m4f and at least as good when a closing third at Ludlow (2m5f, good to soft) 22 days ago; thereabouts.

quotes.race: Season Tickets On Sale Now Mares' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Rockola will be going up to three miles as she did all her best work at the finish. These Jukebox Jurys are very game - Nick Brown, syndicate organiser.

stable_tour.quote: She's a sister to Off The Jury and is the first horse I've had for Nick Brown. She's been working promisingly and made an encouraging start when keeping on for third in a junior bumper at Stratford. 10-11-23

5:35.race_name: Bet Clever BetGoodwin Mares' Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
5:35.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 5.6) (Watered) (Rail Movements: All races +18yds)

runners.name: The Secret Pearl
runners.comment: Rallied well to snatch narrow win at Market Rasen last month; leading contender
runners.spotlight: Creditable sixth of 15 in Grade 2 novices' handicap at Newbury (2m4f, good) in March and rallied well to snatch narrow win in Market Rasen maiden (2m, good) last month; leading contender.

runners.name: Crazy Maisie
runners.breeder: Oghill House Stud & Joseph M Burke

prev_owners.owner: T Snaith, G White & Giggle Factor

runners.comment: Has struggled on the Flat this year and did not achieve much on previous hurdling attempts
runners.spotlight: Struggled in basement-grade AW races this year and did achieve much on her two previous hurdling attempts; makes no appeal.

quotes.race: Wear Your Poppy With Pride Handicap
quotes.quote: The original plan was to go to Kempton on the 20th, but when they put this extra fixture on it was a no-brainer to come. Crazy Maisie went hurdling last year on soft ground and she had such a hard race at Huntingdon. She just went backwards from then onwards. She had a holiday for two or three months and she's come back all good - Mark Hoad, trainer.

runners.name: Elusive Feeling
runners.comment: Ran as though something was amiss in a Listed bumper; might fare better here
runners.spotlight: First foal from a fairly useful jumper; ran as though something was amiss in a Listed bumper in January but Ben Pauling evidently felt she was worth her place in that line-up; had wind op soon afterwards and is fitted with a tongue-tie for this hurdling debut; no surprise if she features

runners.name: Getaways Gift
runners.comment: Placed in a bumper last year but struggled on first two hurdling starts
runners.spotlight: Came second in good-ground Plumpton bumper 13 months ago but struggled on both hurdling starts last season and needs to take a big step forward here.

runners.name: Golden Echo
runners.comment: Flat winner who shaped with significant promise when fourth on first two hurdling starts
runners.spotlight: Won a low-grade Flat handicap last summer and shaped with significant promise on both hurdling starts this year, more recently when fourth at Chepstow (2m, good) last month; one to consider.

runners.name: Oh My Guinness
runners.comment: Tailed off when a big-priced outsider for soft-ground Kempton bumper on debut in February
runners.spotlight: Tailed off when a big-priced outsider for soft-ground Kempton bumper on debut in February; can only be watched on hurdling debut.

runners.name: She Is For Me Boys
runners.comment: Irish point winner; no match for winner when second on rules debut; still a possible here
runners.spotlight: Joined Jamie Snowden after small-field Irish point win in October; no match for very easy winner when second of five on last month's hurdling debut at Plumpton (2m4f, good) but has possibilities here if she comes on for the run.

runners.name: Aquifolia
runners.comment: Lowly rated Flat maiden; struggled from fairly early stage on recent hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: Lowly rated Flat maiden who was struggling from a fairly early stage on her recent hurdling debut.

runners.name: La Trattaria
runners.comment: Showed some ability on second of two French hurdling starts; back from a year off today
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability when fifth of nine in slow-ground French hurdle a year ago, her second start, but has fitness to prove on this British debut; considered only if lively in the betting.

6:40.race_name: BetGoodwin Free Bet Nose Losers Novices' Handicap Chase
6:40.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 5.6) (Watered) (Rail Movements: All races +18yds)

runners.name: Bread And Butter
runners.comment: Chase mark is 13lb lower than hurdle rating but that's for good reason
runners.spotlight: Did well over hurdles during the winter when successful three times but he made it 0-9 over fences when tailed off at Market Rasen in February and has since left Olly Murphy; chase mark is 13lb lower than hurdle rating but that's for good reason.

quotes.race: Trustatrader Apply Today Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Bread And Butter is thriving and Lewis [Saunders] gave him a lovely ride today. There's only one winning post on heavy ground, so there's no point being in front at the top of the home straight. The wind op has helped him and I think it's boosted his confidence as much as anything as he has come down the weights from where he was. The race did fall apart too - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: www.roscommonracecourse.ie Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Bread And Butter got a lovely tow into the race and did it well. I thought the handicapper might have been a bit hard on him after the last day! There's a 0-123 over 2m5f at Galway that we might look at - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

runners.name: Fortunate Fella
runners.comment: Looks set to make a better chaser after finishing a close second over C&D three weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden but looks set to make a better chaser after finishing a close second over C&D three weeks ago (good); stayed on well that day from off the pace and might well go one better.

runners.name: Rock On Rita
runners.comment: Fakenham winner in March but poor next time and has become a hard mare to predict
runners.spotlight: Turned things around when winning a small-field chase at Fakenham (2m5f, good to soft) in March but back in modest mode at Bangor; has become a hard mare to predict.

runners.name: Daring Plan
runners.owner: Miss Jane Edgar & D V Gardner
runners.comment: Better hurdler than chaser, though last attempt in this discipline was better; had wind op
runners.spotlight: Ran a little better in his fourth chase but hurdle form remains his best and yet disappointed back in that scene last time; perhaps wind surgery can assist with his revival bid.

runners.name: Bruce Gobbler
runners.comment: 0-7 over hurdles but fair runs the last twice; pedigree points to improvement over fences
runners.spotlight: Maiden under rules but he did keep galloping on his final two runs over hurdles, at 2m and 2m3f; pedigree points to improvement over fences.

runners.name: Ultra Viers
runners.comment: Running okay off reduced mark and didn't seem to get home over 3m last time
runners.spotlight: 0-19 under rules but hasn't been running too badly off his reduced mark and didn't seem to get home over 3m last time; not ruled out.

runners.name: Lunar Ocean
runners.comment: Consistent in four handicap chases for this yard (2m3f-3m) and he's able when fresh
runners.spotlight: All four runs for current yard have been in handicap chases and ran respectably in all of them (2m3f-3m); able when fresh, and aids in which he has been effective are now combined.

runners.name: Ceejaybe
runners.comment: Rallied into third over C&D last time and finished right up behind Fortunate Fella
runners.spotlight: A maiden who can pick up a race sometime soon after his rallying third over C&D 20 days ago, finishing right up behind Fortunate Fella.

7:40.race_name: Unique Weddings At Fontwell Park Handicap Chase
7:40.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 5.6) (Watered) (Rail Movements: All races +18yds)

runners.name: Romanor
runners.comment: Promising return here (2m3.5f) last month; was staying on that day and now drops in trip
runners.spotlight: Multiple chase wins at 2m-2m5f; didn't get going last year but offered much more on his recent return from a 325-day break, staying on to be beaten just over 2l here (extended 2m3f, good); may sharpen up for that but needs to prove this shorter trip still suits these days.

quotes.race: Play Low6 Picks At low6.com Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Romanor has got to be ridden like that, he just wants to run away with you the whole time, so you have just got to ride him chilly effectively and do everything as late as possible. For some reason he absolutely adores this place - Danny Sansom, jockey.

quotes.race: starsportsbet.co.uk Handicap
quotes.quote: It worked out well in the end. Romanor was a bit keen early and then the pace quickened and he was caught a bit flat footed. It was only in the last 100 yards I thought he'd win but if he hadn't wasted the energy earlier he'd have won easier. He got a bit agitated on the way down but he went on the ground. He'll make a nice jumper for someone - Jamie Spencer, jockey.

runners.name: Hatos
runners.comment: Continues to struggle, last time outpaced over further; career-low mark the only plus
runners.spotlight: Best form for this yard when third at Wincanton (about 2m, good to soft) in November, when first-time cheekpieces were added to his tongue tie, but hasn't been able to back up that performance, including when blinkered and outpaced over further at this track last time; continues to drop in the weights but others are preferred.

quotes.race: Play Coral Racing Super Series For Free Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: I think having a hurdle in front of him was beneficial to Hatos and what pleased me was he ran right to the line, whereas in his bumper he was maybe a bit one-paced and weakened. He ground it out today when it got tough. He loves that ground, the heavier the better. I think it's important to him because he travels so easily on it. He could be a really nice two-mile heavy-ground chaser in the future. He's a lovely straightforward horse and we might go for a similar race with a penalty. We'll see where his hurdling takes us, but I love that two-mile heavy-ground chase division - Anthony Honeyball, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely young horse who made an encouraging start to his hurdling career when winning at Chepstow in January. Unfortunately he sustained a small puncture wound on that occasion which kept him off for the rest of the season. I sent him up to Hexham in April but he simply could not handle the unique undulations of the course. Hopefully he can build on his chasing debut at Chepstown last week when he finished well beaten. I always had it in my mind that soft/heavy is what he needs to be at his best as he has a good cruising speed on those conditions. 30-11-22

runners.name: Rocks Up Late
runners.comment: Won with something to spare last time and probably tough to beat under the penalty
runners.spotlight: Left Tom Ellis for £1,000 in February and that looked money well spent on his stable/chase debut at Worcester (about 2m, good) last week, winning with something to spare in a newly applied tongue tie; 3lb well in under his penalty and he's got strong claims of following up.

runners.name: Pleasure Garden
runners.owner: H J Jarvis & Mrs P Jarvis

prev_owners.owner: Charles C Walker - Osborne House II

runners.comment: Bit more last time but needs to take another firm step forward from out of the weights
runners.spotlight: Finished second in this off 11lb higher in 2023; beaten about 42l on his first two starts this year but took a step back in the right direction when third at Plumpton (2m1f, good) last month; needs more.

runners.name: Fox Wallace
runners.comment: Comfortably made all a week ago and she's 7lb well in despite the penalty; must go well
runners.spotlight: Found her form of late, building on placed efforts at Taunton and Hereford when comfortably making all, from 8lb out of the weights, in a mares' race at Stratford (2m1f, good) one week ago; despite her penalty she's effectively just 1lb higher and officially 7lb well in; another bold bid on the cards.

6:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 5.6) (Watered) (Rail Movements: All races +18yds)

runners.name: Light Dragoon
runners.comment: Flopped on his handicap debut (off since) but previous promise makes him of firm interest
runners.spotlight: Promising third on his hurdles debut last July and he opened his account (also Worcester, 2m, good) seven weeks later; flopped on his handicap debut at Southwell in early October, however, when quick ground was blamed; off since but he retains a fair bit of potential for a yard that's won with four of its last six runners.

runners.name: Mount Olympus
runners.comment: Much better when narrowly beaten at Fakenham and he's open to progress now handicapping
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way when weakening on his first two starts over hurdles but much better when he bustled up a gambled-on winner at Fakenham (2m, good to soft) in March; four-time Flat winner who's open to progress now handicapping for his in-form yard.

quotes.race: Racing TV Club Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Mount Olympus travelled around nicely and surprised at the two-furlong pole at how he picked up. He'd shown glimpses of promise previously and the step up in trip clearly suited - Tom Marquand, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's won three times on the Flat for us and finished third at Kempton off a career-high mark. He's done plenty of schooling and will be out over hurdles next month, probably at two miles. 10-11-23

runners.name: Sambezi
runners.breeder: Alban Chevalier Du Fau Et Al
runners.comment: Tends to go well here but the losing run is stacking up; not the percentage call
runners.spotlight: Dual course winner, including at this trip (good to soft), but without a win since May 2023; inconsistent this year, a respectable run over C&D (good) in March coming in between two lesser efforts, including when favourite last time; tends to go well here but probably not the percentage call.

stable_tour.quote: He had an improved run when eighth at Chepstow last time. He's dropped 1lb and we'll bring him back down to his own handicap level, where hopefully he can get his head in front again. He was running in a 0-115 race last time and it was encouraging. 18-12-24

runners.name: Thankyouandplease
runners.breeder: Sarl Igep Haras Du Chateau De Rabodanges
runners.comment: Caught the eye on his handicap debut and he's open to improvement; interesting contender
runners.spotlight: Caught the eye on handicap debut at Newton Abbot (2m1f, heavy) last time, finishing on the tails of the principals and shaping like he had more to offer; this forecast surface will be very different but he's an interesting contender who's open to improvement; non-runner at Newton Abbot yesterday.

runners.name: Stanley Pincombe
runners.comment: Tailed off in a first-time visor (now ditched) over C&D last time; plenty of work to do
runners.spotlight: Placed off 13lb higher over C&D (good to soft) on seasonal debut in September but ended 2024 with some lesser efforts and he was tailed off after a 102-day break here last month; first-time visor swiftly ditched.

runners.name: Tommy Dillion
runners.comment: Struggling badly over fences and this return to hurdles needs to a spark a big revival
runners.spotlight: Did win a heavy-ground hurdle race at Lingfield in 2022 and his third at Plumpton (2m1f, soft) in April 2023, his last start in this discipline, was a respectable effort; it's been a real struggle over fences since, however, and he's plenty to prove returned to this sphere.

8:10.race_name: Give Generously To The Snowdrop Trust Open National Hunt Flat Race (Cat 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
8:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 5.6) (Watered) (Rail Movements: All races +18yds)

runners.name: Anothermanicmonday
runners.comment: £4,000 3yo; family of high-class Accordion Etoile; yard not known for bumper wins; debut
runners.spotlight: £4,000 3yo; Masterstroke gelding; fifth foal; half-brother to winners Bagheera Ginge (2m2f-2m5f hurdle/chase), Champ Is Real (3m chase) and Prime Pretender (point); dam maiden, out of unraced sister to high-class 2m hurdle/chase winner Accordion Etoile; yard only has the occasional bumper winner and he's likely one for further down the line.

runners.name: Constellation Walk
runners.comment: 8-1 but tailed off for his debut in November; irregular heartbeat an excuse; can do better
runners.spotlight: £95,000 3yo; half-brother to 2m3f chase/2m5f hurdle winner Menaggio; 8-1 and hooded for his debut when beaten over 140l at Chepstow (good to soft) in November; was subsequently found to have an irregular heartbeat and he can surely do better.

runners.name: Hard Stare
runners.comment: 7-1 when only 9th in a valuable Newbury bumper in March; that form still sets the standard
runners.spotlight: £20,000 3yo who easily landed the odds in a point bumper at Larkhill in January; 7-1 but beaten nearly 20l when ninth on his rules debut at Newbury (also good; led before weakening) in March; that was a valuable event, however, and he still sets the standard on that form; tongue tie goes on.

runners.name: The Boss Bear
runners.comment: 7-1 and came home well on his Huntingdon debut last month; open to plenty of progress
runners.spotlight: 17,000euros foal from the family of jumps legend Tiger Roll; 7-1 and he came home strongly when second at Huntingdon (good; fourth has won a maiden hurdle since) on his debut last month; open to progress and he's firmly on the shortlist.

runners.name: Shes A Woman
runners.comment: 125-1 and beaten 37l on her introduction at Warwick in March; others preferred
runners.spotlight: 125-1 and always behind when beaten 37l on her introduction at Warwick in March; others preferred.

runners.name: Flying Pimpernel
runners.breeder: Mill House Stud & Mrs Kathy Stuart
runners.comment: Well related (including bumpers) and yard does well in this sphere; contender on debut
runners.spotlight: Elusive Pimpernel filly; first foal; dam unraced half-sister to three winners including Sunshade (useful bumper/2m-2m4f hurdle) and Rapid Flight (useful 2m4f-3m1f hurdle/chase), out of unraced half-sister to bumper and smart 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase winner Close Touch; trainer has a strong 25% strike-rate in bumpers over the last five years and she looks a likely type on this debut.

runners.name: Bel Amigo

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie Team Spirit, Jacques Detre & Patrice Detre
Ecurie Team Spirit, Patrice Detre & Jacques Detre

runners.comment: Improved since wind op, winning 3 novices, latest over 2m3f; chance but sharp 2m a concern
runners.spotlight: Has shown marked improvement since wind surgery, winning three novice races at Carlisle, the first two over 2m1f (good/good to soft) and the latest over 2m3f (good) when scoring by 16l; interesting back in a handicap, although this sharp 2m may not be ideal.

quotes.race: Pauline Phizacklea Memorial Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was obviously his race to lose. Bel Amigo was very impressive when he won a claiming chase in France and was very disappointing in his first two starts for us but it was obviously his wind. That's two runs in 14 days so we'll let him catch his breath and we may find something for him at Perth - Nick Alexander, trainer.

runners.name: Kinbara Firstdraft
runners.comment: Two h'cap wins last term, the first over C&D on fast ground; fair run latest; chance
runners.spotlight: Won two handicaps last season, the first over C&D in June (good to firm), the second off 6lb lower over 2m4f at Ayr in November (good); creditable second to an improver at Down Royal on latest start (2m4f, good); chance

runners.name: Evaluation
runners.comment: Useful on the Flat; not as good over hurdles (won at Ayr on debut); each-way chance
runners.spotlight: Useful Flat performer (second in the 2024 Northumberland Plate); not as good over hurdles so far, winning over 2m at Ayr on debut in November (good; first run after wind surgery) and last time finishing runner-up at Kelso (2m, good); quite interesting on h'cap debut.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Series Stayers Handicap
quotes.quote: It depends what mark Evaluation ends up with but there's a staying race at the Sunday Series at Musselburgh in two weeks and as long as he's okay from a handicapping point of view he'll go there - Keith Dalgleish, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was a very good second in the Northumberland Plate this year and we'll get a move on with hurdling now. He's very exciting. 30-10-24

runners.name: Mack The Man
runners.comment: Ayr winner off 10lb in November (good); below par since, including last time; bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Exposed; goes well on testing ground but latest win (off 10lb higher) was on good ground at Ayr in November (2m) when returning from a break; beaten 20l when eighth over C&D last month (good to soft; blinkers replaced regular visor); visor back on today; well handicapped, but a bit to prove.

quotes.race: Go North Sea Pigeon Hurdle Series Final (A Handicap Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mack The Man has had some good days in the past and it's great that he's had another one now. Nick Alexander, trainer.

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Handicap Hurdle (Qualifier For The Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Final)
quotes.quote: Mack The Man has gone and got a bit of confidence and this was a lovely little race to come back over hurdles in. He hasn't really liked the ground but his class has got him through it. He was just too clever over fences and that lost him a bit of ground, he was never a bad jumper. That was good. I couldn't see why we can't go to a good handicap with him -  Adam Wedge, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's another who lost his way but, on his day, he's good. I hope we can get him back - he's fresh and well and doing lots of different things. We'll try to keep him sweet and we'd be delighted if he could get competitive and win another race. 26-10-22

He's been fantastic and is now at a mark of 120. When he was with Evan Williams he peaked at 132, so there might be a little bit more to come even though he's ten. He seems to be loving life. Kit, my son, rides him and seems to get on well with him. He places him. He might be entered for a race at Haydock next weekend, a £50,000 handicap over 2m3f that I had in mind for Ginger Mail. He can run in the better races and he's proved that in the past as he finished placed in some decent handicap hurdles. Kit likes to aim high. We thought he wanted further than 2m but when we stuck at the trip and put on the visor he was a bit of a revelation. He's a very quirky horse. When he won at Ayr the other day people said Kit gave him a great ride for kicking on with him in the back straight, but he said it was the horse and he had no choice. We'll try him at a higher level and hope he's competitive. 21-11-24

runners.name: Just Dottie
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner last term; career-high mark but stable in form and an obvious contender
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner last season, the first a mares' handicap in May, the latest off 9lb lower in April (beat a previous winner by 13l); on a career-high mark but stable in fine form; eye-catching jockey booking and an obvious contender.

quotes.race: DM Hall Surveyors Mares' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I'm very happy that we've got Just Dottie to win it for the second year running. She's done everything right again today. When I've asked her to pick up between the last two she really has and she's gone away and won quite nicely - Ben Smith, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: She was fifth on her first run back following a 227-day break at Perth last time and, if you listened to the commentary, you'd say she was something of an eyecatcher. She goes to Perth again on Thursday in the race she won last year and she should go well. 16-05-24

runners.name: Simple Star
runners.comment: Gained first hurdles win in C&D h'cap last July; below par last time; should fare better
runners.spotlight: Off the mark over hurdles in a C&D handicap last July (good); some fair Flat runs since, but was shade disappointing back over hurdles after racing too freely when only ninth over C&D last month (Cuban Cigar seventh, Mack the Man eighth); should fare better.

quotes.race: AEJ Facilities Management Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We were very disappointed last week at Carlisle so Doreen [Monteith, owner] said let's try Simple Star back over hurdles. He was a little star for us last year on the Flat. He came back this season and ran a great race at Musselburgh and then I think it was trainer error putting him into tracks that started with a downhill and he just got too keen. Hopefully, he'll be back at Musselburgh at the end of the Flat season - Dianne Sayer, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Cuban Cigar
runners.comment: 3-32 over hurdles; C&D second off 14lb higher in September; not progress; others stronger
runners.spotlight: Exposed 7yo who is 3-32 over hurdles; runner-up over C&D off a 14lb higher mark in September (visor tried) but didn't build on that, including with blinkers which are on again here; fair run last time but others look stronger.

quotes.race: bet365 Juvenile Hurdle (Go North Grey Bomber Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Cuban Cigar is a cracking little horse. We bought him privately and the aim was the Go North Final at Musselburgh but he could go to Cheltenham for the Triumph Hurdle now. He was very well trained with Richard Hannon and I was very pleased with him today - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

2:50.race_name: DM Hall Surveyors Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Peejaybee
runners.breeder: Scea Ecurie Brindor & Scea Du Claux
runners.comment: Course winner; back to winning way last time at Ffos Las; interesting off 5lb higher
runners.spotlight: Course winner here last September (2m4f, good); back to winning ways last time at Ffos Las (3m, good to soft); interesting contender off this 5lb higher mark.

quotes.race: Racing TV Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was pleasing from Peejaybe and he'll come on for it. I thought the trip was probably going to be a bit sharp for him but he's done it well. I hope this will be a stepping stone to another novice somewhere and we'll see how we go - Richard Spencer, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He goes for the Challenger Staying Chase Series final at Warwick on Thursday. He qualified for it when second at Market Rasen in January. He wasn't right after the last meeting, he was a little bit sore and had a cough but if he gets up to Warwick fresh and well he'll run nicely. 26-03-25

runners.name: Whistleinthedark
runners.comment: Won four in a row at up to 2m5f two seasons ago; fair run two starts back; bit to prove
