runners.spotlight: Won four chases on the trot at up to 2m5f two seasons ago, including over 2m4f here (good); hasn't won since, but fair effort when second at Warwick two runs ago (2m4f, soft); not so good with cheekpieces (left off here) back on last time; has form at 3m; overall a bit to prove.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Whistleinthedark has been going well since he went chasing and I was hopeful coming here today. He's been progressive and I think he'll go to Aintree next month for a handicap - Laura Morgan, trainer.

quotes.race: Tysers Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought turning in I'd win well. Didn't jump the last well but didn't lose any ground and I thought Whistleinthedark would go away away and win well but he's had to dig deep - Brendan Powell, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He joined us this season and his two runs have been encouraging. He finished a half-length second at Ayr and on Boxing Day put that experience to good use with an easy win in a 2m5½f handicap chase at Market Rasen. He's much better over fences than hurdles and is going to give us a lot of fun, although his 12lb hike in the handicap is not going to help. 18-01-23

runners.name: Saint Arvans

prev_owners.owner: D Carr And Miss A P Lee

runners.comment: Last win was over C&D in June 2023 (good); on a good mark; needs to improve on recent form
runners.spotlight: Good-ground performer; last win was over C&D in June 2023 (good); some fair efforts since; back on a decent mark; needs to improve on recent efforts.

runners.name: Kandor
runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Biraben & A Gilibert
runners.comment: Won hurdle here in 2024; best of 4 chase runs when 1.75l fourth over C&D latest; contender
runners.spotlight: Won a novice hurdle here last July (2m4f, good); four runs over fences, best effort when 1.75l fourth of eight over C&D last time (good to soft); contender.

runners.name: No Regrets
runners.comment: Kelso win in visor last March; bit disappointing since; needs to bounce back after a break
runners.spotlight: Beat Everyday Champagne (5lb better off) when winning at Kelso last May (2m7f, good; visored for the first time); bit disappointing since (tailed off last of two at Ayr on latest start in November); needs to bounce back after a break.

stable_tour.quote: He ran a good race when third at Southwell early this month. He blew up a bit after aeak and it wouldn't be his track either. Hopefully he might go a couple of places better next time. He's still a novice but has a good bit of experience and should win his share of races. 25-10-23

runners.name: Fete Champetre
runners.comment: Three fair races for new trainer; could go well but stamina to prove on first try at 3m
runners.spotlight: Ex-Rose Dobbin; has run three fair races for new trainer (in front when falling two out at Ayr in March); could go well but stamina to prove on first run at 3m.

quotes.race: tote.co.uk Four Calling Birds Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: When Fete Champetre won his novice hurdle we had quite high hopes for him but he's not quite lived up to that unfortunately. He's had his issues and Rose has been very patient with him and given him every chance, so it's great to repay that by winning on him. Rose is ill today so can't be here but she'll be watching at home cheering on -  Jockey Craig Nichol speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Fete Champetre is a nice horse, he won his bumper well at Kelso and we love him. We've schooled him over loads of fences to bring him back on his hocks a bit and it's worked. He's improved a hell of a lot from his last run and I hope he'll be a three-mile chaser next year. As long as the ground is all right he could run again this season - Tony Dobbin, trainer's husband.

runners.name: Everyday Champagne
runners.comment: In good form last summer (2nd twice here) but rather lost his way and pulled up last twice
runners.spotlight: In good form last summer, finishing runner-up over C&D in June/July; has rather lost his way since and has plenty to prove having been pulled up on last two starts, latest here last month.

quotes.race: Invades Loves Ayr Handicap Chase (Go North Monet's Garden Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Everyday Champagne wants nice ground and I thought today would be too sharp for him. He arrived in great fettle from Nicky (Richards) and I don't really know how much he'll come on for it as I don't know him well enough to tell you to be honest - Nick Alexander, trainer, speaking to RTV

stable_tour.quote: He was very good when winning on his first start for us at Ayr - we made plenty of use of him and he did it very nicely. He arrived in great order from Nicky Richards and we're lucky the owners wanted to put him closer to where they live. I don't know him terribly well yet, but I think he wants three miles. I put the cheekpieces on him at Ayr to sharpen him up because he was running over two and a half. There's a nice three-mile chase back at Ayr on the first Monday of December and that's where we'd like to go. 22-11-23

runners.name: Hay Meadow
runners.comment: Point/bumper/hurdle winner; unlucky on h'cap debut over C&D latest; one with a chance
runners.spotlight: Point winner (3m, heavy); won a bumper here in September and off the mark over hurdles in a mares' novice at Ayr in March (2m4f, good); ran well over C&D on handicap debut last month (good to soft; unseated rider after the last when disputing the lead); up 4lb; chance.

runners.name: Wasdell Dundalk
runners.owner: Abbadis Racing & D A Harrison Racing
runners.comment: For chase wins over 3m here; fair second over fences latest; others look stronger
runners.spotlight: Has won four 3m handicaps over fences here on ground ranging from good to heavy; won twice over fences on the better ground in the autumn and was a fair second at Ayr when last seen out in January (3m, soft); pulled up in bad ground on latest hurdle run; others preferred.

quotes.race: Paul Ferguson's Jumpers To Follow David Whitaker Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's absolutely fantastic to notch a hat-trick with Wasdell Dundalk. We freshened him up after we bought him and he goes to the beach occasionally as part of his training and seems to be enjoying the job again. He's a really easy horse to train and a lovely character. I wasn't sure about the heavy ground for him but he handled it - Lisa Harrison, trainer.

runners.name: Park Annonciade
runners.comment: Course winner; mixed form last term; 2m4f on good perhaps ideal so could go well
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m novice here in August 2023; mixed form over hurdles/fences last season and below par on last two starts, latest at Ayr last month (3m, good to soft); 2m4f on good ground perhaps ideal, though.

quotes.race: Best Odds On The Betfair Exchange Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Park Annonciade was very good. He took me there easily and he jumped two out and the last superbly - Ben Bromley, jockey.

runners.name: Go Go Chicago
runners.owner: Where It All Began Paul Hanagan
runners.comment: 2m2f novice winner last June; two fair runs since; unexposed and worth considering
runners.spotlight: Won a Stratford novice for the Killahena/McPherson stable last June (2m2f, good); placed in two novices since, latest at Kelso last month (2m2f, good; first run since October); unexposed; worth considering.

runners.name: Frisby
runners.owner: Hold My Beer, B Hague, M Lee & A Duffus

prev_owners.owner: Hold My Beer, B Hague, M Lee & Partner
Hold My Beer, B Hague & Partner

runners.comment: Irish point winner; in the frame all three starts over hurdles; may improve on h'cap debut
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner in December 2023 (3m, heavy); in the frame on all three starts over hurdles, last month finishing 11l third in a C&D maiden (good to soft); may improve on handicap debut.

stable_tour.quote: He's ready to run and we're looking forward to getting him back. He's done well and we're very happy with him. His second on his debut in an Ayr bumper has worked out very well as the well-regarded winner has won again since. We're going hurdling with him, but he's a staying chaser in the making. We've been patient with him because he hasn't had his ground as he wants it really soft. 11-12-24

runners.name: Artic Row

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Trevor Hemmings

runners.comment: Last three wins have been over fences (has won over hurdles); not been in top form
runners.spotlight: Last three wins have been in 2m4f handicap chases at Ayr, although won a 2m Ayr novice handicap over hurdles in March 2023 (good); hasn't been in top form over fences on last three starts and probably best watched this time.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Digital Solutions Handicap Chase (Go North Monet's Garden Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Artic Row is an improving young horse who jumps well and he's one to look forward to. He won at the track last time and likes decent ground. He'll make a nice staying chaser next year - Nick Alexander, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had an unfortunate start to the season when he unseated at the first at Hexham and then fell at Ayr. He loves that track and we want to try him over 3m as I don't think staying that trip will be a problem. I want to get a completion and hopefully a win under his belt and then make a plan after that. He's a strong traveller and I don't see why he can't compete at a higher level. 21-11-24

runners.name: Summergrounds
runners.comment: Progressive 9yo; three wins last term, latest at Ayr in April; career-high mark; contender
runners.spotlight: Progressive 9yo who won three races last season, the latest at Ayr in April when coming late to win by a neck (2m4f, good to soft); creditable second over C&D in September; on a career-high mark (3lb higher than last time); contender.

quotes.race: Racing Post Go North Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Summergrounds is a consistent little horse and he loves this ground. Danny gave him a great ride, they were getting at it and he just took his time - Nicky Richards, trainer.

runners.name: Belle Of Annandale
runners.comment: Two hurdles wins in 2023; bit disappointing last term but well handicapped as a result
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m maiden here and a 1m7f novice at Musselburgh in 2023; bit disappointing in handicaps at up to 3m last season but well handicapped as a result.

runners.name: Cracking Destiny

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Louise Whillans & King for a Day
Mrs Louise Whillans & King for a Day

runners.comment: Placed at Kelso last month, after a break, but is nothing like the force of old
runners.spotlight: Placed at Kelso (2m4f, good) last month, after a break, and also suited by this C&D but he is nothing like the force of old; younger rivals have more appealing profiles.

quotes.race: Prince Philip Perpetual Challenge Trophy Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Cracking Destiny would run well but I didn't think he had that in him. Craig said they went quick early on and it played to his strengths, as he sits off the pace and needs them to go fast over two miles - Ewan Whillans, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Healthy Pets Chase (A Novices' Limited Handicap)
quotes.quote: Cracking Destiny's come to life in handicaps and jumps fences really well. He's a horse we'll try to win a couple more with and will probably go to a dispersal sale at the end of the season, but that's because the owners want top, top horses and Gold Cup winners. Cracking Destiny won't be that, but he'll do a good job and will have a great time until May - Ryan Tongue, racing manager to Mike Grech and Stuart Pakin, owners.

runners.name: Stumps Or Slips
runners.comment: Won very comfortably on recent stable debut and is 7lb ahead of the handicapper here
runners.spotlight: Rewarded strong market support on stable debut at Ffos Las (2m5f, good) nine days ago, making smooth headway from off the pace before winning very comfortably by 9l; 7lb ahead of the handicapper under 7lb penalty here; makes very obvious appeal.

runners.name: Leitrim Chief
runners.comment: Ended last season in poor form for James Ewart; needs to have been refreshed by new regime
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden who signed off for James Ewart with two poor runs in headgear (now removed) in February/March; makes stable debut from a tempting mark but needs to have been revitalised by his new regime and is untested on ground this quick.

runners.name: We Got Your Back
runners.comment: Dual 2m winner during winter and ran a big race in defeat over 2m4f last month; respected
runners.spotlight: Won twice at around 2m on soft ground during the winter and gave another very good account when close/clear second at Southwell (2m4f, good) last month; can make his presence felt again.

runners.name: Sword Of Fate

prev_owners.owner: Galloping On The South Downs Partnership

runners.comment: Veteran; suited by this C&D and will find this much easier than last couple of assignments
runners.spotlight: Veteran who is suited by good ground and gained three of his ten chase wins at this track; out of form since returning this spring from a break but will find this much easier than last couple of assignments and has each-way claims if first-time cheekpieces give him a lift.

quotes.race: Betfair #racingstaff Week Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Sword Of Fate had to come here after his Stratford win the other night as it was the last time he would have been off his old mark as he is due to go up 6lb. He has now had two runs in four days so he will have a little break and be back in three weeks or so - Tom Lacey, trainer.

quotes.race: Central Roofing South Wales "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: We did not really want to run Sword Of Fate so quickly after his win here last week, but this looked too good an opportunity to miss. He wants this ground and when the rain comes he will be off on his holidays until next spring - Tom Lacey, trainer.

quotes.race: 7bets4free.com EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Sword Of Fate was weak last year, but he loved that ground and we like him - Tom Lacey, trainer.

runners.name: Reflection Of You
runners.breeder: Mrs S C Welch & Mr A King
runners.comment: 0-5 over hurdles but not beaten far in her two handicaps; may improve over fences
runners.spotlight: 0-5 over hurdles last season but wasn't beaten far in her two handicaps (3m/2m4f) and her winning Irish point debut in 2023 bodes well for her prospects on this chasing debut.

runners.name: Tanking Along
runners.comment: Remains lightly raced but has made a low-key start to his chasing career
runners.spotlight: Fell on chase/handicap debut in February and has been safely held both starts since (2m4f/3m); remains lightly raced but needs to improve.

stable_tour.quote: A giant of a horse, he's 17.3 hands and one of the biggest I've ever had. He had a lovely run last time when third at Wetherby. He's only five and is a big baby. You won't see the best of him until he goes over fences. He'll run at Christmas time and it could be in a chase. 11-12-24

runners.name: A Place Apart

prev_owners.owner: Abbadis Racing & D A Harrison Racing
Abbadis Racing & D A Harrison Racing

runners.comment: Absent since pulled up on consecutive outings in autumn 2023
runners.spotlight: Effectively on same mark as when runner-up to Sword Of Fate over C&D (good to soft) in summer 2023 but has been absent since pulled up on consecutive appearances that autumn.

quotes.race: Matchbook Betting Podcast Chase (A Novices' Limited Handicap)
quotes.quote: A Place Apart was good. Going that speed in a novice handicap on this ground caught a few out but not him and that's probably why he won it in the end. He was following the other horse out to his left and I don't think that will be a problem. He was probably the winner as he's the most straight forward of them - James Bowen, jockey.

quotes.race: Molson Coors Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: A Place Apart has eventually won a race and I'm thrilled. We went for a bit of a touch as a three-year-old in Limerick and he didn't quite get home. I thought he would have won races before now - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

2:18.race_name: Edinburgh Gin Classic Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Amdoinmebest
runners.comment: Safely held in three Irish points this spring; probably best watched on this rules debut
runners.spotlight: Safely held in three Irish points this spring; probably best watched on this rules debut.

runners.name: Chichester
runners.breeder: Mrs James Wigan & London TB Services Ltd
runners.comment: Smart at his best on the Flat; fair fourth over hurdles in February; should do better
runners.spotlight: Smart at his best on the Flat; made low-key start to hurdling career during the winter but positives can be drawn from his fourth at Musselburgh (1m7f, good to soft) in February and he ought to be better suited by the faster ground here.

quotes.race: Seat Unique Ganton Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Chichester did it well, didn't he? My only doubt before the race was the small field and there might not be much pace on but there was quite a strong gallop for a small field and that played to his strengths. He has no entries at Royal Ascot, we chose to come here instead of going there, and we'll wait and see where he runs next - Keith Dalgleish, trainer.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Kilkerran Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: That was a really good performance. They went a nice gallop and Chichester travelled round lovely. He really picked up when I asked him to and it was impressive. He's been very consistent, he's shown he's got the class and everything fell right for him today. It's exciting - Callum Rodriguez, rider.

quotes.race: Stablemate By AGMA Carlisle Bell Handicap
quotes.quote: They went a good gallop, which suited Chichester as I think he wants a bit further. He just does enough when he gets there and the cheekpieces helped a little bit. He's a nice horse for these big handicaps and I'm sure there's another one or two in him. He's straightforward and could go over any trip up to a mile and a quarter - Joe Fanning, jockey.

runners.name: Dapper Gent
runners.comment: Not favoured by today's weights but was consistent in early part of last season
runners.spotlight: Made the frame four consecutive times over hurdles in early part of last season, once over C&D (good to firm) off his lowly handicap mark; absent since September and not favoured by the weights today but might collect another minor prize.

runners.name: Dont Look Back

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late W G Young

runners.comment: 0-20 over hurdles, including several chances off lowly handicap marks
runners.spotlight: Won on the Flat in 2023 but is 0-20 over hurdles, including several chances off lowly handicap marks; difficult to enthuse over.

quotes.race: Pontefract And District Golf Club Ltd Handicap
quotes.quote: Bollin Margaret is in good form, she just needs everything to go right for her, she doesn't want too much daylight and to get there on the line. David Allan knows her really well - Tim Easterby, trainer.

runners.name: Drumlee Myth
runners.comment: Close second in bumper here in September but well beaten all three hurdle runs this year
runners.spotlight: Very close second in five-runner bumper here last September but well beaten on all three hurdling starts this year; has too much to prove.

runners.name: Gonnino
runners.comment: Belied 50-1 odds when fourth at Kelso last month and has each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Struggled on hurdling debut in December but fared much better and belied 50-1 odds when fourth of nine at Kelso (2m2f, good) last month; has each-way claims at least if able to build upon that recent effort.

runners.name: Kinbara Hills
runners.comment: Ran much better than eventual 37l defeat suggests in slow-ground handicap last month
runners.spotlight: 0-9 over hurdles but showed some fair form last year and shaped with considerably more promise than eventual 37l defeat might suggest when returning from break in slow-ground Fairyhouse handicap last month; back on a quicker surface and fitted with first-time tongue-tie here; shortlisted.

runners.name: Mosstown Mill

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Dolores Gleeson & Exors of the Late Gregory Jones

runners.comment: Won small-field Irish point last month but the form is not worth much
runners.spotlight: Displayed improvement to win four-runner Irish point last month (good ground) but the close second was a modest maiden hurdler under rules and the form is not worth much; makes stable/hurdle debut today.

runners.name: The Last Cloud
runners.comment: Went very close when finishing strongly at Catterick in February; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Improved with experience over hurdles last season and lost out by only a short head at Catterick (1m7f, good to soft) in February after finishing strongly; not sure to be suited by the faster ground here but still features prominently in calculations.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely, big horse we're looking forward to - we think a lot of him. Being by Cloudings, he's probably going to take time. He had a lovely first run in a maiden hurdle and I liked the way he stayed on and finished out his race. He's a great jumper and a staying chaser in the making. 11-12-24

runners.name: Keady Town
runners.comment: Has some fair Flat form on his CV but struggled when 100-1 for last month's hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: Has some fair Flat form on his CV but struggled when 100-1 for last month's hurdling debut; tongue-tie is now added.

runners.name: Cloudsareclearing
runners.comment: Showed no promise when a big-priced outsider for three maiden hurdles last season
runners.spotlight: Showed no promise when a big-priced outsider for three maiden hurdles last season; the added cheekpieces need to make a huge difference.

5:02.race_name: Edinburgh Gin Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Not For Passin
runners.comment: Second in an Irish point last month; half-brother to an AW bumper winner; contender
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in an Irish point on debut last month (3m, good to yielding); half-brother to an AW bumper winner and to a 1m4f-2m2f Flat winner; contender.

runners.name: Borders Eagle
runners.owner: J D Wright & Mrs S Wright
runners.comment: Well-beaten fifth of seven on Kelso debut (6-1) but is a likely improver
runners.spotlight: Didn't show a great deal when 25l fifth of seven in a Kelso bumper last month (2m, good; 6-1); likely improver.

runners.name: Ivans Legacy
runners.comment: Fourth of seven in a Hexham bumper in March (2m, good to soft; 15-2); should improve.
runners.spotlight: Pulled quite hard and showed up for a long way when 17l fourth of seven in a Hexham bumper in March (2m, good to soft); should improve on that, particularly if he settles better.

runners.name: Connells Cross
runners.comment: 3,000euros yearling; half-sister to 5 winners; interesting newcomer; worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Filly by Fascinating Rock; 3,000euros yearling; half-sister to five winners, three of them on the Flat; interesting newcomer from a top yard and worth a market check.

runners.name: Lutte Allen
runners.comment: Beaten 42l when seventh of eight in a Hexham bumper last month; improvement needed.
runners.spotlight: Beaten 42l when seventh of eight in a Hexham bumper in April (2m, good); improvement needed.

runners.name: Zhanma Enki
runners.comment: 100,000euros 3yo by Zarak; half-sister to high-class Yala Enki; interesting newcomer
runners.spotlight: Filly by Zarak; 100,000euros 3yo; half-sister to four winners, notably high-class hurdler/chaser Yala Enki; interesting newcomer from a stable with a good record in bumpers.

2:25.race_name: Al Basti Equiworld, Dubai "City Bowl" Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
2:25.stalls: 5f & 6f - Far side ; 1m2f - Inside; 1m4f - Stands' side; 1m6f - Flag

runners.name: Salsada
runners.comment: Seen far more often over hurdles in recent years but pulled up in March on latest outing
runners.spotlight: Seen far more often over hurdles in recent years and she's pretty useful, but pulled up in March on latest outing; stiff task in a three-runner race last September and that's her only Flat run since a creditable show over C&D (good to firm) in June 2022; down the weights but not solid.

quotes.race: Chris Blanckley Birthday Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Salsada won well. At Hexham [two starts before] she ran a blinder and was beaten a short head, and then she disappointed at Wetherby for whatever reason. I brought her back here because she's won here and I just think up-and-down tracks like this suit her - Brian Ellison, trainer.

quotes.race: Victoria Jackson Animal Conservation Awareness Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: You always hope they'll do it like that and we think a lot of Salsada. She just had a problem with the stalls and she's been sent to me to go jumping. She made two mistakes and would have won by further otherwise. She's Listed class and probably wants more of a galloping track - Brian Ellison, trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs Scottish Premier Series EBF Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: We love Salsada. She's a bit enigmatic at the stalls but once she's in she couldn't care less about them and she's really getting the hang of things as a racehorse. I was really pleased, she galloped all the way to the line and she's going the right way. At some point we'll have to have a crack at some black type but that will probably be next year. In the meantime we'll let her progress and continue to learn her job. - Jedd O'Keeffe, trainer

stable_tour.quote: She's a very good mare. She ran in the Scottish Champion Hurdle last year on ground that was probably a bit too quick for her and finished fifth, which was a great run. She came back and had a chip in her joint, which we took out, and then it's been a nightmare season with niggle after niggle. She finally returned at Kelso and was disappointing, but she needs racing and then ran well to finish third at Newcastle on ground that was too heavy for her. She does want better ground. She's come out of the race well and has definitely improved a lot. The plan is to go to Hexham on April 6 and then to Ayr for the Scottish Champion Hurdle. She was second to Epatante at Doncaster last year and has always been a mare we've thought a lot of. She's working her way back there. 03-04-24

runners.name: Youthful King
runners.comment: Respectable fourth of seven at Newbury (2m) off 3lb higher on penultimate start; hood now
runners.spotlight: Has run over 1m4f and 2m but never in between and it's worth a shot; respectable fourth of seven under usual rider Jack Dace at Newbury (2m) on penultimate start came off 3lb higher and, despite a poor show on AW last time, he needs a second look in the first-time hood.

runners.name: Kotari
runners.comment: Fortunes went on the slide in the autumn; withdrawn recently when ground was good to firm
runners.spotlight: Sole run on good to firm when runner-up in 2022 in France; registered a hat-trick over 1m2f/1m4f last spring, with the second leg at this course; 2lb lower now than his last winning mark, as his fortunes went on the slide in the autumn; unraced over this far on the Flat but it's worth a go; withdrawn at Epsom recently when the ground was good to firm.

runners.name: Rapid Mission
runners.comment: Won last July (1m4f, good) on final start for Joseph O'Brien but he's not done much since
runners.spotlight: Won last July (1m4f, good) on his final start for Joseph O'Brien but he's not done much since on the Flat or over hurdles; tongue-tie added when tailed off back on Flat (1m2f, AW) in February on latest outing.

quotes.race: Conference & Banqueting Facilities At Limerick Racecourse Handicap
quotes.quote: Rapid Mission was very free in the blinkers. I had to get him to switch off but the pace was on racing down the back straight and I sneaked into it. He won snug at the line - Declan McDonogh, rider.

runners.name: Macari
runners.owner: R Vaughan, R Bisiker, M Jones And S West

prev_owners.owner: Ricki Vaughan, R Bisiker, Sheena West
Ricky Vaughan, R Bisiker, Sheena West

runners.comment: Rather in and out but his recent third at Goodwood (1m6f, good) was creditable
runners.spotlight: Won for the first time on the Flat when bolting up from the front in an amateur riders' event at Newbury (1m4f, heavy) last October off 7lb lower; rather in and out since but his recent third at Goodwood (1m6f, good) was creditable; 5lb claimer is now recruited.

runners.name: Media Mogul
runners.breeder: Forenaghts Stud Farm Ltd & Sam Mencoff
runners.comment: Winning his last two wasn't without difficulty but this staying prospect has more to give
runners.spotlight: Wore cheekpieces on last two outings and won them both; neither was without alarm, as he hung badly left when challenging at Wolverhampton (1m4f, AW) on first occasion and needed plenty of riding to oblige at 11-10 in a five-runner race at Redcar (1m6f, good to firm) on latest; however, raised just another 3lb and this staying prospect has more to give.

stable_tour.quote: He's a great big horse who's taken a long time to come to hand and is still very green. He progressed well through the winter and won over 1m4f at Wolverhampton last month in first-time cheekpieces. I hope he can keep winning and I'm sure he'll stay much further in due course. 16-04-25

runners.name: Chillhi
runners.comment: It's over a year since he accomplished anything significant; 5lb out of the handicap
runners.spotlight: Both of his wins (from 30 races) were in summer 2022; it's over a year since he accomplished anything significant and slow starts are playing a part; while he should be well down the weights, position 5lb out of the handicap takes the gloss off that.

stable_tour.quote: A nice horse who had kissing spines and has been operated on. There were a few times last year when he went to win his races and his head came up. We were wondering whether he was thinking about the game, but we found out he had severe back problems. He's back in now and working away well and should be ready to run in a month. We think a lot of him and I reckon he could be all right. 03-04-24

2:58.race_name: Wolvercroft Garden Centre Alderholt British EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race) (IRE Incentive Race)
2:58.stalls: 5f & 6f - Far side ; 1m2f - Inside; 1m4f - Stands' side; 1m6f - Flag

runners.name: Baybe Driver
runners.comment: 40,000gns yearling from a quick family; stable's 2yos already off the mark; respected
runners.spotlight: February foal; 40,000gns yearling; eighth foal; half-brother to winners Nigel Nott (5f/6f; RPR 95), Baileys Jubilation (5f 2yo; 80), Baileys Breathless (6f 2yo; 79), Baileys Liberty (7f; 71) and Connected (7f; 63); dam 5f 2yo winner and Listed class; stable's 2yos already off the mark; possibilities.

runners.name: Charlie Boyo
runners.comment: 75,000euros yearling; 1st foal out of unraced half-sister to 6f 2yo Group 1 winner Arcano
runners.spotlight: March foal; 75,000euros yearling; first foal out of an unraced half-sister to 6f 2yo Group 1 winner Arcano; trainer's newcomers always respected.

runners.name: Chilliconcarneigh
runners.comment: May get further but must be showing speed at home to be kicking off at 5f
runners.spotlight: April foal; 50,000euros yearling; sixth foal; half-brother to winners Gaiety Musical (1m/8.6f; RPR 88), Izzer (5f/5.5f including 2yo/Qatar; 81) and The Mad Monk (7f; 61); dam a maiden from family of Group 1 winners Dank (9.5f/1m2f), Eagle Mountain (1m2f) and Sulk (1m 2yo); difficult to know what his trip will be but must be showing speed at home to be kicking off at 5f.

runners.name: Comical Point
runners.comment: March foal; 140,000gns yearling; of obvious interest given pedigree/connections
runners.spotlight: March foal; 140,000gns yearling; second foal; half-brother to 6f AW winner Hello Zaman (RPR 84); dam Listed-placed 5f winner (93), half-sister to 1m/1m1f winner Cable Speed; of obvious interest given pedigree/connections.

runners.name: Ebn Sabt
runners.comment: 45,000gns yearling; third foal; closely related to 7f winner Admiral Churchill (RPR 93)
runners.spotlight: April foal; 45,000gns yearling; third foal; closely related to 7f winner Admiral Churchill (RPR 93); dam placed 1m-11.4f (70), half-sister to 6.5f 2yo winner Mottrib; market can guide.

runners.name: Hengroin
runners.comment: May need further than the minimum; stable's first 2yo runner of the season
runners.spotlight: March foal; 38,000euros yearling; sixth foal; half-brother to winners Verimli (French Listed-placed 10.5f-1m4f; RPR 102), Veydari (6f 2yo; 80) and Jumeirah Beach (Polish 1m2f Flat/2m1f jumps); dam unraced half-sister to French 1m6f/1m7f Group 2 winner Verema; may need further than the minimum; stable's first 2yo runner of the season.

runners.name: Henfield
runners.comment: First foal; dam 1m 2yo winner (RPR 69); stable doesn't have many 2yo runners
runners.spotlight: March foal; first foal; dam 1m 2yo winner (RPR 69) and half-sister to 6f 2yo/1m4f Flat and 2m4f hurdle winner Aristobulus; stable doesn't have many 2yo runners.

runners.name: Palmeira
runners.comment: First foal out of a 7f 2yo winner; looks the stable second string on jockey bookings
runners.spotlight: January foal; first foal out of a 7f 2yo winner (RPR 76) and half-sister to winners Psychedelic Funk (7f/7.4f Group 3) and Gale Force Maya (5.5f/6f Listed); looks the stable second string on jockey bookings.

4:40.race_name: Al Basti Equiworld, Dubai Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
4:40.stalls: 5f & 6f - Far side ; 1m2f - Inside; 1m4f - Stands' side; 1m6f - Flag

runners.name: Lightning Touch
runners.breeder: Newsells Park Stud & Merry Fox Stud
runners.owner: Newsells Park Stud & Merry Fox Stud
runners.comment: Long absence to overcome but shaped well behind smart horses in late 2023
runners.spotlight: 350,000gns yearling; returns from a long absence but she wasn't beaten far behind top-class fillies in two 1m events on the AW in late 2023; the market can guide as to expectations on this belated return.

runners.name: Sweet Nightingale
runners.comment: Winning hurdler but at a modest level and she's been absent since late 2022
runners.spotlight: Winning hurdler but at a modest level and she's been absent since late 2022; makes no appeal on belated Flat debut.

runners.name: Cloaks Of Gold
runners.comment: Plenty to like on paper and kicks off in a modest race; had wind surgery
runners.spotlight: Cracksman filly; ninth foal; half-sister to winners Subastar (1m 2yo; RPR 96) and Subaana (1m; 88); dam 1m winner (86), closely related to top-class miler/sire Dubawi; plenty to like on paper; had wind surgery.

runners.name: Club Class
runners.comment: Kept on well for third at Haydock and this longer trip looks sure to benefit her
runners.spotlight: Frankel filly out of high-class 1m2f performer Speedy Boarding; kept on well for third behind a surprise winner at Haydock (1m, good) and this longer trip looks sure to benefit her.

runners.name: Princess Rascal
runners.comment: Never out of last place at Ascot (1m, good to firm) but was only about 2l off the winner
runners.spotlight: Never out of last place at Ascot (1m, good to firm; 25-1) but was only about 2l off the winner and she can improve on that form; bred for this longer trip.

runners.name: Simply Ruby
runners.comment: Came under early pressure before staying on to some effect at Lingfield
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to a 1m6f/2m winner; came under early pressure before staying on to some effect at Lingfield (1m4f; 12-1), finishing 7l off the winner who was well beaten in last weekend's Oaks Trial at Lingfield.

4:03.race_name: Al Basti Equiworld, Dubai Novice Stakes (Colts & Geldings)
4:03.stalls: 5f & 6f - Far side ; 1m2f - Inside; 1m4f - Stands' side; 1m6f - Flag

runners.name: Bradshaw
runners.comment: One Flat run in France; poor form in three hurdle races for current yard
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in one French Flat start (1m6f) when with David Menuisier; poor form in three hurdle races for current yard.

runners.name: Cinderella Man
runners.comment: Value dropped from 78,000gns as a yearling to 1,000gns at two; best watched
runners.spotlight: Value dropped from 78,000gns as a yearling to 1,000gns at two; half-brother to 1m winner Fast Tara (RPR 97); dam unplaced 7.4f-1m3f (49); best watched on this belated debut.

runners.name: Landing Board
runners.comment: One run for former yard and sold on for 15,000gns; finished tailed off at Epsom
runners.spotlight: Had one run for Jane Chapple-Hyam and sold on for 15,000gns; 40-1 when tailed off at Epsom 23 days ago.

runners.name: Paps Of Jura
runners.comment: Dam 7f/1m winner (RPR 67); rare Flat runner for his jumps-geared stable
runners.spotlight: Third foal; dam 7f/1m winner (RPR 67), out of unraced half-sister to 1m winner Heaven Bound; rare Flat runner for his jumps-geared stable.

runners.name: Arabian Force
runners.comment: Clung on gamely at Wetherby; more needed under a penalty but he's up in trip here
runners.spotlight: Much wiser to the job in hand when always prominent at Wetherby (1m, good to firm) and clinging on gamely; more needed here with his penalty but in the right hands to progress and raised in trip.

quotes.race: Bet With The On-Course Bookmakers Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: At Kempton Arabian Force was very raw and green but he's learned plenty from then. He was a touch slow and I wanted to be on the front end so I've had to ride him quite aggressively early on which probably wasn't ideal but he needed that today to wake him up a little bit. I got a nice breather in him round the bend and had something to aim in the straight and I committed him early as he's going to stay further. He's very tough, we had a challenger on our outside but he knuckled down and, with a bit of ease in the ground and stepping up in trip, you'll see a much better horse. He's only going to progress throughout the year - Cieren Fallon, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Gladius
runners.breeder: Irish National Stud Mare Syndicate Iv
runners.owner: Qatar Bs, China Horse Club & D Howden
runners.comment: Picked up nicely to make a winning debut at Kempton and that form has worked out well
runners.spotlight: 250,000gns yearling; picked up well to make a winning debut at Kempton (1m) and the two placed horses have won since, with the third also running respectably at Listed level; looks a nice prospect.

runners.name: Spanish Train
runners.comment: Could finish only midfield at Kempton and held by Gladius on a line through the winner
runners.spotlight: 170,000euros yearling; could finish only midfield at Kempton and the winner of that race was third to Gladius the time before; this colt will need to step up plenty on that initial effort but that's feasible.

5:15.stalls: 5f & 6f - Far side ; 1m2f - Inside; 1m4f - Stands' side; 1m6f - Flag

runners.name: Yellow Card
runners.comment: Not well in under a penalty but he overcame trouble in running to win on the AW
runners.spotlight: Would have won with any luck on handicap debut at Bath (1m, good to firm) and again found plenty of trouble before getting up in the nick of time at Wolverhampton (9.4f); he's 4lb badly in here under a penalty (only raised 2lb) but looks very capable of being better than his current mark; up in trip here but he's by a Derby winner.

runners.name: Van Aert
runners.comment: 6lb rise harsh enough for narrow win on handicap debut but he was well backed
runners.spotlight: Gelded ahead of Kempton reappearance and having attracted support (1m4f; 5-4) he ran on well to lead in the dying strides; 6lb rise seems harsh enough but he's clearly turned a corner and cheekpieces are now added.

runners.name: Magic Runner
runners.comment: Her race over 9.4f last time didn't pan out too favourably; should stay this far
runners.spotlight: Beaten a head on nursery debut over 9.4f at Wolverhampton and shaped well back there a month ago in a race that didn't pan out too favourably; good chance that she'll stay this longer trip.

runners.name: Top Of Pleinmont
runners.comment: First run beyond 1m when a 4l second to a well-backed winner over this trip on the AW
runners.spotlight: His first run beyond a mile when coming from off the pace to chase home a well-backed winner over this far at Wolverhampton two months ago; beaten 4l but good chance he can take another step forward.

runners.name: Middelton
runners.breeder: W H R John And Partners
runners.comment: Could be seen in a better light off this low a mark but has a good bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Down the field in three novices at about 1m, the latest after being gelded; could be seen in a better light off this low a mark but has a good bit to prove.

1:55.race_name: Al Basti Equiworld, Dubai Apprentice Handicap (Racing Excellence - Whips To Be Carried But Not Used)
1:55.stalls: 5f & 6f - Far side ; 1m2f - Inside; 1m4f - Stands' side; 1m6f - Flag

runners.name: Clipsham La Habana
runners.comment: On a long losing run but his return to action (7f) was encouraging with a view to 6f
runners.spotlight: No win since late 2022; has dropped in the weights and his reappearance effort at Doncaster wasn't bad, especially with a view to dropping back in trip; 0-10 on turf but fully effective on fast ground.

runners.name: First Company
runners.comment: Better on AW but ran well in the corresponding race in 2023; each-way shout
runners.spotlight: In good form on AW this year but he's better on that surface and was well held back on turf at Wetherby 18 days ago; only previous visit to Salisbury saw him finish a close second in this race in 2023 though.

runners.name: Little Miss Magic
runners.comment: Didn't kick on from her winning stable debut at Bath last summer; others look safer
runners.spotlight: Made a winning stable debut at Bath last August but that wasn't a springboard to better things; handy mark but others look safer.

runners.name: Mammy
runners.comment: Low-key stable debut at Brighton last month; yard looks to hold stronger claims elsewhere
runners.spotlight: 7f AW win for Michael Bell in January; low-key stable debut at Brighton a fortnight ago; stable looks to hold stronger claims with Beau Jardine.

runners.name: Unico
runners.comment: Still seeking first win for this yard but on good mark and has talented apprentice booked
runners.spotlight: Yet to win for current stable but last season's best gives her a good chance off her reduced mark; yard out of a quiet spell now and she can leave her Kempton reappearance well behind her with a promising apprentice booked.

quotes.race: QuinnBet Acca Bonus Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Unico is probably still a little bit green and a bit on her nerves. When she got to the front she was still a bit unsure about what to do but I think she did it nicely. We've had a little downpour which has probably helped - Josie Gordon, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Thunderous Love
runners.comment: Two ready 6f wins this season; 3lb rise shouldn't prevent a bold bid for the hat-trick
runners.spotlight: She had overcome slow starts to win both her races this year, at Southwell (6f) on the first occasion and Nottingham (6f, good to firm) 16 days ago; well on top at the finish last time and a 3lb rise looks fair; solid claims in her hat-trick bid.

runners.name: Safari Dream
runners.comment: Below par back on turf latest; earlier AW efforts give him claims; no win since 2yo days
runners.spotlight: Two placed efforts on AW in the spring but he took a backward step at Haydock 19 days ago; should be well treated but he hasn't won since his 2yo days.

stable_tour.quote: He was a good two-year-old but had a foot injury which knocked his confidence a little bit but he's become well handicapped. 11-07-24

runners.name: Beau Jardine
runners.comment: Easy win in this race last year off 4lb higher; promising reappearance; high on the list
runners.spotlight: His last two wins have come over C&D, the latest in this race 12 months ago when rated 4lb higher; those wins were on soft but he's fully effective on faster ground, as when close up behind The Cola Kid here 11 days ago (first run for 203 days); talented apprentice booked; high on the list.

runners.name: The Cola Kid
runners.comment: Best run for a while when 3rd over C&D 11 days ago; needs more to end losing run
runners.spotlight: Best effort for a while when third in a C&D amateurs event 11 days ago; more will be required to end his losing run.

quotes.race: Summer Racing At Naas Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: We thought he would need the run. He was a bit sick after the run the last day (tenth at Fairyhouse at the end of May) and I'd say he's probably better fresh. He stayed at it well. There is a race for him at Fairyhouse next Sunday, a six furlong 0-70 handicap. He's a good fun horse, very honest and stays going. Every time he ran up to now there was a problem with the draw but today everything worked to plan - Michael Brown, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Formerly with Michael Browne, he is another who joined us in September. It took us a while to get his head in front, but he did win at Newcastle (6f) in March and has run very well in defeat in each of his last two runs. I have given him a little break since then, but he is still on a competitive mark. 04-05-22

3:30.stalls: 5f & 6f - Far side ; 1m2f - Inside; 1m4f - Stands' side; 1m6f - Flag

runners.name: Maury
runners.comment: Latest run was his best but it was a steadily run maiden and may prove misleading
runners.spotlight: Dropped away late on in a 7f maiden at Chelmsford four weeks ago, but that race was slowly run and the form may not be solid; more realistic assignment now handicapping but others appeal more.

runners.name: Piranha Rama
runners.comment: Won three 6f nurseries last year; gone quiet of late and visor needs to revive fortunes
runners.spotlight: Won three 6f Class 6 nurseries as a 2yo, including on fast turf; short of her best on her last three starts though and perhaps vulnerable to less-exposed rivals; visor now tried; yard also runs Rumba Bay.

runners.name: Jagetme
runners.comment: Good 3rd on last month's handicap debut (5f); can progress further and should stay 6f
runners.spotlight: Unexposed filly who showed improved form when a close third at Lingfield on her handicap debut/reappearance three weeks ago (5f, AW); should be fine over 6f and she's open to further progress.

runners.name: Rumba Bay
runners.comment: Two AW wins this year; close 4th at Nottingham latest but finished behind Dark Sorceress
runners.spotlight: Two AW wins earlier in the year (7f and 6f); solid fourth off this mark at Nottingham 16 days ago but she finished behind Dark Sorceress on that occasion.

runners.name: Prince Of Joy
runners.comment: Still has low mileage and yard in good form but two runs this year haven't been persuasive
runners.spotlight: Only beaten one rival home in two handicap runs for his new stable, failing to improve for cheekpieces at Brighton two weeks ago; yard form a positive but improvement is a must.

runners.name: Rogue Endeavour
runners.comment: No impact in handicaps thus far; starts out for new yard off a reduced mark but risky
runners.spotlight: Was handicapped on a promising debut run last May and he's struggled to make any impact in six handicap runs; starts out for a new stable (sold 2,400gns in March) off a more manageable mark but still carries risk.

runners.name: Off The Bench
runners.comment: 8lb better off with Dark Sorceress on AW run in March; not progressed but still has time
runners.spotlight: Encouraging stable debut when third to Dark Sorceress at Chelmsford in March and 8lb better off with that rival today; not quite so good twice since but stepping back up in trip will help and holds each-way claims.

runners.name: Dark Sorceress
runners.comment: Improved filly this year; conditions should suit and cheekpieces could help; contender
runners.spotlight: Looks an improved filly this year, winning at Chelmsford on her reappearance in March and showing better form when second at Nottingham a fortnight ago (6f, good to firm); the winner there was unexposed and the Topspeed figure was solid so she's set to go well again; cheekpieces now added.

runners.name: Oldbury Lad
runners.comment: No progress for handicaps the last twice; cheekpieces now added; not a solid option
runners.spotlight: Attracted support on his nursery debut last October (7f, AW) but never landed a blow; well beaten at 40-1 on his Kempton return ten days ago (7f); cheekpieces on for the first time; none too solid back on turf.

runners.name: Lilys Symphony
runners.comment: No improvement for handicapping the last twice; cheekpieces need to have a positive effect
runners.spotlight: No improvement for handicapping the last twice; cheekpieces added on her return from 11 weeks off.

runners.name: Pipkin
runners.comment: Poor form in novice runs on AW this winter; more realistic task today; bred to do better
runners.spotlight: Tailed off at massive prices in her three novice runs (6f/7f) during the winter; more realistic assignment here and her pedigree offers hope she will do better at some point.

5:10.race_name: Clonmel Racecourse Supporters Club Claiming Hurdle
5:10.going_detailed: GOOD (Watered) changing to GOOD (Good to firm in places) after Race 2 (5.45)

runners.name: Thank You Blue
runners.comment: Jennie Candlish's 1st runner at Clonmel has to be respected dropping into claiming company
runners.spotlight: Won two handicaps at 20.5f/2m on his return to hurdling before creditable third at Newcastle; below best from career-high mark at Perth three weeks ago but Jennie Candlish's first ever runner at Clonmel has to be respected dropping into claiming company.

quotes.race: JTC Pizzalicious Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Thank You Blue jumped really well. He'll probably be better over a little bit further, I was just forcing him for the last half a mile. He was good over the last two and galloped to the line - Sean Quinlan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: We managed to get this lovely big rangy horse out for one run last term in a Wincanton bumper, where he ran a smashing race in what looked like a very hot contest. That was over 1m7f, but he has plenty of stamina and we will try and get another bumper into him next, although he is still around six or seven weeks off his return. I look on him as a medium-term project as you will not really see him at his best until he is seven or eight years old. 09-11-22

runners.name: Takarengo
runners.breeder: Jas Linnane, J Moore & B Gardiner
runners.comment: 1-35 record over jumps; needed the run after lengthy break on latest; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose performer has modest 1-35 record over jumps; good effort on the back of 497-day absence when beaten 12l into sixth of 11 in course handicap hurdle over 2m1f four weeks ago; others preferred.

quotes.race: corkracecourse.ie Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Takarengo is a very good jumper but he can lose lengths at times and I'm not sure if hurdling is for him. If the owner wants to run him at Punchestown or somewhere like that then maybe we can look at that but I think the main target is the Cesarewitch, which he was third in last year. There's a few nice pots between now and then and he needs a bit of nice ground, he's not a good-to-firm ground horse. He was in real good order and today was his day to win a race over hurdles - Tom Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: idealgraphix.ie Handicap
quotes.quote: Today was all about getting him right for either next weekend or the weekend after. There's a 50 grand handicap here next weekend and there's a 100 grand one in Naas the following week. He'll get a nice little slap from the handicapper now, I suppose he's entitled to, and it'll give him a decent weight in either handicap. Then we'll think about hurdling or something. he could do anything. He could even be an Ebor horse for next year and he could go further - Tom Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Roscommon Apprentice Maiden
quotes.quote: We were fancying him coming here. A mile and a half or two miles would be no problem to him. I thought the ground would be worse than it was, they say it's heavy but I don't think it is. When the two horses ran off the bend it wasn't a help, making his own running is the last thing this lad wants. We'll try to sneak into a good handicap over a mile and six or two miles. He's too low for the Cesarewitch but the front two today came away from the rest - Ben [Coen] said they came to him twice and he pulled out more for him twice. More than likely he'll go hurdling in time, he's a big raw horse - Tom Mullins, trainer of Takarengo

runners.name: Circus Act
runners.comment: Won Down Royal handicap hurdle last month; good run on the Flat since; has her ground here
runners.spotlight: Dual-winning hurdler won Down Royal handicap (2m4f, good) last month on her first start in 230 days; solid fourth on the Flat at Sligo 11 days ago; has her ground; in the mix again.

runners.name: Cafe Con Leche
runners.owner: Anthony David Bustin & Paul Mc Kernan & Aisling Mccarthy
runners.comment: Struggled at Killarney three days ago; big chance at the weights and has run well on good
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner over timber, all on soft/heavy, the latest at Cork in December 2023; went close back there in March when runner-up at 100-1; struggled at Killarney three days ago; big chance at the weights and has run well on good.

quotes.race: Follow Limerick Racecourse On Facebook Hurdle
quotes.quote: Cafe Con Leche has got a lot stronger and he is more effective in a finish now than he used to be. He's an improver, he's developing, and it was probably a blessing in disguise that he didn't get into the Boodles - Denis Hogan, trainer/rider

quotes.race: Rosegreen Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Cafe Con Leche just followed the favourite before that one just stopped. He was rated to win this. He's quite versatile as to ground. We might just take our time with him for now - Denis Hogan, trainer-rider

runners.name: Falcon Park
runners.comment: Denied in hat-trick bid in January; struggled in 2 starts for this yard; best form on soft
runners.spotlight: Relished a return to hurdles this season and only narrowly denied in hat-trick bid for Paul Hennessy at Gowran in January; struggled first two starts for this yard; best form on softer.

quotes.race: Lisronagh Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Falcon Park is just in good humour at the moment. I've no idea why he's hitting form but he's always shown more at home than he showed at the racecourse - Paul Hennessy, trainer.

runners.name: Mephisto
runners.comment: Dual-purpose performer is 0-16 over jumps; last win was on the AW at Dundalk in March 2023
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose performer is 0-16 over jumps; last win was on the AW at Dundalk in March 2023; has a tough task on these terms.

runners.name: The Mass Path
runners.comment: Placed in three of his 15 starts over hurdles; visored; market will reveal expectations
runners.spotlight: Placed in three of his 15 starts over hurdles and was third in 2m4f beginners' chase here last summer; remote sixth of 17 at Limerick last month; visored; market will reveal expectations.

runners.name: Dinamine
runners.comment: Won at Gowran; 49-rated Flat performer disappointed in 2 hurdle outings; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark on the Flat at the 35th attempt making stable/seasonal debut when winning at Gowran (7f, heavy) last month; 49-rated Flat performer disappointed in two hurdle outings; others preferred.

runners.name: Rockview Roman
runners.comment: Three-time Flat winner; yet to shine over hurdles; hard to make a strong case for him
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner; yet to shine over hurdles (0-9), well beaten in Wexford handicap when last seen in October; hard to make a strong case for him.

quotes.race: Crowne Plaza Leading Jockey & Trainer Championship Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: We knew he had a race in him off that mark but the draw was putting me off and it was his first time on the surface. He's run at a mile and three but hadn't shown anything before either, so there were unknowns heading into tonight, although we knew he had ability. He had a very bad accident as a two-year-old around this time last year. He got a very bad cut and we nearly lost him, that's why he was off the track for so long. Hopefully he'll make up for lost time now - John McConnell, trainer of Rockview Roman

runners.name: Voice Of Reason
runners.comment: No show in Down Royal handicap on latest; tailed off in three past claimers; hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Flat winner for Ger Lyons; record of 0-18 over hurdles; never a factor in Down Royal handicap on latest; tailed off in three past claimers; hard to fancy.

5:45.race_name: Aisling Kennedy Memorial (C & G) Maiden Hurdle
5:45.going_detailed: GOOD (Watered) changing to GOOD (Good to firm in places) after Race 2 (5.45)

runners.name: Polemon
runners.comment: C&D second last month standout run over hurdles; place claims
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner on a sound surface last year; not as effective a hurdler (0-6), standout effort when second to a 10l winner in C&D maiden last month; stiff task on Flat latest; place claims back in maiden company but no easy task conceding weight.

runners.name: Berkshire Echo
runners.comment: Dropped out quickly on recent Punchestown hurdles debut; can only be watched for now
runners.spotlight: Berkshire gelding is a fourth foal; dam unraced half-sister to high-class 2m-2m4f hurdler Jazz Messenger; 66-1, dropped out quickly on recent Punchestown hurdles debut; can only be watched for now.

runners.name: Bright Lad
runners.comment: Modest form in bumpers/maidens at huge odds; no appeal on first run since September 2023
runners.spotlight: Modest form in bumpers/maidens at huge odds; no appeal on first run since September 2023.

runners.name: Fancy A Tipple
runners.comment: Half-brother to hurdles winner Roccos Inspiration; always behind on Cork debut 5 days ago
runners.spotlight: Youmzain half-brother to 2m hurdle winner Roccos Inspiration; dam unraced sister to 3m/3m1f hurdle winner Knighton Lad and 2m/2m1f hurdle winner Curvacious; always behind on Cork debut five days ago; best watched.

runners.name: Irinas Path
runners.comment: Form on good and soft last summer; keen and din't stay this trip at Sligo on Tuesday
runners.spotlight: Runner-up last summer in maidens at Kilbeggan (2m, good) and Roscommon (2m4f, yielding to soft); keen and didn't get home on comeback run at Sligo (2m4f) on Tuesday.

runners.name: Keep Kool Coko
runners.comment: Career-best on latest in 2m4f Punchestown auction series final; the one to beat
runners.spotlight: Twice placed in maidens last year and again when chasing home an easy winner over 2m6f at Tramore last month (yielding); career-best sixth of 15 on latest in valuable 2m4f Punchestown auction series final and looks the one to beat back in maiden company.

runners.name: My Boy Christy
runners.comment: Huge odds and ran accordingly in good-class maidens at Naas and Leopardstown; best watched
runners.spotlight: Huge odds and ran accordingly in good-class maidens at Naas and Leopardstown last term; best watched.

runners.name: The Gooses Acre
runners.comment: Mild promise in bumpers last month but much more likely needed here on hurdles debut
runners.spotlight: Sent off at big prices in all three bumpers, showing some promise last month at Limerick and Cork; much more required here on hurdles debut.

runners.name: Trasna Na Pairce

prev_owners.owner: Mrs D P Magnier & Mrs Veronica Sherwood

runners.comment: Recent Kilbeggan third over this trip makes him a big player
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner last October was later runner-up in a Fairyhouse bumper for Pat Doyle; nice step forward on second attempt hurdling when close to much of pace in finishing third in 2m4f Kilbeggan maiden last month (yielding); big player.

6:18.race_name: Tote Never Beaten By SP Handicap Hurdle
6:18.going_detailed: GOOD (Watered) changing to GOOD (Good to firm in places) after Race 2 (5.45)

runners.name: Oakley
runners.breeder: Dr A Bolte U Dr H H Leimbach
runners.owner: Mrs P Crampton & Oliver Crampton & Djcc Investments Limited

prev_owners.owner: Mrs P Crampton & O Crampton & D A Cloudsdale & J Crampton
Mrs P Crampton & O Crampton & D A Cloudsdale & J Crampton

runners.comment: Third twice of late over 2m; should stay this far; contender raised 1lb in weights
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner is yet to score over hurdles but two fine runs in defeat when third at Leopardstown and Fairyhouse of late over 2m; should stay this far; contender raised 1lb in weights.

runners.name: Sharetheknowledge
runners.comment: Returned from absence with clear 2nd here under top weight, having forced pace; same mark
runners.spotlight: Maiden is 0-7 but finished second in Thurles maiden last season (2m, soft) and returned from 230-day absence with clear second here (18.5f, good) under top weight, having forced pace; mark unchanged; tongue-tied.

runners.name: Silas Marner
runners.comment: 0-18 under rules; went close in couple of bumpers; needs to bounce back from Flat flop
runners.spotlight: 0-18 under rules; went close in a couple of bumpers a few years ago; form of Fairyhouse fourth in January offers hope but needs to bounce back from tame Flat effort on latest.

runners.name: Kingdom Calling
runners.comment: Step back in right direction at Limerick; could be dangerous off tumbling mark up in trip
runners.spotlight: Shock 250-1 maiden hurdle winner at Listowel (2m, soft) last September; fair way below that level since but step back in right direction when remote third of six at Limerick last month; could be dangerous off tumbling mark upped in trip.

quotes.race: John Lynch Memorial Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I'm delighted as Kingdom Calling had been making a fool out of me last year and is a lovely horse going forward and I think he will improve. We thought he was a bumper horse last year but he was running too keen and was petering out at the back-end of his races. The last day in Tramore, Philip Enright got him to relax, to breathe and do everything right but he thought mentally he was still childish - Eoin McCarthy, trainer.

runners.name: Workforadime
runners.comment: Never a factor in 5 starts late last year; first start for new yard after leaving Byrnes
runners.spotlight: Never a factor in five starts late last year; well-backed into favourite when well beaten at Fairyhouse in November; first start for new yard after leaving Charles Byrnes; best watched.

runners.name: Love Like This
runners.comment: Maiden after 24 starts; runner-up at Ballinrobe last month; disappointing favourite latest
runners.spotlight: Maiden after 24 starts but running well enough at times mixing hurdles and fences, notably when runner-up at Ballinrobe over timber (21.5f, good) last month; disappointing favourite on latest at Down Royal.

runners.name: Isthereonemoreinme
runners.comment: Jumping issues have been evident in all five starts; nothing to suggest he can feature
runners.spotlight: Jumping issues have been evident in all five starts over hurdles; nothing to suggest he can feature on return from a break; passed over.

runners.name: Truly Elegant
runners.comment: Backward step at Fairyhouse; absence to overcome but monitor the betting on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Fair bumper form; wasn't disgraced in first two hurdle starts but took a backward step at Fairyhouse in October; absence to overcome but monitor the betting on handicap debut.

runners.name: Adaliz
runners.comment: Never a factor on handicap debut; her half-brother is the talented Adagio; not discounted
runners.spotlight: Not much promise in trio of maiden hurdles at 2m on testing ground; never a factor on handicap debut at Bellewstown; her half-brother is the talented Adagio so still not discounted in first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Karloss
runners.comment: Improved to land gamble at Sedgefield on British debut; back in Ireland now after absence
runners.spotlight: Improved sharply to land a gamble at Sedgefield (2m1f, good) on British debut after five runs in Ireland; rounded off that spell with solid fourth of 17 at Doncaster (16.5f, good); market will guide on return from 473-day absence on first start for new Irish stable.

runners.name: Makfils
runners.comment: Well-backed at Limerick when reluctant to race and slowly away; headgear combination tried
runners.spotlight: 1-27 over hurdles, that win coming for Peter Fahey at Punchestown (2m, good to yielding) last May off 92; no impact first two runs for this yard but well-backed last time at Limerick when reluctant to race and slowly away; headgear combination tried now.

quotes.race: Summer In Town 8th & 9th June Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Makfils was off a low mark today and was good after a break. He travelled well, never missed a beat jumping and he loved the ground - Jake Coen, rider.

runners.name: Bite That
runners.owner: Mrs Patrick J Flynn & Gavin Omahoney
runners.comment: Emphatic 8l chase win at Wexford in March; can race from 16lb lower hurdles mark here
runners.spotlight: Achieved a sequence of four seconds in handicap chases last autumn; went one better with emphatic 8l win at Wexford in March; good effort upped in trip here on latest; can race from 16lb lower hurdles mark here; player.

runners.name: Hero In The Sky
runners.comment: Win and runner-up in point-to-points but never a factor in five rules starts
runners.spotlight: Poor form first four rules starts before win and runner-up in point-to-points; never a factor here over 2m1f on handicap debut four weeks ago; risky proposition.

runners.name: Lacken Forest
runners.comment: Never involved in three handicaps; only positive is the booking of champion conditional
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in maidens at long odds; never involved in three handicaps to date; only positive is the booking of champion conditional Tiernan Power Roche.

runners.name: Padraics Choice
runners.comment: Won over fences for Shark Hanlon; 595-day absence to overcome; first run for new yard
runners.spotlight: Came back from break to win handicap chase at Downpatrick (2m3f, good) in August 2023 for Shark Hanlon; 595-day absence to overcome here on first start for Pat Foley; tongue-tied.

quotes.race: Dennison JCB Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Padraic's Choice had plenty of ability, it's just a matter of getting it out of him. Jody gave him a peach of a ride. He's not the most straightforward but when he gets his own way he jumps brilliant - Shark Hanlon, trainer.

runners.name: The Border Boy
runners.comment: Hopes hinge on a break doing him some good but is at least well handicapped
runners.spotlight: Solid fifth at Tramore (21.5f) last May off 86 but regressive since; hopes hinge on a break doing him some good but is at least well handicapped.

runners.name: Boston Bongo
runners.comment: Long way below his best this term; headgear combination now for new yard; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; ended last season with a runner-up finish at Limerick (2m, heavy) off 2lb higher; long way below his best this term; headgear combination now; first start for new stable.

runners.name: Big Dispute
runners.comment: Career-best effort when runner-up in Killarney maiden on Monday; player; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; career-best effort when runner-up in Killarney maiden on Monday; player if he gets a run.

runners.name: Weather Alert
runners.comment: Jumping errors costly when fourth here in March (well-backed); not discounted; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; jumping errors proved costly when fourth here in March (well-backed); not discounted.

6:48.going_detailed: GOOD (Watered) changing to GOOD (Good to firm in places) after Race 2 (5.45)

runners.name: Answering
runners.comment: In poor form over fences; return to hurdling needs to spark a revival; ground a concern
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner at Thurles (2m, heavy); latecomer to chasing when never a factor in pair of beginners' at this track; return to hurdling needs to spark a revival; ground a concern.

runners.name: Duke Otto
runners.comment: Wexford winner may not have much in hand from his new mark but in the mix for the places
runners.spotlight: Gained a first win since 2023 with narrow success off 97 at Wexford (2m, good to yielding) in March; poor run on the Flat on latest; may not have much in hand from his new mark but in the mix for the places.

runners.name: Qaasid
runners.owner: Four Fools & A Fast Horse Syndicate
runners.comment: Hasn't translated Flat ability to this sphere but could be of interest now handicapping
runners.spotlight: Five-time Flat winner in Britain and rated 91; hasn't translated that ability to this sphere but could be of interest now handicapping off lenient mark for in-form Shark Hanlon; enjoys a sound surface; considered.

stable_tour.quote: He is a Shadwell-bred gelding and although he's only got his head in front twice he has run consistently well and is a hard horse to criticise as he tries every time. He's in the same bracket as Dingle in that he will be a good all-weather horse this winter - all of his wins have been on the all-weather. He'll be ready to resume again in December and hopefully give us a lot of fun. 06-09-23

runners.name: Walk Away Harry
runners.comment: Fourth at Fairyhouse on penultimate; disappointed here on latest; new headgear combination
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner; has run with promise in a couple of starts for this yard, including when fourth at Fairyhouse on penultimate run; disappointed here on latest; new headgear combination tried.

quotes.race: Avison Young INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Walk Away Harry had a great run the last day in Clonmel, but we were a bit concerned the ground today wasn't soft enough for him. The trip helped and he got a brilliant ride - Charles Byrnes, trainer.

runners.name: Story Rory
runners.comment: Shown nothing in six runs since handicap hurdle success at Tramore (2m6f) in 2023
runners.spotlight: Shown nothing in six runs since handicap hurdle success at Tramore (2m6f) in 2023; best watched for now; headgear combination.

runners.name: Colleen Danu
runners.comment: Gowran win in November; disappointed on soft at Cork; big chance back on good here
runners.spotlight: Has progressed since joining this yard, building on eyecatching stable debut sixth of 18 at Gowran when winning there (2m4f, yielding) off 95 in November; failed to back that up in big-field Cork handicap next time but remains of interest back on better ground; tongue-tied.

runners.name: Order Of The Dance
runners.comment: Best work at finish when second at Kilbeggan; step up in trip likely to suit; cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 5yo never featured in three maiden hurdles; much-improved effort on handicap debut when runner-up at Kilbeggan (15.5f, good to yielding) three weeks ago; best work at the finish on that occasion so step up in trip likely to suit; cheekpieces.

runners.name: Mega Speculator
runners.comment: Ordinary form; best of five maiden hurdle runs yielded fifth place at Thurles in March
runners.spotlight: Ordinary form; best of five maiden hurdle runs yielded fifth place at Thurles in March; non-runner 6.20 Tipperary on Wednesday.

runners.name: Zolpharine
runners.comment: Maiden winner in 2023; well treated on pick of hurdles form but comes with risks attached
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner at Kilbeggan (2m, good to yielding) in 2023; modest chase form, falling here over 2m7f last time; well treated on pick of hurdles form but comes with risks attached.

runners.name: Jekiki
runners.comment: 0-9 for Jessica Harrington; beaten out of sight first 2 starts for this yard; passed over
runners.spotlight: 0-9 for Jessica Harrington; beaten out of sight first two starts for this yard; readily passed over.

runners.name: Chapter Thirty
runners.comment: Tailed off twice since Killarney fourth, inc' on handicap bow here four weeks ago; hooded
runners.spotlight: Minor signs of ability when fourth of eight in Killarney mares' maiden in October; tailed off twice since, including on handicap debut here four weeks ago; hooded.

runners.name: Spellacys Cross
runners.owner: James M Barcoe & J F Oneill
runners.comment: Narrowly denied here chasing in February; ordinary form over hurdles but in the mix
runners.spotlight: Made bright start over fences when third at Fairyhouse and narrowly denied here (2m7f, heavy) in February; jumping errors when pulled up at Limerick (sent off favourite); ordinary form over hurdles but in the mix.

7:18.race_name: Clonmel Racecourse Supporters Club Mares Maiden Hurdle
7:18.going_detailed: GOOD (Watered) changing to GOOD (Good to firm in places) after Race 2 (5.45)

runners.name: Keilah
runners.comment: Seventh of 21 at Navan in November (Belle The Tigress fifth); off since so might need this
runners.spotlight: Off the mark on the Flat at Punchestown (1m1f, good) last September; satisfactory hurdles debut when seventh of 21 at Navan in November (Belle The Tigress fifth); off since so might need this.

quotes.race: William Hill Proper Betting Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Keilah was just nabbed on the line in Navan. She tries every time. I thought Nathan gave her a lovely ride there, a very patient ride. She quickened up and put it to bed quick - Willie McCreery, trainer.

runners.name: Moonlit Mist

prev_owners.owner: Mrs M V Magnier & Mrs Paul Shanahan

runners.comment: Won on the Flat last May; runner-up here in September; contender on hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: 2-12 on the Flat and rated 77; made winning start for current yard in Fairyhouse handicap (1m2f, good) last May; rounded off campaign with runner-up here (9.5f) in September; each-way contender if she takes to hurdling.

runners.name: Arctic Flame
runners.comment: Remote fourth of 15 in course bumper four weeks ago; entitled to improve on hurdles bow
runners.spotlight: Very green when fifth in Thurles bumper on debut; ran to similar level at Leopardstown; remote fourth of 15 in course bumper four weeks ago, unable to sustain effort in front; entitled to improve on hurdles bow.

runners.name: Belle The Tigress
runners.comment: Disappointing favourite at Gowran with testing ground possibly the culprit; big player now
runners.spotlight: In front of Keilah when fifth at Navan on debut; beaten 1.75l when third at Naas (2m) next time (form has worked out); weak in the betting late on when a disappointing favourite at Gowran in January with testing ground possibly the culprit; ought to go well.

runners.name: Russellsbelle
runners.comment: Unlucky faller the last twice but a massive player here with a clear round of jumping
runners.spotlight: Looked set to get off the mark when falling at the last in Listowel maiden hurdle (2m, good to yielding) last June; another hard luck story four weeks ago when a faller two out when disputing the lead; big player with a clear round.

runners.name: East Cork Flyer
runners.comment: 4,000gns 4yo; dam point and 2m4f-3m hurdle/chase winner; best watched
runners.spotlight: 4,000gns 4yo; third foal; dam point and 2m4f-3m hurdle/chase winner, out of 2m4f-3m1f hunter chase winner; best watched.

runners.name: Kick On Nellie
runners.comment: Decent staying pedigree but jumped abysmally when tailed off on debut at Limerick
runners.spotlight: Decent staying pedigree but jumped abysmally when completely tailed off on debut at Limerick last month; can't recommend.

runners.name: Rhythm Of Life
runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges
runners.comment: Fourth of 11 at Limerick (2m, good) last month; hails from top yard; can improve again
runners.spotlight: Finished fifth on her hurdles debut at Navan (2m, heavy); improved effort when fourth of 11 at Limerick (2m, good) last month; hails from top yard; entitled to improve again.

runners.name: Small Bucks
runners.comment: Flat maiden; wasn't disgraced in midfield at Down Royal 10 days ago but up against it
runners.spotlight: Modest Flat maiden was pulled up early after saddle slipped on hurdles debut at Naas; wasn't disgraced in midfield at Down Royal 10 days ago but looks up against it.

runners.name: Tiffany Mae
runners.comment: 0-11 on the Flat and rated 50; two poor runs for this yard; can't recommend on hurdles bow
runners.spotlight: 0-11 on the Flat and rated 50; showed only glimpses of ability for Jessica Harrington but two poor runs for this yard; impossible to recommend on hurdles bow.

runners.name: Vangaway
runners.comment: Yard had 20-1 maiden hurdle winner at Down Royal this month; champion conditional booked
runners.spotlight: Closely related to point and 2m1f/2m4f hurdle winner Ocean Drifter, half-sister to bumper winner Driftwood Bounty; yard had 20-1 maiden hurdle winner at Down Royal this month; market watch advised with champion conditional booked to ride.

7:48.race_name: Tote Guarantee Available On Course & Tote.ie Handicap Hurdle
7:48.going_detailed: GOOD (Watered) changing to GOOD (Good to firm in places) after Race 2 (5.45)

runners.name: Glenashling
runners.comment: Excuses on recent handicap debut; remains capable of better and drops in class here
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 6yo off the mark at fourth attempt in 2m1f Down Royal maiden in March (better ground, first-time hood) courtesy of the stewards having been impeded run-in; reportedly lost a shoe (and blowing hard) when well held on handicap debut against some seasoned rivals at Ballinrobe but remains capable of better and drops in class here.

runners.name: Bayrann
runners.comment: Underwhelming so far in handicaps; bit to prove now
runners.spotlight: Thurles maiden win last term came on good ground; disappointing twice since on easier ground at Punchestown, latest when dropping away quickly after forcing much of pace early this month in handicap; bit to prove now.

runners.name: Miss Gherkin
runners.comment: In handicapper's grasp last winter, seemingly remains so on first start for new yard
runners.spotlight: Handicap wins over this trip came at Leopardstown and Tramore over a year ago; looked in handicapper's grasp over the winter and returns from a short break for new yard here.

runners.name: Mountain Port
runners.comment: Shock Tramore maiden winner has struggled so far in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Shock (150-1) winner of 2m Tramore maiden last summer for Kieran Purcell but two poor runs since in handicaps, latest early this month on yard debut; probably still too high in the handicap.

quotes.race: Michael Griffin Auctioneers Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Mountain Port always worked well but he wants real good ground. We put the cheekpieces on him to help him concentrate and he picked up smartly. He is a horse that can improve away - Paddy Cody, rider

runners.name: Kimy
runners.comment: Disappointing since big run at DRF; needs to bounce back
runners.spotlight: Tramore maiden winner last summer (good) and career-best second in valuable Leopardstown mares' handicap at DRF (soft); form since has been disappointing so needs to bounce back.

runners.name: Expound
runners.comment: Recent Ballinrobe Flat winner in good heart and could play big role on favoured ground
