runners.spotlight: Useful Flat handicapper was gaining third win in that discipline when scoring at Ballinrobe six days ago, making most under 10lb claimer and just holding on; relatively unexposed over hurdles, winning Tramore maiden last summer but didn't get home after getting worked up on handicap debut; in good heart and could play a big role here on favoured ground.

quotes.race: Peter Queally Memorial Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Expound has plenty of ability and it's good the way he can mix it between both [codes]. When he won his [Flat] maiden he made the running and Denis [Hogan, trainer] said to keep it simple, he likes to make the running and let the horses try and catch him. He was very good from the front, jumped really well and travelled and when they came to him he picked up and done it nicely in the end - Daniel King, jockey, speaking to RTV.

runners.name: Mount Frisco
runners.comment: Best on softer ground; hard to be confident in on this ground but never one to rule out
runners.spotlight: Front-runner recorded heavy-ground wins early last year in Tramore novice chase and 2m Limerick novice handicap hurdle; below best on quicker ground of late over both hurdles and fences; hard to be confident in on this ground but never one to rule out.

runners.name: Ballycashin
runners.comment: Won here a year ago (2m3f), penultimate C&D run wasn't bad; considered
runners.spotlight: Sole win came in 2m3f handicap here a year ago (yielding) off 102; comeback run here last month (behind a stablemate) was encouraging enough but took a backward step at Punchestown; remains of interest given her record here.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Ballycashin will go hurdling now even though she isn't the biggest. She is tough - Tony Mullins, trainer.

runners.name: Fascinating Shadow

prev_owners.owner: Townley Hall Bloodstock And D J Cox

runners.comment: No turf win since 2021, promise on seasonal return, not discounted, due to run on Thursday
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose; 1-11 on turf but that win came in 2021; shaped well on seasonal return at Cork (1m4f, soft) last month and quicker ground is fine; not discounted; declared to run at Clonmel on Thursday.

quotes.race: Sign Up To Our Newsletter Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I think Fascinating Shadow is a nice horse. He does everything right for me at home. We went to Dundalk with him, my first runner there in eight years, but I went up with him, and ever since he scored there the plan was to come here. He probably want nearly faster ground than that, but he'll be a nice novice horse for the year - Shark Hanlon, trainer.

8:18.going_detailed: GOOD (Watered) changing to GOOD (Good to firm in places) after Race 2 (5.45)

runners.name: Ballyredinkingston
runners.comment: Third in slowly-run Killarney contest on Monday; this looks a stronger race
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a point-to-point and has fared creditably in both bumpers, here in March and when third in slowly-run Killarney contest on Monday; place claims again.

runners.name: Ballyteigue Bay
runners.comment: Out of half-sister to Azertyuiop; market best guide but likely to be all the better for it
runners.spotlight: Order Of St George 5yo cost 31,000euros as a 3yo; half-brother to four winners in France inc Devona (2m2f hurdle) and Vaheoz (2m3f-2m5f hurdle/chase); dam unraced half-sister to top-class 2m chaser Azertyuiop; market best guide but likely to be all the better for the run.

runners.name: Mustang Mozzie
runners.comment: Couple of fair efforts in bumpers last term and bred to appreciate decent ground
runners.spotlight: Couple of fair efforts in bumpers last term, at Navan and when midfield at Leopardstown; by Kalanisi and out of a Definite Article mare so bred to appreciate decent ground and drops in class here.

runners.name: Townscupsixtythree
runners.comment: 7yo an unlikely one to make an immediate impact on belated debut
runners.spotlight: Valirann half-brother to winners Clearly Capable (point and 2m2f-2m5f hurdle) and Corner Me Eye (point); dam unraced half-sister to bumper and 2m/2m4f hurdle winner Random Native; unlikely one to make an immediate impact on belated debut.

runners.name: Morning Mayhem
runners.comment: Half-brother to a bumper winner; market best guide
runners.spotlight: Dragon Dancer 4yo cost 13,000euros as a 3yo; half-brother to winners Ruby Island (bumper and 2m/2m5f hurdle) and Creating Havoc (point); dam unraced half-sister to useful bumper/2m2f hurdle/2m6f chase winner Raven's Run; debutant 4yo probably all the better for the experience but worth a market check.

runners.name: Mystical Madness
runners.comment: Pulled up for Thomas Byrne in Lingstown point' in March; best watched on rules debut
runners.spotlight: Axxos gelding cost 7,500euros as a foal; third foal; dam unraced half-sister to 2m4f-3m4f hurdle/chase winner Riverside City; pulled up on debut for Thomas Byrne in Lingstown maiden point-to-point in March; best watched on rules debut.

runners.name: Carsons Dreamboat
runners.comment: Tailed off when unfancied on hurdles debut early last year; top yard so still respected
runners.spotlight: My Dream Boat mare; dam bumper and 2m4f hurdle/useful 3m1f chase winner; none too fluent, tailed off on debut early last year in Navan maiden hurdle won by a better-fancied stablemate; from top yard so has to be respected on switch to bumper in what looks a modest enough contest.

runners.name: Dancing Dame
runners.comment: Form pick on three placed efforts; handles good ground, lack of a recent run a negative
runners.spotlight: Placed in three of her seven bumpers, at Killarney, Listowel in 2023 and more recently when chasing home a clear winner at Wexford last October; out of depth in Listed bumper following month but has to be of interest dropped in class here and goes on this ground, although lack of a recent run a concern.

runners.name: Biddy Early
runners.comment: 4yo for whom market best guide on debut
runners.spotlight: Idaho 4yo is fourth foal of a French 1m4f winner, half-sister to winners Free Handshake (2m6f hurdle) and Gracious (French 1m4f-1m6f Flat and 2m-2m3f hurdle/chase); market best guide on debut.

3:38.race_name: Prix de la Michodiere (Maiden) (Unraced 3yo Fillies) (Moyenne Course) (Turf)

runners.name: Velikaya
runners.breeder: Haras De S A Aga Khan Scea

runners.name: Spangled Star
runners.breeder: Sca Elevage De Tourgeville, Mme H Erculiani Et Al
runners.owner: Stars Of Fortune, Ecurie Jml Racing & C & Y Lerner

runners.name: Shiribetsu
runners.breeder: Ecurie Haras De Saint Vincent, Haras Du Saubouas & Abf

runners.name: Motu Proprio
runners.owner: Beaumelles Racing, Blu Racing Et Al

runners.name: Yoga Master
runners.breeder: Broadhurst Agency, Haras D'Etreham & Haras Du Saubouas

runners.name: Grecian Comet
runners.breeder: Scea Marmion Vauville & Mme C Kairis
runners.owner: Mme Catherine Kairis & Tolmi Racing Sc

6:33.race_name: Prix de Pontarme (Listed Race) (3yo) (New Course: 2nd Post) (Turf)

quotes.race: Juddmonte British EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands A, B, C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Diego Ventura shouldn't really have won given the way things unfolded. He had to make up a lot of ground and I had to switch him out to the middle of the track to get a clear run. We then got a bit of a bump from the second, but the fact he has won giving weight away has to be positive - James Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Diego Ventura is one we liked. He goes very well at home and he was still a bit green here. We'll take him home and make a plan - Gavin Cromwell, trainer
